wBPHb5oKFQXlm7GH1__j7A.text: Amazing food.  Very authentic.  The best Korean bbq place I've been to in my life.  (And I've been to many!) Great customer service.  Fun and fresh setting.

BlLetjMVQa5LwXu8S6DgFQ.text: It has been my 4th time here and they never disappoint with the food and excellent service! Figured they deserved a review for being consistently good!! Beef combo is a must try!!

JNDFdfSlCEkYKPe5XAetig.text: Great service!!! Our waitress NaNa is awesome!!! She's super attentive and friendly  we had a beef combo and pork combo for 6 peoples. Everything is perfect!!! Highly recommended!

AjmbquvFg_XX4ZxOg0U2VA.text: A must try Korean bbq in las vegas. We got the beef combo and it was superb. The meat was tender and delicious. They also have great choices for appetizers. Friendly staff and good service. I will definitely comeback!

D8nkxlK9UmEuCfaI5IMfpA.text: Unbelievable good.  Great staff. A breath of fresh air for Las Vegas.  If you don't check this place out.  YOUR MISSING OUT !!!

rAY1ILNwS5kzR84XzOjIsg.text: Came here on July 4. Not too long of a wait. First time here from San Diego.  Staff was excellent! Friendly, attentive, and explained everything.  Food was outstanding.  Better than any other Korean BBQ we tried. Open atmosphere, nice decor, and nice open tables with the grill. Like that they cook for you. Marinated strip steak my favorite but all food was good. Sides were excellent and they didn't hesitate to bring more. If that wasn't enough we also got dessert.  A big crunchy cookie with your choice of ice cream. I will be back for sure every time I am in vegas!

rR2f9AXbTwZY75IxfsNG2w.text: You get what you pay for! At first impression, it seems expensive but for the quality of service and Black Angus meat that you are getting, it evens out. I went around 9PM on a Friday night and almost every table was occupied. We were seated within 10 minutes and the servers were so attentive. I didn't have to flag down a server for more banchan/side dishes or ask multiple times, they radio it over to someone who is able to complete the request and it dishes are refilled quickly and efficiently. The plus side of someone else cooking for you, is seemingly less residual "meat smell/smoke" lingering on your clothes. Our server explained each meat and the best sauce/dip that would pair with it. I love that the meats are delicious non marinated but the marinated meats aren't too overwhelming or overly seasoned (too sweet or salty) and they have clean flavors. I would highly recommend trying this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye! Yummm. Cheese dip to pair with grilled Korean sweet potato/yam

0aYHFsaKZtRr34HFllixtw.text: Second time to Hobak. Superior quality meets and fun environment. The servers do the cooking which is not the norm and part of my issue    The one thing it lacks is the substantial assortment of sides you will find at DJK or Lee's. If it had the sides it would be the # 1 KBBQ without question. Sides such as steamed broccoli, potato salad, different kimchee, jalapenos, ect ect make the full KBBQ experience complete.

kF5FxS5e5xiTap-ILxqI8A.text: 2nd time around. Still deserved 5 star rating with excellent service, foods, and great staff! Love the free slush!

SoyTbTVbYp6cNZns_jla9w.text: Outstanding service by Nana our waitress! We ordered the Large Hobak Family Platter for four. Everyone is full and extremely happy! They changed our grill a few times and meat was cooked medium well!!! Definitely coming back here again when I'm in town!!

_G3X9k1SLyq__AZQ5TxRDQ.text: Spendy, lengthy wait, but really excellent quality and great service.  Worth it.

RHQnvVDFPpKV76JzXeR3uA.text: This place is Amazing! I think the best Koren BBQ I've been to, even though it's been a while.  And the environment is great!

s6ZFb949rAUeZKj7SeLfBw.text: Best Korean BBQ in town! Friendly staff and cute design makes for a great experience!

PTnvb80vHpQDj228lDXrLA.text: Great communication with all of the servers. Had great service throughout our dining and the food was delicious. We chose the beef selection and was able to had a great meal in what seemed like a 1960s sort of themed Korean bbq restaurant. The servers have sneeze guard masks which is very nice to have that assurance of cleanliness while they cook your food and also their communication with their walkie talkies allows for faster food service which was helpful in our meal experience. The restroom was kept fairly clean and also offered service toothbrushes and mouth wash to rid of the food odor after eating. The one complaint I had was when our pajeon was set up with the other side dishes at our table before we sat down was cold. I thought it was possibly served cold but when we asked for other rounds of side dishes it was then served hot. Also I highly recommend that you do not try their slushy machine for it isn't mixed right and tastes pretty horrible. Overall this was a great experience. The start and finish to our dining is what lost the star. 4/5 but will def come back when I visit Vegas again.

ayfnk97RtGLr8Aq61AJYsw.text: This was my first visit. I was very skeptical. But my husband swore I would Love it. When we arrived there were A LOT of people with luggage waiting to be seated. I only assumed they had an evening flight to Korea....always a good sign. We were told it would be a 30 - 40 min wait and it was.  We arrived at 6:45 on a Sat. They do have outside seating with misters and free cold slushies of some sort to drink (self serve by the reception). We had 4 people and ordered the combo 3 platter with a side of spicy rice.  OMG is was the BEST Korean BBQ I have had outside of Korea. They cook everything for you. My table liked their meat cooked less than I do and that was just fine. The desert comes with the combo and was excellent. If you are on a low carb high protein diet this is a great spot. Just don't eat the rice, etc and order more greens.  Definitely on my LIST. Just prepared to wait a bit.

z3maytd0ZI8qSftgp6XR5g.text: Excellent Food & Services !!  We 12 people ordered 3 sets of Family Combo beef and pork.  So delicious !  We were celebrating 84-year grandma birthday and had a great dinner party!! Manager handsome like Song Joong-Ki

My 4 year old especially loved the free ice cold slushy when you walk in and grandma loved the progressive twist with toothbrushes in the bathroom. lol   Food:  The marinated short ribs and skirt steak where so tender and delicious. They were severed with the loveliest side dishes and tofu soup. Nice cold beer on the tap and potatoe pancake. My whole family left feeling happy and satisfied customer especially with the 10% discount for early door meal!

C7tQaw0lZaYdyY8uqjBehA.text: This was my second time here. The first time was with my husband and we both agreed that this was the best in town. We've tried so many different places and we both agreed that the food and service here is top notch.   My high school classmate was coming to town and wanted to have korean bbq, so of course we took them here and no one was disappointed. We ordered the set menu and it comes with everything. My only suggestion is more side dishes of assorted kimchee.   I love the concept of having the taste of charcoal when you barbeque. The meat is very tender and well seasoned.   Another must try is their dessert. It's the typical green tea and red bean ice cream but with their own twist to it.

XIWLlsM78hn2upveZNavLQ.text: Server: Annabell - she was THE BEST!! I'd give her 10 stars if I could!! She cooked all of our food perfectly and was super friendly. Service was A+++!!  My friend and I came here today after a day of cigar and bourbon shopping. We were both starving!! Came in and the hostess said it was a 20 minute wait, but we got seated in 10 minutes or less.   We got the large beef combo, because we were starving!! We got brisket, boneless short rib, aged short rib, and rib eye. All of the meats melted in my mouth!! Everything was super tender and juicy.   The thinly sliced brisket with the sushi rice was so good. First time I've ever had it this way and I like it!! The ribeye was beautifully fatty and it was as juicy as could be. The boneless and aged short ribs were so so so so good. I can't express how good the short ribs are. You just have to try them and enjoy for yourself. Best KBBQ place in town hands down!!!!!   I will be back with my parents for sure.

dXcs32DMWD5txTjNAKbLxw.text: This is by far my favorite place to go for Korean BBQ the quality of the meat and service and is unbeatable!!

y2lyKUfAG99hzvSM-BcDjA.text: We ordered the beef combo for two people. It was delicious, tender, and soft. It comes with steamed egg and tofu soup. Both were good. We would come back.

srWZKzPXR0i6nr_6lwJzWQ.text: We had considered going to an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ or this place and this was definitely a great choice! There were 3 couples and the girls had their own table next to the guys and that was definitely a good idea because each table ordered the family dinner combo which was enough food for us all. The best meat I tried would have to be the steak! They cook the meats one at a time and will bring you sides as you ask for them. They asked if we wanted rice closer to the end of the meal, which I thought was odd, but I didn't mind because I was already getting full from the delicious meat and side dishes. They also give you two different salads, stew, and steamed egg. There was plenty of food and everything was flavorful! I love that they had the cheese in the cup and had us try dipping the meat in there. The pull-down air vent did a great job sucking up the smoke from the grill.  After the meal, they ask if you would like green tea or vanilla ice cream- we went with green tea and it was made like a ice cream sandwich using rice crackers and had  chocolate drizzle on the inside. They were to die for!   Overall, I wish Utah had this restaurant with their urban decor and amazing food! I just want to drive 6 hours to eat here again!   Bonus: Free slushee drinks at the entrance!

The servers usually cook your meat for you which is nice because there's no guessing game as to whether your steak or seafood is done. I went for my birthday and they came out with an amazing dessert display. The wait can get long, so try to get there during early dinner or lunch time to avoid waiting too long.

mOHLpWSuhxHT9Xy0d33PXg.text: Been here many times since this place opened. Tonight's experience was obviously different. Our first serve seems like she never got any proper training and didn't care about the job. Over cooked the beef brisket, left the cheese on the side, never used the beef fat to start the cooking, and the overall service was just bad. The busser reset the table right next to me, THREW everything into a bus tub, and there was still dirty chopstick and paper on the floor. The runner presented an extra tofu soup that we never asked for and took away the steamed egg that I haven't finished.... BUT.. The server Nana showed up and checked on the table. She cooked the last course for us. She apologized for our bad experience and really made an effort to change it. This would have been a 1 star review but Nana just saved the night!

ttURvhbMxCCObS6cxj6hbA.text: Set menu is the way to go here. So many banchan, they are all delicious. Bean soup was great too. It could have been a meal by itself. I'd be great for any occasions like family dining, birthday party (oh that'd be epic!), girls night (if all of your girls are aligned with you, food loving self ;)), or even date! I thought it was so cute and considering of them to find tooth brush and mouth wash for you to use in bathroom :D

ef3X8ZmOJBKNS-FfAnf6Pg.text: Hobak is def now my favorite Korean BBQ spot in town! The atmosphere of the restaurant is really cool. It reminds me of a night market but trendy and modern. The place is super clean and organized. The customer service is so helpful. They are there to watch out for your meats and will cook the meats for you if you don't want to cook it yourself. Mind you, traditionally Korean BBQ is served all you can eat but this place is not. However, their family options was enough!  We ordered the Hobak Family Combo 3 for 2 people ($54.99). Man was that enough food!  It comes with Marinated skirt steak, Spicy angus short rib, Aged Short Ribs, and your choice of pork belly or aged pork rib. We got the pork belly. Everything was amazing and so flavorful. And the staff cooked our meat to perfection. Also, the combo comes with dessert (rice cracker with ice-cream with chocolate) Amazing... and 1 free rice per person. Additional cost for rice after that. They do also serve the traditional small plate appetizers, egg, and soup.   Will be going back soon!

3uJEJDabCUqo1hA2ItZ5aA.text: This is my first Yelp review because I just can't let you know, who are interested to try Hobak how good this place is. We came in and was told that they'll set up the table. Waited for around 5 minutes, that was a Saturday aternoon. When we get to the table I was taken aback, the table was literally set up. The bancha was already there, water, cups, together with all the things we'll use. That is good, because sometimes in some restaurants it gets awkward and inconvenient when they will start fixing you're table when you're already sitting there. Passing this and that, moving things around. So, this style is a plus for me.  Food: We ordered Family combo and premium pork belly. It was fantastic, you might think it's the same with other KBBQ, it's all bbq. But the difference here is they used coal vs the stove grilling in other KBBQ places I've been. It added flavor. The beanpaste stew was also flavorful, loved it. The kimchi is hot, good hot. Lastly, included in the combo is the rice pop ice cream, I picked green matcha. Delicious, like an ice cream sandwhich, but the shell is crispy.  Service: They were friendly, professionals. Accomodating and they cooked for us! Nice and warm people.   Place: Beautiful, I like their style. Cool, hip and modern. And check out the restrooms :) They have free toothbrushes and mouthwash.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family Combo for 3-4 but that&#39;s not all. Some were served after, it didn&#39;t fit the tray they placed next to our table.

dntv4mqHNyBXIFxJd-xnKA.text: Pretty good Korean BBQ spot to try if you're in Vegas.  I came with two friends and we decided on the small Hobak beef combo.  It comes with the option to choose different cuts of beef.  We ordered the Angus brisket and Angus rib eye and the marinated skirt steak.  All the meat was very fresh and tender and had minimal fat on it.  The beef combo also comes with all the sides and fixings to complete the K-BBQ experience.  Even though the small feeds 2 people, it was more than enough food for the three of us.  We did save room for dessert and got the strawberry ice cream sandwich and it was delicious!  Service was quick and attentive!  Two thumbs up for Hobak!

ofvDMZPXjCQ0_OAf2uqQOg.text: Went here for dinner this evening, have been here before and always loved the food. Tonight my servers were Nan & Crystal. They are both very courteous, friendly, and efficient. This has been one of the best experiences with the staff I've had. You two are awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LUFMF-iVTffC9qRf2RgGkg.text: Great friendly, hospitable service.  Well maintained and immaculate restaurant.  Staff is over-welcoming and attentive; grill service, side dish and dish replacements.  Just based off of the service they deserve a 5 Star!  Keep up the great service!  A variance of mix stocked melt in your mouth beef.  Ordered the marinated short ribs. One order consisted of two slabs.  The meat was moist, tender, and flavored perfectly.  Although, some pieces were fatty, but credit goes to the meatless bone.  Some Korean restaurants leave fat and meat on the bone, but this restaurant attempts to cut down as much meat off the bone as possible.  Accompanying the meat order is the traditional bean soup, house salad, scallion salad and steam egg.  Great, all around accompaniments.    Ice cream dessert; a traditional, but not so traditional flare.  Refreshingly cool, cookies and cream (other flavors available)ice cream, wedged between the not so traditional Buntigi and red beans.  It worked.  A definite Korean spin.

jYYRFZOvhBYEKIzmqkV9JA.text: This place was so good, the meat was juicy and well marinated ! I'm not going to lie it was kind of awkward because they cook the food for you while you just sit there and wait till it's done. None the less it was a great experience. The price wasn't bad, I got the 3-4 people combo and we got about 4 different meats along with the side dishes and ice cream at the ends. Will for sure come here again, it was my first time

T781TPD6fwqyV0qDmr7sJA.text: We have been to Hobak several times, both by ourselves and with friends.  The reviews are always the same...AWESOME.  This time we brought a friend with our family (lunch on 6/27/19.)  The beef and pork are very tasty and of very good quality every time.  That's what I like about this place.  It is very consistent.  Not only with the food, but also with the service and the servers.  Always greeted at the door, and our wait has been very short each time.  This place gets very busy, so do expect to wait for seating.  The only thing we order is the combo dishes.  For our group(s), it is always the way to go, and we have never left still hungry.  For us, the winner is Set 3.  The taste is always good, and like I mentioned, consistent every time we have been.  We especially like the salt mixture that they provide.  The side dishes are ok.  For me, meh as far as taste.  It does seem very authentic though.  The dessert, if you have room, is a great ice cream/rice krispy sandwich.  It is light and just right to finish off the meal.  We always order rice bowls and extra sides that we do like, which are all free or included with the combos.  The large runs us $103.99 plus tip.  This time, our server was Boddens.  HANDS DOWN, THE BEST TABLE COOK!  We have been coming for years, and this was the first time ever our last selection (spicy pork with the potatoes and carrots) was done to perfection.  Really, the whole meal was cooked to perfection.  I have to admit, most times the temperature of the meats are not cooked to my liking, but this time....AWESOME!  Boddens is the man!  The one kinda cool, and at the same time odd thing, is that you can brush your teeth after the meal (in the restrooms.)  Hygiene items provided.  Would definitely recommend, and will of course be back soon!

aHDHrC2wSZnWh9AUPfQn9A.text: They almost delivered a 4star meal - tried their skirt steak/rib eye/aged rib combo - first the appetizers-Korean side dishes were incredible especially the fermented bok choy & the kimchi. The steamed egg and soup were light and tasty.  Now for the heart of the matter the skirt steak was okay - the rib eye was a beautiful piece of meat by sight I could tell it was very tender and well marbled - it was sacrilege to destroy such a nice piece of meat! After scissor cut into bite size - I knew from years of cooking that the fire was too hot - flambe may he dramatic BUT the burnt oil taste ruined the meat and the experience- 3hours later I could still taste that rancid flavor. The aged ribs were tasty but overshadowed by that nasty burnt oil taste.  The  dessert of ice cream sandwich with puffed rice cracker was inspired.  The indoor fire works for birthdays was cute.  Next time I may give one more chance at lunch - hopefully you cannot mess up bulgogi

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice cracker ice  cream sandwich
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy birthday

s3X_jkCEvygMeFp2kdbhIw.text: This place is a must go!!! Of course there was a wait. We waited for about 35 mins for a table of 4. As soon as you get seated, they start putting down the side dishes and a server came over and greets you. We ordered their corn cheese, family combo #1, and grapefruit soju. Let me start by saying that family combo (small) is ALLOT of meat. They say small is enough for two but for us it served between four people! All the meats was excellent! No bad smell to the meat, meats was marinated well, and everything was so soft. Family combo came with steamed eggs, soup and ice cream for dessert. Soup was not my favorite but the steamed eggs were good. Side dishes was alright as they were not my favorite besides kimchi. I definitely love the pork belly and the spicy beef.   Corn cheese was so good! The sweetness from the corn mixed in with mozzarella cheese is perfect! Ice cream was soooo good. Too bad they didn't have green tea, vanilla will do.   Oscar was mainly our server and he did such an amazing job! But everyone who stopped by a little were just as awesome. I will definitely be back!!

MLH6kx3szsbWSjb-tT4rkg.text: The best Korean bbq outside of Korea. The complimentary ice cream sandwiches were a nice ending to a great meal.

nanC9YRHb5cgI1XOn2bY6Q.text: This place is one the best Korean BBQ places I have tried!    We had family in town and decided to try this place out, however since we had never dined here before we did not know what to expect, but in reading all the great reviews thought it would be a good first for us all.  We had the combo number three which is all the marinated meat selection, three beef and one pork cut. We were NOT disappointed.  First thing I noticed was the quality of meat was really good and let me say the taste of each meat selection was AMAZING!   My mouth is watering as I write this review.  Best of all they cook it for you and everything stays nice and hot. The banchan (side dishes) are also wonderful and as with most Korean places you can order as many of these as you please.  The grill was another impressive part of our meal. We did not come out smelling like smoke, yeah!   The service was inviting and warm! We had several different staff members at our table and all were informative and offered some of the best service with a smile!   I am looking forward to returning here again and again! Don't change a thing!

IgfTGOrF5GR7YcQkQv9OmA.text: Good spot, great food, awesome service. I was in "idontknowwhatthehelliwant" mood but I didn't want anything heavy, that I knew. I went through my yelp bookmarks like 10 times until I finally stopped on "hobak Korean BBQ". Once we got there, we were seated right away. The place got packed pretty fast, considering it's Monday, I say it's a sign of success lol we ordered marinated aged short ribs, rice, beer, coke, and whatever comes with the meat. Everything was delicious! They brought bean paste soup, steamed egg, and bunch of small apps - the usual for Korean BBQ. Quality of everything was really good - fresh and flavorful. The meat was soooooo tender, it melted in my mouth. We absolutely loved everything. The entire time, our waitress along with the other staff, checked on us to make sure we had everything we needed, we were happy with the food, which we were very much. After dinner, we ordered rice crispy ice cream - soooo delicious. The only thing that kinda left a negative mark were hostesses - both the blonde and the brunette. Unlike the rest of the staff, they were not friendly, not welcoming, never smiled, and they kept rushing us to pay our bill (which we didn't even ask for) so they could clear our table for next guests. They were snobby, I don't know what their deal is honestly. Other than that, a fantastic spot! The food and service were amazing and I know for a fact that I'll be back.  P. S. Please train your hostesses, we felt like we were being kicked out. I don't want to experience it again

xJiduYUIiZbWeaau-8-N-Q.text: If I could I would give 0 stars. My party of 10 came in around noon, the restaurant was not packed at all maybe 2 other tables of 2 people. They sat us at a BBQ table after we said we just want to each the lunch specials, which seemed to irritate them. We ordered bulgogi, the server came back and said they only have enough bulgogi til 3pm (it was 12:15) that didn't make sense. So they only got us 3 orders of bulgogi. 2 were OK the 3rd was not the correct dish. It was spicy pork belly mixed with bulgogi. We didn't order that and they would not switch it out. The managers seemed irritated we were there. The lady taking our payment even said they messed up and still did not take it off our check. With all the other better options in Las Vegas, this place should be the absolute last resort. There are plenty of other K-BBQ restaurants With better selection, atmosphere and prices than this place. Won't come back.   More info:  I ordered 2 bulgogi with no spice and 1 with spice. After they clearly brought out spicy pork belly and had the nerve to charge me for spicy pork belly after the fact.  I uploaded the receipt as proof.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The mix of Bulgogi and spicy pork I did not order and was refused to fix.
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Proof they messed up the order and wouldn&#39;t fix it.

eK_5Y1tgr1PLPeFrIaLgfw.text: I have been here twice. The inside is supposed to represent a street of Korea, kind of reminds me of a mix of Soyo and 8oz Korean Steakhouse. This is not AYCE, it's a la carte or combos. I typically get the family combo number 1. Hobak was one of the very first in Vegas where servers bbq the meat for you. So it does have the customer service and atmosphere going for it. In terms of the food let's see. I wanna say their steamed egg is vastly underrated, it has the perfect level of fluffiness. Their salad is a decent mix and their desert (looks like an green tea ice cream sandwich) is more special than most. Their meat...hmmm...I mean the pork belly and pork ribs nothing out of the ordinary. I do think their beef brisket is better than most Korean bbq joints, less frozen and prepared better. And their beef ribs has amazing quality because of the way it detached from the bone. I would come back but probably with my tourist friends who seem to be more impressed with theatrics than food lol.

_f-d2Ke5RneYADjjSPxtIA.text: Hobak, you're doing it right. I've been here at 2pm, 6pm, 8pm, and 1am. Every time, great experience, great food, and fun atmosphere! There is a wait most of time, be prepared, but it's worth it.   We once got brisket that was super fatty, told them, and they were quick to give us a brand new plate of meat. I love hobak and forever will! I had my "birthday party" here and they gave me a fun sparkler and dessert!   Thank you for rocking every single time!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PBRwvVJH8puro3BdzFRosw.text: Quality meats and attentive service. A Korean bbq place I can go to and leave without smelling like it!! They prepare and cook the meats for you on the grill so you just sit back, relax and wait.   We had three in our group and shared the small family combo for two, which was the perfect amount for us. The beef cuts were excellent, but the spicy pork texture was kind of grainy, however the flavor was good. Next time we will opt for all beef cuts. The combo comes with soup, steamed egg and a very small portion of rice which is molded into small shapes of balls like you would eat nigiri. Not too many side dishes like you would see at an ACYE but all are refillable.   Don't forget to save room for dessert! It comes with the combos and they cut it for us in 3 servings which was the perfect portion. We opted for strawberry and the texture and flavor of the ice cream sandwiched between a thin, crispy wafer and whatever spread they used was fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pOJq3Ekua7jv404584RHEA.text: The place is located on Spring Mountain before Jones westbound. Place is nice, modern, reminded me of the Southern-style BBQ joints. Tables on top of drums... nice touch. Wait staff very helpful and cooked all the dishes for us. The meats we ordered in a combination plate were brisket, skirt steak, seasoned pork jowl, and pork belly... the seasoned pork jowl was fatty and really tasty.  The combo came with soup and dessert. The food was good, no complaints but besides the pork jowl, you can get the other stuff at other Korean BBQ places. When ordered individually, it can be pricey so I recommend getting the combination plates. Their dessert was delicious with the ice cream placed between what tasted like wafers... Really good. I would come back for another meal...

I love their house salad with the dressing, I love the daikon and jalapeno! Make sure you save room for dessert if you get the family combos!  And if it's your birthday they'll celebrate it! :)

PMF2Cd_72VQndFLxIPYuqw.text: Solid KBBQ and what a delight! Staff was overall super consistent, kind, generous with their time and actually entertaining.   Food was unique and delicious, some concepts I've never seen! Truly refreshing, delicious and memorable. Can't ask for a better time!

I7inpLubLXHITRZd-DS0fw.text: OMGGGG SOOOO YUMMY!!!! Im from out of town and really wanted to eat korean BBQ and this place definitely did the job. So good and if you order a combo free ICE CREAM SANDWICHES!!! I definitely recommend it.

Dq0qaSmFsH4LPP-p06HhXw.text: First time here and the food was great and the service was quick and awesome!! Glad we tried it!

CnjywDL--lwtCgxhp8DUBQ.text: Hands down the best KBBQ in Vegas!!!! For the longest time, I didn't really like many of the KBBQ places in Vegas, until Hobak opened up! I've been going here frequently since this place first opened up, so this review is long overdue! I love everything here from the food, ambiance and customer service. If anyone asks me to recommend an Asian restaurant in Vegas, this is the spot! I've taken family here as well as friends, everyone loves it!   I always order the beef combo. I've tried all of the choices of beef but my favorites would have to be brisket, skirt steak and boneless short ribs! I love the Hobak sauce that you can use to dip your meat in. For brisket, I also love to dip mine in the cheese which might sound weird but it's so delicious! Brisket also comes with sushi rice and wasabi which was very different but it's also a must try! Their combos come with a bean paste soup, steamed egg and rice pop ice cream dessert. Not to mention the side dishes, you will leave the restaurant feeling extremely full! They also have a complimentary slushy machine by the entrance that you can enjoy while waiting for a table!   I used to go to many AYCE KBBQ since they were cheap and didn't care too much about quality. Ever since Hobak, I never return to AYCE places again! Quality makes such a huge difference and I don't think Hobak has ever let me down in their quality of meat they serve!   I have also tried some other non AYCE places out there in Vegas but I must say, none of them beat my love for Hobak. Definitely recommend anyone to come and give this place a try! The wait is always long though (since it's soooo good!), so be prepared to wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QsUmnAX-9uA3c1kUx_i6wA.text: Towers of alcohol-like really, actually. Towers of alcohol. I have never been more excited to eat, drink, and enjoy! Hobak Korean BBQ has exceptional taste in presentation, their staff's attentiveness, and making sure you are enjoying yourself. Whether you are with a large or small group-their waiters are quick to check on you, quick to help you with your selection, and truly kind! I came here with my company's boss, coworkers, and their family. They treated my coworker's daughter with such KINDNESS and adoration - I have never seen this in a restaurant before! I would be so proud of the training and attention meal presentation that goes on behind the scenes here! The food tasted incredible. I really enjoyed the ribs, I'd highly recommend getting a variety of meats though - let your taste buds enjoy EVERY kind of food this place has to offer! I can't wait to come back!

jD9nNJevt5TavQ5ktNqzUg.text: I really liked this place.   We got the Small Hobak Beef Combo. The quality of beef is extremely good. Price is amazing for the amount of food you get!  It comes with a large variety of complimentary side dishes (yay!). The steamed egg and soybean soup were great, though the soup was a bit on the salty side. The entire meal finishes off with a delicious ice cream sandwich if you get the combo.  Overall, I enjoyed the food and it was a nice change from the restaurants available on the Strip.  TIP: Get the grapefruit soju to enjoy with your meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm look at that marbling!

UCOC-kKkvGsdTOB7kyt5-w.text: I've only tried 3 Korean bbq in three places in Las Vegas but it was enough for me to know which one I like the most! Meat is fresh, soups are great (not as spicy as I wish thou) and the combos are more than enough to satisfy you, it comes with a lot of sides for you to choose. They take care of the meat so you don't have to, plus there's a whole set of things to brush your teeth in the restroom right after! It looks like a great place to have a dinner party. Try the beef combo!

p4tpngMVJd2k1ChOSNdRiA.text: DISCLAIMER: this is my first visit to a Korean barbecue restaurant, so if I seen amazed by something normal don't judge me. Thank you. Anyway, I LOVE this place. I came early for dinner, so we immediately got a table, and the appetizer/free stuff was given to us as soon as we got there. This includes kimchi, some sauces, cheese, radish soup, a pancake, salad, and probably something else that I can't remember. The other people in my party had never tried Korean barbecue either, but we decided to get the small family meal 3. It was plenty of food. The service seemed ridiculously fast, and there was never a time where you had nothing to eat. You always had something to snack on, and there was A LOT to snack on. The meat was delicious, and it was nice to have it cooked by someone else, as they know when it's done, and I didn't. You eat little bites of meat with the sides, and you have a jolly good time. Again, it was all delicious, and the only thing I didn't love was the soup, but I just don't like cucumbers all that much. The interior was crazy and silly, but very nice at the same time. All the staff was well trained and knowledgeable, and they never left you waiting for something or forgot about you. After all, if they did, you would lose the meat. After the entire meal, we spent $80, for more high quality food than I would ever expect to get for that price, and  a unique and fun experience. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat cookin on a grill

8Xct-KYLFdBIak7Yt7ZxBA.text: Legit korean BBQ with good service and a vibe that is similar to (almost copycat-like) to the Kang Ho Dong Baekjong chain of restaurants in LA, but without the corncheese and egg that is cooked with the beef juices on the side of the grill.   The combos here do come with steamed egg and bean paste stew, along with a variety of banchan and dongchimi broth.    But the real reason that this restaurant exists is to serve prime meat that is cooked on the various grilltops throughout the meal, and I have to say that Hobak has some of the finest meat in Vegas.  I think I may have to say that the quality rivals that of the top KBBQ restaurants in LA as well.  The brisket and the boneless short rib are definitely the stars of the show, with the other beef offerings taking a strong second place.  The aged pork ribs and pork jowl are also tasty, but I prefer the beefy flavor and tenderness from the parts of the cow.   I also enjoy eating the brisket with the sushi rice & wasabi that come together, just for that extra pop of sweet/sour flavor.    Ending the meal with the ice cream sandwiches makes you wish that you actually saved some room in your stomach for them, because the dessert is quite tasty.    This place gets busy REALLY quickly, and the wait can get long just as fast.  The food and the service is worth it, however, and I wouldn't hesitate to wait for a table here at Hobak.

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chadol

PWtNtdlJEohRU5OuQu5a0Q.text: Great experience at this restaurant. Service, food, and atmosphere were great. Pricey for sure, but worth an occasional splurge. Clean restaurant, friendly staff. Had a whole bunch of different meats -- would love to me more specific, but we ordered, they brought it, cooked it, served it -- awesome. Pork spare ribs, marinated beef, and beef rib segments (I think)

2hLApweRi1Vsz-1IHV-ZTw.text: A friend said that this is a MUST TRY Korean restaurant, and their suggestion was spot on.  Hobak has got to be hands down the best Koraen restaurant I've been to to date.  We got the combo for two and all the meats were super high quality.  In this restaurant, the staff actually cook the meats for you and they did a superb job.  Nothing was overcooked, everything was so juicy and delicious.  The sides were great too - we had a green onion / bean sprout salad, daikon, a cold soup, a regular green salad, a marinated bok choy dish and kim chee.  I liked that there were a lot of vegetable options.  I definitely can't wait to come back with more friends.  One note - be prepared for a wait.  We've driven by a few times before stopping in and there's always a crowd outside.

m33y6wktM1rBccm4xV1oVg.text: My favorite Korean BBQ place in Vegas. Staff is always on point and food is great. Go for the marinated skirt steak and the ice cream sandwich. You won't be sorry.

Lgw_gCcwlCD4dRdYWlb6Pg.text: I love coming here when I'm visiting from LA. The service is always to the T. The wait is decent and the food is delicious. I'm not a huge carnivore, so I never step foot in AYCE Korean BBQ places. I prefer quality over quantity- and their meat quality is worth mentioning.

_TVzSYyjXdDq-WHpEL7Epw.text: I posted an Eater article two years ago today on Facebook so I thought I would come check it out. I like the decor and the service is good. Everyone is so friendly especially Denise who checked in me several times to make sure everything was good. I had the tofu stew with pork and cold noodles with vegetables. I wanted to try the BBQ but the prices and portions are geared for more than one person. That's one reason I like the AYCE option at other places.  The tofu stew was absolutely delicious. Just the right amount of spice and very tender chunks of pork. It was the first time I had cold noodles and the taste was spot on. I loved the presentation of frozen chunks of vegetable broth that kept the noodles cold. I requested the sides as u didn't know if everyone got them or if it was just for those eating BBQ. They were all very fresh and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold noodles with vegetables and sides.
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The febreeze station outside to help with the smoke in your clothes.. I love it.
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tofu soup with pork.

CrI5eF2xTyHTU_RNLFR2sA.text: Finally! A Korean BBQ spot worth going to in Las Vegas! Reminds me of spots dispersed throughout Los Angeles Ktown. Quality of the protein here is amazing and the service is fantastic. There are various combos you can order depending on your preferences and party size, but Hobak is worth a visit if you enjoy overall quality for your buck. My boyfriend and I really love their combo with both pork and beef, but if you have other preferences, the server will walk through the menu options with you. I love their sides and they even have all the essential dips I love having with my KBBQ.   Whenever I take friends or anyone here, I always end up ordering a combo and add ons so everyone can get the full experience. Dessert is prepared for everyone by the servers as well and the place is super clean and decently ventilated.   They don't take reservations, so come early on the weekends to get your name on the list because this place is usually poppin'.

NBT_K431_nI78t9dV6CE3g.text: On our way back from ski trip to Utah, we stopped at this place for lunch, and we got our luggages stolen at the restaurant parking lot. Broad daylight. Two other Vehicles were broken into also. What employees told me is that this apparently happens often. OFTEN?! Why no security guards then?! We were able to check the surveillance footage at the manager's office. Three Asian guys in a black BMW (ugly hatchback, you know) with no license plates. Well, I'm stuck at Vegas Metro Police Station filing police report. 3rd hour....

wvFN9bPtKsjZL8KPmxeoZA.text: Absolutely amazing!!!  Good food, good service, and great hospitality!! At the moment we arrive we felt welcome and was seated almost instantly! What made the experience more entertaining was our waitress Crysta!!! She was awesome and made the whole experience amazing. She made sure we knew what everything being brought out was and was on top of everything for us. She knows what she's doing and definitely made Hobak a top tier experience. The food was cooked perfectly to how me and a friend liked it. If you are coming to Hobak, ask for Crysta!!

KC_g7sNIUSrGqC-GDdCr1A.text: Absolutely delish and a fun atmosphere at reasonable family style price. Quality of food is wonderful. My new favorite Korean BBQ of all time

The kimChi was fresh tasting and they made sure we were happy and had enough sides until satisfied.

He made sure our meet was cook perfectly.  The side dishes were very simple such as salad and Korean pickles.  The salad was ok.  That was the only thing I did not care for. sihwNoN5WhKkhmlmBNgTrQ.text: Excellent place for Korean very flavorful and each meat has a different taste! I have been to other Korean BBQ places and the meat tastes bland, here everything is very vey flavorful and delicious

bbVicq7gfkiEkATxmQSa6w.text: Great experience for sure They use premium Heritage Pork humanely raised feeding 100% fresh vegetation and to our 100% pure premium Black Angus Beef. The grilling instrument has a closed top and an open fire option for the fire grilled steak. They add real charcoal for added flavor. Both the steak and the meat marinated meat needed some extra salt for cooking. I would like to see a higher temperature on the grill to get better flavor and grill marks on my steak. They offer to cook and cut the meat for you or you can do it yourself. For the best experience, I would say do it yourself. We chose a family beef combo option. Price was reasonable. For the food part, it came out to $25 per person. It is not AYCE, but you get enough. Maybe not the best but definitely worth trying

gPrNu2VrUB86iF143ZRa4Q.text: Tried this place for the first time last night for a friend's birthday, and it was a great experience. I've always gone to other places when it comes to KBBQ, but I've gotta say that the meat here is the best. I'm so used to doing all-you-can-eat so the menu was a little daunting at first glance. However, our server Randy was very helpful with his suggestions and made the whole process quick and easy. It was weird at first with having someone else cook for us, but it turned out great because all our meats came out perfectly.

_EYDcj7Q974BxoFnFVcVnQ.text: Our favorite Korean restaurant to dine. We always order the 2 person beef combo which consists of brisket, ribeye, and short rib. The side dishes that accompany the meats are well seasoned and tasty. We ordered the spicy angus fried rice this time thru a recommended review on Yelp. It was delicious. We always eat here a la carte, instead of other Korean all you can eat places. The meat quality is high quality. We are always served by Ronnel. He is very friendly and attentive. The only short coming I would say is I called to check if they were open during a holiday weekend. The female staff member said she only works the morning, so she wasn't familiar with what time they were closing. Maybe if she took the initiative to place me on a brief hold and check, I would have been a satisfied customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MPLlnAhT5WpWpsaAfJmL4Q.text: Food is good. Meat quality is good.  Price is okay.  Service is not so great.  We waited almost an hour to get sat.  That's fine because they were busy.  However, once we got sat, it took a waitress almost 15 minutes to acknowledge us.  Even then, it was the typical "are you ready to order?" No greeting or hello whatsoever.  During service, asked for more salad. Never came. Asked for more water. Never came. After we were done, we were pretty much abandoned and they forgot about the dessert that came with our pricey combo.  Very very slow and they were not attentive at all.  I would not recommend. Vegas has a lot of other great options for Korean BBQ now.  We went out of our way to go there and it was not worth it.

8t9l0t4C_C1ynrJY2YdoJA.text: Hobak is a life changing experience.   The quality of the meats and service are top notch. Everything is mouth watering and it's also very nice that they cook for you.  I have not gone to any AYCE KBBQ since I've gone to Hobak. It's totally a different experience! I leave feeling very satisfied every time I go here!

hs2eo0K-19ymXu2_yK4XyA.text: Everytime we come to Las Vegas we stop here. The food is awesome,great service and priced very well. Servings are large and well worth the price   Atmosphere is fast,fun and exciting,waiters are on point on every aspect.   Their competitors should eat here and realize what they are not doing right !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food is so awesome here

Djp3erSSmTmH5Mwo1_XOqA.text: Love the food here!  We've been twice and both times and it can be frustrating waiting for a table as they would not take a reservation or call ahead.  The food is definitely worth the wait!  I love that they are so organized and get you in and out quickly.  The food is exceptionally fresh and it's so nice that the server actually does the cooking for you.  I'm always worried at other Korean BBQ's that I didn't cook the food all the way and I'm going to get sick but here they take all the worry out of it.  We ordered the large beef combo and added the spicy short rib and spicy angus fried rice (which is my two favorites).  For 2 adults and 2 teens it's a little on the light side so next time we'll add a 3rd extra dish.  The pork meal does come with more food but we aren't big pork eaters.   I love the bean paste soup and could eat it all myself.  We also tried the cold noodle soup.  It wasn't my favorite but our friends from Korea said it was very good and just like home.  Lastly the meal ends with the best ice cream sandwiches ever!  I suggest the mint chocolate chip or cookies and cream.   Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas and can't wait to go back again!

K7xdG8h_wOt4QZHQb0DqDA.text: Hobak is hands down the best Korean BBQ spot in Las Vegas. All the staff is attentive and give you the best experience ever! They check on the meat to make sure is cooked to your choice of temperature. Now let's talk about the meat/pork..... so good always so fresh, it makes me want to go back just thinking about it. Overall great tasty satisfying food along with great service. Must try in vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rr8J1S0cO1HGuPnF4WpdjA.text: What great place....!!! It is much better than any Korean bbq restaurants in LA...such as baekjung, parks bbq, agassi gopchang & etc I will be back definitely....i want to give 6 star if possible.

N1rqmq5zSC71EBbQ_0mh1g.text: My good friend Greg came to visit from LA, and he actually found Hobak on Yelp.  Thanks Yelpers!!!!  This restaurant is brand new (about a week old), and on the edge of Chinatown, so we would not have found this place without the Yelp reviews.  We got the beef and pork combo for 2, and everything was delicious . So. Much. Food.   The beef and pork were both very flavorful and tender, and very high quality.  I've tried at least 5 k-BBQs in Vegas, and this one is by far my favorite!!!!!  The food quality is topnotch, and the service is PHENOMENAL!!!!!  Most k-BBQ places will only cut the ribs and maybe flip the meats a few times for you, and it's mostly self-service.  At Hobak, it's table-side service 100%.  Our supa kawaii server NANA was a super star!!!! She was very knowledgeable about the menu, the food prep, and was super friendly.  She cooked and cut all of our 4 different types of meats.  This was the best service I've had in a long time  Andrea also helped us, and she was super friendly and fantastic as well.  Thanks Ladies!!!!  I'll be back next week   ************  I  Hobak, and I want to share this amazing place with everyone I know--took a different friend for late late late dinner at 12am (it's Vegas after all), and tried the all beef combo for 2.  The food and service were just as fantastic as my last review.  Let me post some more pics

8ymkI1HY_r5Ot91nG6xaEA.text: Went there with friends with small toddlers, 5 adults and 5 kids under 5 and the servers were super sweet! 0BYFW-3S-kBCfWXVzLNmWQ.text: Don't really have that much to add that all these other reviewers haven't already said but I'll reiterate my favorite things.  - This place kills all other Korean BBQ places in Las Vegas. - The service is 100% I've had Cody and Sim and both are flawless. - Fondue with my meat just works now to the point that I don't need to go anywhere else. - Walking to your table and appetizers are already there makes you feel like a King. - Grills being changed constantly also makes you feel like a king.  To the other Korean BBQ owners that are now going to have to step up their game, I say good luck! I didn't know what I was missing till I came here. Thank you soo much for opening HOBAK now I wont have to think so hard about which Korean BBQ place to go to anymore since there is only 1 perfect one in Vegas. xlKU6oZBe_uggWxrYH-xVQ.text: If Kang Ho Dong Baekjeong (my standard for all Korean BBQ places) is a 5, this place is a solid 4.5, maybe higher. I used to never go to Korean BBQ in Vegas, but now this place will be the one and only place I will go for Korean BBQ in Vegas  My boyfriend and I shared the Beef Combo for two, it was a decent amount of food and we left feeling full, but not overly stuffed. The meats were soooo tender and juicy, and they cook it for you so you don't have to worry about anything except eating. The combo came with an egg and a soup stew, both were delicious! The ice cream sandwich was really good as well - I was surprised by how light and refreshing it is for ice cream, perfect end to our meal!

nagy4Wo66GkBmihI85sU_Q.text: Every time we visit Vegas Hobak is on our list of restaurants to go to. They don't take reservations so be prepared to wait on a Friday or Saturday night. bsfwtn8SwWOLI65iuID1nA.text: I really enjoyed the experience of this dinner as much as the food.  My favorite was the spicy pork belly, which kind of surprised me.  The skirt steak was a close second, but the ribs were a little tough. Service was all around great.

s29A8cMgoKdh18jvb1cGQQ.text: Love the quality of the meat and the price is great. My favorite server is James. He takes time to explain each of the meats and how to pair them with the condiments. Having good quality food and 5 star service makes this one of my favorite place to have Korean BBQ.

yLuOG3ASLJojALjuY63yAw.text: The lunchboxes are delicious and a great amount of food for the price. The atmosphere is uplifting and has sort of a beach bar meets an industrial warehouse... my wife and I will be back to try the bbq! Oh yeah, the staff got things under control

urlPSA1SF0x4ggmgVaDfQw.text: Holy crap.  This is the first place that needs 6 stars. Hot damn.  I am blown away at the quality of meat, the impressive range of flavors and the service.    This needs to be on any foodies mandatory list.  It's a toss up between the food and the service being the best part.   They also nail the Kalbi.    Will be back for sure.!!

3-hzbKIZNP4PeHd8vYP52w.text: Just when you thought that Korean BBQ couldn't get any better, IT JUST DID! Prime quality cuts, experienced grillers, an assortment of great and flavorful sides, (which by the way, your server is more than happy to explain what they are) just makes this Korean BBQ joint stand out more than others besides the fact that the staff cooks for you. Be sure to bring friends. Parties of 6 or more will be leaving as satisfied customers. Hobak, Ho-I-will-be-bak.

vee8GlwBXLFLpNv3_nhdYw.text: real nice spice and help at the counter. Flavor and speedy service..never have to wait long...its always ready and hot when I get there. great price   reasonable  pick up so far only..it looks nice there...we just like to slop it up and use poor manners at home...

zlgFvtZp6l-0bUkrOcoA0A.text: The absolute best Korean BBQ in Vegas and maybe even better than LA! Coming from LA, I have very high standards for KBBQ since LA is known for the best, but Hobak blows a lot of restaurants out of the water. First of all they use wood chips to grill the meats so the meats are packed with flavor. The quality of the meats is top notch and you can tell by looking/eating it. They offer a lot of awesome side dishes with free refills. One of my favorite dish that I also ordered on the side was the spicy buckwheat cold noodles. They cook/cut everything for you, ready to eat. On top of that greatness, they offer you free ice cream at the end of your meal! What more can you ask for? Oh yeah, they give you a bottle of cold water on your way out into the dry desert heat! 5 STARS!

-0KGL4uLhMKCELKgc1maYw.text: I'm not a really big fan of KBBQ (mainly because I probably don't know how to cook the meats properly) but I must say this was a great experience!! Meat was juicy, tender and FLAVORFUL! The waiter/waitress help cook the meat (which makes a world of difference) The rice cake pop were delicious! Bonus: there are toothbrushes in the bathroom after your meal.

v0NfdoD0JJptKyEjj0NNlw.text: I just got back from South Korea and the food here at Hobak is 20x better than anything I actually got in Korea. It's pricy but it's understandable with the quality of meat in the restaurant. I enjoyed the fact I didn't have to cook it myself. Service was great and the staff was very knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for good Korean food off the strip.

ovNaPalqxH5OfjVd-oxqew.text: Hobak is an Amazing Korean BBQ spot!! I can say hands down this is in my top favorite places to eat, enjoy and get phenomenal customer service!! The staff is friendly, helpful and give great recommendations! The boneless short ribs are so good and the green tea ice cream is a Must!! The ambiance is great and definitely check the restroom!! They make sure you leave with great breathe!! I would recommend Hobak to anyone looking for Amazing Korean BBQ!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ywc5n4p2Fc3UDCRWh3BPOw.text: Ohh myyy goodneesss!! Best Kbbq in town by far! My friends and I went to check this place out since the reviews were really good and come to find out, what you read is what you get. This has only been open for 5-6 weeks btw.  Service- our server was CODY! He was awesome. He taught us a fun Korean drinking game of some sort. He also cooked our food and man, he was on point. I also requested for a song from BigBang and he delivered! Thanks Cody! We left tip not because it was customary but because our service was more than what we expected.  Food- to die for. We got a beef combo and an extra order of marinated skirt steak. That skirt steak was crack for us. Cody cooked it medium rare and it was perfect! Juicy and very flavorful. Their side dishes, especially the kimchee and bbq sauce made us enjoy our food even more! The green tea ice cream sandwich was bomb! They use rice cracker of some sort with chocolate and red beans! Yuuuummm!  Ambiance- reminds me of the authentic bbq places in Korea. From their grill to the contemporary decorations, they definitely set themselves above other kbbq. They have butchers in the back where you can see them get the meats ready. Bathrooms were very clean with free tooth brush and mouth wash! All kpop music too! They have a nice waiting area outside where they have water mists for clients to turn on and off.   We will definitely be back to try other dishes but the price was definitely worth it. The meats were fresh, service was fun and place was clean. Like I said, it's only 5-6 weeks old. If they keep this up then they have a bright future ahead.

iCgjBAZrXSmOBaeqWRLCgA.text: Awesome BBQ. Some of the tastiest meats and marinades. Great service and open late night! Spicy short rib is a great go to and the ice cold beer is a perfect compliment. Great for families and a late night craving.

3OYC4m0j3AA621CIq9yqtA.text: Had a difficult time finding this place at first (note to self: look past the KFC lol) since its tucked away in a nondescript plaza but once you enter through those doors---that hardly matters, really. As the place transports you almost instantly.   First things first: the atmosphere. The overall aesthetic of the place could best be described as what most trendy and upcoming Korean restos/coffee shops do best: which is an eclectic but tasteful mix of vintage and modern edge. From the string lights overhead mimicking a cute little alley way to the old school telephone booths and vintage Coca Cola machines/ads as well as the 1940s movie posters plastered haphazardly about; this place definitely does not skimp out on the little details that makes an experience one for the books.   As for the food, it isn't AYCE but the quality and the mix (we ordered the family combo) was enough to fill three people comfortably, not too much and not too little.   My favorite however would have to be the service. If not the spicy pork belly (dipped generously in that little side ceramic filled with melted cheddar cheese) and the ambiance then the service took the cake for me.   Simply Ask for Nana and thank me later. You'll see

mNR8n5kTe2dq0tUDq7xZEA.text: 4.5 stars  Me and 3 girlfriends grabbed lunch here on a Sunday afternoon. I tried calling the night before to make reservations for dinner but they only take reservations for 8 or more people. They said typically for weekend dinners, people start arriving by buses, so just be prepared to wait!  We ordered the Hobak Family combo, which comes with a combo of beef and pork. The side dishes weren't bad but I was disappointed with the salad because it wasn't the traditional Korean dressing. The bean sprouts dish mostly had green onions in it so we had to ask for a refill about 4 times. I could definitely taste the quality of the meat. The meat basically melts in your mouth. Unfortunately, rice is not included in the meal but there was more than enough food for the 4 of us! The servers were very nice and constantly checked up on us to help us cook our food.   Honestly, my favorite part of the restaurant is the atmosphere. It looks like you're eating on the streets of Korea, it's so cute! I recommend trying this place out if you want quality over quantity.

jRJoZhVz3Km7wduep2QsAw.text: This place was just ok. The Angus Ribeye was delicious, everything else was just OK. Overated. Wouldn't eat here again; service was just too slow for a Thursday night and it wasn't even busy. I'd hate to come here on a busy night. Took forever to refill my green tea; was dying of thirst all night.

IfYMhGVRExVv2QS04bkEEA.text: Me and my boyfriend found this place at yelp. Read the reviews posted and we decided to try the place. We order the Hobak beef family pack for 2. I was thinking it would be enough for both of us, but what a surprise, after the first 2 beef serving I was really full the here comes the last one which is the spicy pork. Cannot believe that it's so much food.  I will definitely recommend this place to have a good Korean bbq. The beef is really high quality, well marinated and melts in your mouth even the sides was so good. Don't forget the good service. Definitely 5 stars for my taste I have to add something and I'm sure no other restaurant will have FREE Toothbrush for costumers.... YES !!!!! FREE TOOTHBRUSH ..

ImacD2SBgqtn-5Piihj3LQ.text: Great service even better food. Marinated steak was my favorite!!! Also you HAVE TO get dessert. Amazing!!!!

rv9ws_i-9q3ac9l-a96cdA.text: Hobak is the best Kbqq in the city, and probably the west coast. You're a limp noodle if you don't come here. My boy Tai

RIHD5-X4ijwSTQBYTL9owQ.text: I have been here on 3 separate occasions. Everything about it from the entrance amenities to the bathroom mouthwash/toothbrush/paste readily for you. My only issue is that you guys don't offer anything free refills like ice tea. You can't lose anything from brewing iced tea and serving it. You guys have executed team service effectively so no reason you can't offer at least iced tea. Anyways that is why I gave 4 stars instead of the 5 you guys deserve for food. If you can change the no iced tea policy. Then I can change my 4star to 5 star in a rush!

_8JtH-Sivijm-eqRiFF_Ww.text: Came here many times for the same reason. BOMB MEAT. Like meet meat meet meat. Love every bite.   Not only is the quality and taste absolutely amazing, the service is definitely on par. They know exactly what they are doing. Especially NANA noooonaa. She has a great smile and delivers every time  My personal favorite meat? The aged short ribs. Drool drool drool   Definitely coming back!

uxNAmMc0Hc7FlAiOXKmt-Q.text: It was my bf bday decided to come here and eat dinner and we got the combo 1.. portion was over filling we had to bring some to go .. desserts are amazing .. the service and staff were great .. it's worth of the money and the quality was great .. will return back

oFqVg3_Q8fAzH8y0S2f4rg.text: WOW, was my first reaction walking into the place. It used to be an office space and was totally transformed. The interior reminded me of what I see on Korean movies/dramas. The round table stand was out of drums, which is ingenious. The exhaust on each table was adjustable, so not too much smoke, but my clothes still smelled. I like how they have gas and charcoal combined to have the real barbeque flavor.   Now to the food part. Oh my, was the first words that came out of my mouth when I had my first bite. We ordered a set menu for two, and I think it was still too much for my husband and I. would say portions was pretty decent. The skirt steak I think was the bomb!!! Dessert was something different, so I recommend it. You'll be surprised.   This place is not eat all you can. Did I mention free cold drink while waiting for a table.  Definitely will be back!!! And the service was exceptional. I hope they keep it up. I highly recommend this place.

6MzPS0ZsCToqCW8yWZ2dQQ.text: Oh man! I don't even know where to start. Food was delicious. The order for two  can probably feed four people we left with so much meat left. i love the side dishes tooAnd the Ice cream delish. I have no room for cookies & creme but I stuff half of it in my prego belly anyway. Staff was nice and attentive.

Qi4Rk2q5z_pUY-ERvvNh_g.text: Best Korean BBQ I've ever had. Wide variety of delicious items and the meat was prepared perfectly and was extremely flavorful! Jayden was very attentive and never stopped preparing! If you're looking for Korean BBQ you need to check this place out.

YD30u2rli-ULfPTfzKHICQ.text: What everybody said about this place is True. This place is amazing! Like many of the Yelp reviews, I recommend nana as the server. It was way more than enough for 2 girls 1 guy :) We left with full full full tummy lol   Its not like cheap all you can eat bbq but it is worth to spend $$. I would recommend to order combo menu than an a la carte order. All side dishes were yummy. Will go back soon!
