fpZdnVdsPewj12ic0fpCMw.text: It's a really nice place, servers are very knowledgeable about the random questions I ask about the food. (I don't know much) but everyone was very friendly and food was amazing!!

4cEcgWfifu_UfVj0KWhKaQ.text: Cool atmosphere, as if you are outdoors in Seoul...pricy menu, likely $30+ per person.  They have family options, and all meals come with unlimites sides (salad, kimchi, vinegar soup). They cook the meat for you, unless you request to cook it yourself. I personally like the chance to cook my own meat.  Dessert option included a green tea ice cream on a rice cake. It had chocolate drizzled inside, which I didn't like.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vSIU8tJy-zxEqcOfzpvE4Q.text: We had a great first experience here, despite a typo in the menu. The family combo says it includes the high end short rib cut but the Korean actually says it is a pork cut. With that out of the way, Hobak undoubtedly has the closest experience to "authentic" Korean BBQ in Las Vegas - and I just came from a vacation in Korea!   Korean BBQ almost undoubtedly involves the use of charcoal. While Hobak isn't purely charcoal, it does include it in it's gas driven grill, and it does make a difference to the flavor. This hybrid combination means that the flavor of the meat is enhanced with a little more char. This alone sets them apart from all other Korean BBQ in Las Vegas.  The meat quality here is very good, comparable to DJK. Of course, that means that it is a little pricier than AYCE places, and while the combos have plenty of meat, you can't necessarily stuff your face here. That being said, we were completely satisfied with the amount of food.  One of the things to look at here is the way they decorate the interior. It has some fun elements that borrow from the Korean streets, including posters to old Korean movies and a "storefront" style butcher area. The butcher area here helps indicate that the cuts are fresh and that presenting the meat actually means something.  The dessert is a fun take on an ice cream sandwich using Korean rice puff snack instead of cookies.

ljNBL-V-_XQ9K1bdurWTcQ.text: Coming from LA I've been to a lot of Korean bbq places and this place was just ok. Service was a bit slow but the servers were very nice. They were very busy and there was a small wait but the got us seated within 15 mins. Flavors of the meat were ok, not the best I've ever had.

P4rbGFpmOsJms6_7aG95Mw.text: On Saturday we went to Hobak since we heard it was the best in town, it was my first time at a Korean BBQ place. Our server Denise was awesome!!!! She explained everything perfectly. The food was real good, We are definitely going back.

iVqqCvZcYKwsQp1MKS0h7Q.text: Today I had a wonderful Hobak Korean BBQ. We decided to celebrate Valentines with them and it was a great choice ! It was our first time there so our server did a great job at explaining the menu to us. We had a Family combo 1 and it had some delicious meats ! They were seasoned so good, and cooked to perfection!!! Recommended for anyone that want to go out their comfort zone but still enjoy the food by not going way out the box.

RtAVAUG6g7rPnzn9dASFVg.text: Alright listen up fellas, how many times have you gone to get Korean BBQ and realized that you suck at cooking? Or that you don't know what the cuts of meat are or which ones are gonna be marinated to perfection? How many times do you attempt to simmer and sauce the selection only to burn the main course and ruin the mood, not to mention your appetite? Are you tired of being the butt of the joke, because you can't cook the butt of a pig properly? Hobak delivers, and so much more. No more cheap meat, or awful cooking! That's a thing of the past. Not only do they have outstanding quality cuts of meat, but they only use quality ingredients to spice up your evening. The best part? They cook every single piece, every slice to your specific tastes. Why settle for less, when you can be fed by the best?

tNen8bcTLM_PGgG3HiXqiQ.text: My favorite Korean BBQ of all times. Took my sister here for a special meal and she was blown away. We ordered special number 1 for 2 people and it was a lot of food!! Everything was top quality and I highly recommend eating here soon

ZkCsGTpBZqxRmZpWxMmaQA.text: We went here for the first time after reading the reviews and the place is very modern and cool setup. The food was fantastic and probably the best Korean BBQ I have tried so far  The only down side of the place is the amount of food you get for the price. It is definitely good but I don't know when I would return since I left wanting more and paid over $100 for 4 people

VXU4HY1Q6-ZHCQKteQzx1w.text: My family and I visit Vegas annually, and every time we come we make sure to stop by Hobak at least, AT LEAST once. We have never had a bad experience!!! Best food EVER. Definitely worth the thirty or so minutes to be seated.

GC_Zys5XwlR1Mg7Wc1m9KA.text: We were vacationing in Vegas and wanted to try something besides a steakhouse or a super expensive restaurant on the strip.  We found Hobak via a few google searches and the reviews were great so we decided to give it a try.  We were not disappointed.  I highly recommend Hobaks if you like Korean bbq.

-Lj9S3UoJwOKe4Vppun3SQ.text: During a recent Vegas trip, my husband, my sister-in-law, and I decided to try Korean BBQ for the first time. We had been dying to try this and I'm so glad we did. It was amazing! We were super stuffed afterwards, but it was worth it. Upon arrival, we were seated quickly and our waiter came over promptly. We explained we were new and he went over the menu, gave recommendations, and left us to decide. When he came back, we ordered the grapefruit soju (SO DELICIOUS) and the Family Combo. This came with four different types of meat - half beef and half pork. It also came with several side dishes - a veggie stew, steamed egg, veggies, melted cheese, small salad, and several dipping sauces. The waiter helped cook all our meat, asking how done we wanted it (medium rare). My two favorites were the Marinated Skirt Steak and Short Ribs: These were amazing. Super flavorful and extremely tender. I would definitely order again. After three meats came out, we were waiting on our fourth (the spicy pork belly). Our waiter seemed to have disappeared and another waiter stepped up to take over. He cooked our spicy pork belly, which was delicious, but I'd definitely order something else next time. (The meat was very thinly sliced and not entirely what we were expecting.) Then, for dessert, we had two different flavors of Rice Pop Ice Cream (mango/strawberry and green tea). The green tea was amazing - I'd order all green tea next time. Overall, we really enjoyed ourselves. It was definitely a great choice and when I'm in town again, I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea and mango
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy pork belly
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy pork belly

2S2JvtL6dMFFnloo8lXTLQ.text: This place is definitely a 5 star! I would definitely recommend the family combination vs individual plates. You get 3 meat platters, steamed eggs, soup, and end the meal with fried ice cream: vanilla with strawberry syrup  or green tea with chocolate syrup.   We had the green tea and it was too amazing!   Thank you, Hobak! We will be back on our next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of our dishes!  Note: All side dishes are amazing!

a9rFhQp7Bav9Hh0gvm7NQw.text: This place brings Korean market to life with its industrial decor. Its a high budget but you get what you pay for. The service is excellent as they cook the food for you. The experience is what you make of it! Bring a big stomach with a big group of friends, and enjoy good food, good drinks, good service, and good times!

O4OMpUY_jf05rRd752_5YA.text: I've heard a lot of positive things about Hobak so I decided to try for myself. We were seated pretty quickly despite it being dinner time and all. While you wait they're serving slush for free so you can cool down from the summer heat. The interior looks great and looks unique compared to other kbbq's in town. You can definitely taste the quality difference with the meats compared to any ayce. It's a lot better! They also change the grill depending on the meat that is being served so most of them are tailored to cook specific meat. To top it all of, the service we received was really great! Nari and Ryan explained everything to us and made us feel really welcome.

KzshCM6f29BySqDOvysM_Q.text: Amazing Kbbq! It's not all you can eat, but it is well worth the price! The meat just melts in your mouth and the service is great! They come around and help you cook the meats. You basically get it served to you! The quality of the meats is worth the price. I would definitely recommend this spot and I'll be coming back often.

PJ4XuTXDRYhc3wTSeY7LVw.text: Simply the BEST ever!!!! The Quality immaculate. The service better than the food like getting pampered at an expensive spa!!! My rating AAAAAAAA++++!!!! My wife and I are extremely pleased!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s all that&#39;s left from all the delicious meats we tried...!!!! :-) :-) :-)

htoHSaHT_-ZVmGGvmDsXbA.text: This place is good but it doesnt live up to the hype.   The Good:  -The beef was delicious -staff was friendly -lively atmosphere -unique design to restaurant  The not so good:  -pork was disappointing -aekward tabke design (too small) that made it very hot by the end of the night due to size of grill  Overall good but theres no reason to go back in a town with so many other options.

AluI-11P5NYKAcOPq8UiZQ.text: Hobak is definitely one of my favorite Korean BBQ spots here in Vegas. Even with big parties the service has been great. We usually get the hobak family combo. I really like how the server cooks for you and explains what he or she is doing. The meats are good and the kimchi rice is delicious. I really love how dessert is included with the combo too.   The place is a good size and the prices are fair. I like how it's not like other Korean BBQ places where you cook on the grill and front of you and come out smelling like smokey bbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mRWbK1z8rey-a1yBB8JC2g.text: The food was ok. Nothing spectacular and certainly not bad; price was fair. We got the beef combo for 2. Way more food than we could possibly eat. Could even serve 3 people.   A server helps cooks so we don't have to which was a nice surprise.   I think I got food poisoning here. I'm not exactly sure. I'm not putting blame on this establishment at all. Hobak was the last place I ate at before I started having stomach problems. Maybe it was the self-serve popcorn near the front door or maybe it was the chocolate mint candy at the host desk... Because I've been eating the candy all day the following day after... Again I'm not putting blame on the establishment.   4 stars for the service, price and portion.  -1 for the overrated reviews. The food wasn't memorable enough to want to come back.

kdqzWQ48T2Ogu1zsLnz1Lw.text: Awesome service. Great food. Been meaning to try this place but haven't had a chance. Definitely worth the wait. Ribeye and marinated Short Rib a must! New korean bbq fave!.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef brisket. Sushi balls? Why not. Not pictured but a must Ribeye and marinated Short ribs.

DO-ShmBk6AANEaH1t-mlUw.text: This Place is so Amazingly Unique ... They cook personally for you and the Servers are so personable especially Haejin.  She explained the menu clearly. Quality meat and the Sides are really different and authentic. Must go to when you're in Las Vegas.

mSKnqrVr6qp712dz9ceJHg.text: One of the better if not the best KBBQ in Las Vegas.  A lot of good cuts and there's really not too much to say other than the quality is better than most.   They offer a lot of side dishes however the quantity is not a lot. For the price you are paying compared to say Gyukaku, you would be getting a lot more bang with just the same quality at Gyukaku.

MdZOcQ0PG00aHytEfBzrMg.text: Look no further if you're searching for quality.  On Friday ~7:00pm, we waited about 15 minutes to get seated. I absolutely love the smell of Korean BBQ. We ordered Family Combo #2 (non-marinated meat) and I was in meatlovers heaven. I'm pretty OCD about cooking Korean BBQ but the service here was so good that I didn't even have to lift a finger.  We started with the brisket, which cooks so quickly and is perfect when you're getting hangry. They served it with sushi rice and wasabi, which I found to be quite interesting and delicious as well. Next was the outside skirt, an average cut in my opinion. By this point, the steamed egg and bean paste stew had also arrived. The stew was so good!  The best meats were next - pork belly and pork jowl. The pork belly was cut fairly thick and had a little bit of dry seasoning. Both types of pork took a while to cook and was cooked with a sprig of rosemary. I've had pork belly many times in my life and this was a very memorable time. It server cooked it to level of crispiness that I like. It was everything I could've hoped for with pork belly.  We were so stuffed at this point and the combo also includes dessert. We each had half of large rice pop green tea ice cream sandwich. What a great ending to an awesome meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea rice ice cream (included with combo)
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family combo 2 was so good: brisket, outside skirt, pork belly (amazing), pork jowl

lGq1b9VnCiKu7e_dA5RXKQ.text: Really good for the price! Going back here again. It's worth the long wait.  Everything on the menu was delicious. It's been a while since I had good Korean BBQ in Las Vegas.

aNoZviJ-HtOhCrSyrO5_YA.text: Had such a good time tonight! I love the vibe of the place from the decor to the friendly service! Will come again!

sCUKrvJwjzOLQf8F8BZIxw.text: What a treat off the strip!! We got the family meal and it did not disappoint! Our favorite was the special short rib...flavor was SO good on this. And it's a fun experience to have your food cooked right at your table. Fun details include slushy machine, video games while you wait and a febreze station for when you're done. So fun and delicious to boot!

2j8Y7D260eKwseNerz6VjQ.text: Delicious! The short rib was my favorite bbq! Pork belly was good too. Their banchan options were not the traditional side dishes we expected but they were delicious! Really liked the salad. The jap chae was just okay, but really you come here for the bbq. Would definitely eat here again and tell everyone I know to go here too.  Oh and I love they have tooth brushes in the restroom. Great touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bs8EmHl4z26uB4VjTk7xQg.text: 4.5 pretty good.  The customer service was excellent.  If your hair is fixed, or you have frizzy hair, bring something to cover your head because on the outside, when you walk in, there's mist blowing everywhere to cool you off.  I liked that this BBQ had a few pieces of charcoal in it before they lit it up.  You can either order the steaks you want to grill, or do a combo pack.  We did the family combo for 2 which was $65.  Not a bad deal! It came with 4 different kinds of meat, some stew (soup), steamed egg, and ice cream.  The eggs were really good.  We chose the strawberry flavored ice cream and it was pretty good. It tasted similar to a strawberry shortcake.  It was strawberry ice cream between some waffles.  The seasoning on the meats were perfect.  No complaint at all on that.  The side dishes tasted alright.  Not bad.  I would recommend this place to others that are coming to Vegas.  I would also come back if I ever return to Vegas.  You know it's good if Andrew Zimmerman did an episode on this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fV7XgFtTO15eQ_Ivhx8__Q.text: I've been to Hobak many times before and have not been compelled to write a review (good or bad) until now. No doubt this place has consistently tender meats and the sides have been decent in the past. However, last night was terrible. The sides were not interesting and for some reason all the meats cooked tasted like propane. Even the steamed egg tasted terrible like it was steamed in a vat of liquid propane.   With the addition of many other quality kbbq restaurants in town, Hobak should have a place at the top of the pile because they, at least, cook the food for you but when the taste of the food was as bad as last night, you'd wonder if their days are numbered.

yeedFGAkb-adzJuYUxbz2A.text: This use to be my favorite Korean bbq place to go but since having tried many other Korean bbq places, I've come to realize that this place is good but expensive. Quality of meats are great but the variety of sides are lacking. Service for the most part is good. Restrooms have mouthwash and toothpaste to freshen up your mouth after eating all that bbq. I really wish they would bring back their green tea rice cake dessert. Now they just have American flavors which are ok.

m62E4oDvG8xKkb4b3_DCaQ.text: My wife and I love Korean BBQ and always looking for it when we travel. This one had very high quality beef some are even wet aged. They also provided some bbq flavor by adding real carbon in the fire.  The only catch is the vacuum not working and we got smoked all night..

0ag25sLVa6npfKi-rlTYSA.text: In my opinion, the best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. Combo for two(?) forgot the exact name of it, but they have really good sets of combos for example, set 2 for two people, set 3 for three people and etc., and you have choices to pick meats, and the amount is more than enough! They have really good meats, but going beyond, the Korean Soy Bean Soup, Boiled Eggs, and the desert, Ice Cream also must try!   Most of all, impeccable service! If you ask, they provide.  Food: Good Price: Good Service: Good Parking: Good

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7cT68_W-QysJyrXbvkSgXQ.text: Partying at the Encore Beach Club all day that we were searching for an AYCE Korean BBQ, My friends and I made our way to ASIAN Town.  We Yelp'd a few places and came across Hobak Korean BBQ.    When we first walked in I realized it was not an AYCE but we opt to stay and dine here.    We ordered the Family Combo 1 that feeds 3-4.   Oh my good lord, that was a lot of meat and I think it feeds more than 4 people. LOL.    Our combo had the following along with Ban Chan dishes:  Angus Brisket Pork Belly Aged Pork Rib Spicy Angus Boneless Short Rib  The meats are definitely premium cuts.  All were good but my least favorite was the aged pork rib.  The short rib was a little spicy but nothing that a cheese dip can't offset.    Our server was very nice and everyone were attentive.  One of my friends fell asleep at the table so we asked the server to hurry and cook our food so we could get her back to our hotel room. Even though we were rushing, the server was calm, changed our grill as needed and cooked the meats for us.    What stood out to me most was the service we received.  Good job Hobak.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hPMNQfnS7jI6g4yjSoRuNA.text: the best flipping Korean BBQ place!!! I've been to many...MANY Korean bbqs and I've never been this impressed! First the meats are top quality and sooo flavorful! And the customer service here is out of this world, my family and I traveled to Las Vegas from California and were amazed by their friendliness. I won't lie their prices are little pricey but after saving up for a little bit it is a great place to eat and is very well worth it!!

VCCLtdNmmjGKG8ItFRc2eg.text: The Goods 1. Been here for both lunch and dinner, dinner is nice in that they will cook the meat for you as well as cut and prepare the meats.  They keep an eye on the smoke stack for your comfort and they are very efficient 2. A nice finishing touch is the desserts made with rice cracker and choice of ice cream!   3. Had several kinds of meat but kalbi/Korean short rib is always my favorite 4. Beers on tap  Service  1. Efficient  2. It may not seem conversational but to me very consistent with the culture , may be a cultural factor here.  But overall nice when you asked for refills etc  Ambiance 1. Nice!  Did you know they have tooth brushes and floss and mouthwash in the bathroom??  So awesome.  2. Large and spacious adequate seating  3. Wait time can be high  4. Good amount of parking  MoJo  1. This is a one of a kind kbbq 2. I think it is by combo and not all you can eat or ayce, but I prefer good quality over poor quantity

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Several varieties of meat; buhlgogi, dejibuhlgogj
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple spicy tofu soup but it works !!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch special !  It is yum

BFFIBi4ZwwkIxXo8jJsXBA.text: I have tried two other Korean bbq spots and they just don't do it for me as Hobak. The meat quality is good and I love the dessert. My complaint is that I do feel rushed since there is such a long wait to eat here so if there could be another location to help ease that or something that would be great. Even the ridiculous wait time beats the other two restaurants by a long run.

QWoL2OQb4TIexSA5WBBOUg.text: My go to Korean BBQ place! The customer service is great! The meat is always fresh and delicious. It nice they do all the cooking for you so that is always a plus! The down fall is it's not all you can eat.... Also before you leave you can brush your teeth in the bathroom!!

IVBe09FRUAfIKsOcquWnAQ.text: Absolutely delightful!  The room is very comfortable, kind of industrial and very casual.  Lots of people moving and eating, a high ceiling with little to dampen the sound.  This is a great place to go with a group of friends, we were a group of seven which worked perfectly.  We ordered the Family Combo, with brisket, pork jowl, spicy beef short ribs and spicy pork, all of which was cooked in the most dramatic fashion.  In the center of the table the the staff threw the meat onto the grill where it was nicely cooked while we ate and drank.  The sides we ordered were spicy pepper stew, and Angus fried rice with the egg.  The other sides were kimchee, a couple of salads, pickles, bok choy and assorted oils and sauces.  An excellent experience with excellent food.  Get off the strip and try this out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Before you go, get cleaned up.
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delightful!

XoQRvYwxvBlcY4ndED2nvg.text: A very solid offering of KBBQ is served at Hobak. Clean, well served (I love how they grill the meat for you and cut it up at your table) and delicious meats and banchan. One of the other huge bonuses is the free slush served when it's a blazing hot triple degree Las Vegas summer outside.   We decided to go with one of the beef combos which came with a healthy serving of banchan (Korean veggie and side dishes) and ordered some chap chae as well. Everything was just as one would expect KBBQ to be like. Damm good. The kimchi is fresh and the beef is melt in your mouth amazing!   Would I come back. Hells yes!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Envision that sizzle..... dayuuuum :)
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jap chae

wTG8n2cXucri4dbn-6bwoA.text: I had a really great time.  The service was great! The Food as well was Delightful. I really enjoyed it... However, the service was Excellent!! Everyone was very polite & our server Izzy was Splendid & very we'll attending  i loved the service in this place I have to say I'm very happy with the out come of it all tonight. I highly recommend.

0bOmii4EaLRmizTizBmPrg.text: Absolutely thee best Korean bbq i have ever eaten. The side dishes are all you can eat made fresh you can tell the difference if you ever ate at a Korean bbq place. Service was excellent every one had a lot of knowledge of items and menu. Love that. really cool atmosphere and location.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimch
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean spout salald
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed eggs Amazing

v9b8iqx9b1-fi8x35Y8lpw.text: This place is by far my favorite Korean BBQ in Las Vegas! Ever since we moved here we have been having a hard time finding one similar to the ones in K-Town in LA.  But this place is so similar it's awesome. The only complaint I would have is the portions size, the beef brisket was not a Large order! I guess we must be use to LA standards that we expect much, but the skippy portions can get expensive! So I would definitely recommend this place if your looking for some good food, and a fun atmosphere. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. The ice sandwich is bomb! It's has a unique crisp outer layer (reminds me of chicharron lol) but I loved it!   Love the new Flavor added to the list- Cookies and Cream, it definitely makes the meal experience even better. I am a little bummed out that the hours changed, and they're no longer open late. That means. No more late night drop by's

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They Got Cookies and Cream

Sxl-lSmzBlmVAHOr0XobCw.text: My favorite Korean restaurant in Las Vegas! All the meat varieties are delicious and the kimchi stew is my favorite, they make it right every time!! The service will depend, some servers there are amazing others are a bit lazy. Also their banchan lacks a bit compared to other more authentic Korean restaurants.

OZo6PlU7z08l1mD1Xj2KdQ.text: Right next to 'Gabi Coffee& Bakery', 'Hobak Korean BBQ' serves quality meat through a nice dining experience. The Staff will cook the meat for you and let you know when your meal is ready to devour. It can be pricey, but you are paying for the great quality of meat.  You can either buy by meat, or you can do a combo. My friends and I bought the Large Family Combo 2 which can feed 3 ~ 4 people. Family Combo 2 has Angus Brisket, Premium Pork Belly, Outside Skirt Steak, Premium Pork Jowl or Premium Pork Neck; we choose the Premium Pork Neck. The Premium Pork Neck tasted not as tender as what I'm used to when I eat Pork Neck. Other than that everything was delicious, especially the Outside Skirt Steak.  The Family Combo came with Boiled Egg Soup and Bean Paste Stew, along with a few rolls of Sushi Rice. For dessert, the Family Combo comes with Ice Cream Rice Cracker Sandwiches. You choose two flavors, and we choose Chocolate and Cookie & Cremes.  The interior was nice and spacious, and they played Korean songs and Korean MV on the TV.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate and Cookies &amp; Creme Ice Cream Rice Cracker Sandwich
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly &amp; Pork Neck
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bb7OcE2xsun4feKYH5pFag.text: I went here with a friend for lunch on a Saturday.  It's been awhile since I had Korean food. I was pleasantly impressed by how efficient and friendly it was to eat here.  Our side dishes appeared as soon as we had ordered a combo.    The side dishes were tasty and fresh.  I had 4 potatoe pancakes by myself.  There was a soup which was delicious.  I am not a meat lovers but my friend did the meat justice.  Our server also cooked the meat for us and was friendly and attentive during the whole meal.  At the conclusion of our meal we split this huge green tea ice cream sandwich   I have never had one before and it was delicious!    The meal was good, as was the service.  I have no regrets about dining here.   It is on the expensive side. But it's worth it.  There is no point in having money if you never spend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea ice cream deseert
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tender beef cooked to perfection
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoe pancake

aaF6nfkGmZONfFjH_VwcrQ.text: This is a Las Vegas must! Always hit this spot when we are in Las Vegas. Huge portions and very friendly staff. Pork belly is in hit! Lots of adult drink variety with very good soju. They cook the food for you and they get you whatever you need. Wait come be sometimes long it's hit or miss. They have an outdoor waiting area with free slushes at the front.

ezmkIaj7YgHouLyW-7GeSQ.text: First time here. If you like Korean food then you need to try this place! The atmosphere is upbeat and it was busy. We were told the wait was about 15-20 minutes, however, the wait was only about 10 minutes.  What was impressive was the table was set with all kinds of appetizers when we sat down.  We ordered beef set which came out fast. They cook the meat for you so the service is great! The tofu soup is so delicious and the meat is extra tender. The set comes with scrambled egg, 3 types of meat and rice. We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

auIOpuZ5RKa14h6I8ohfdw.text: Very solid Korean BBQ joint.  The brisket, and short rib was delicious, as were the rest of the meal that kept streaming in.  If I'm here again, it's on the list to revisit.

te7A51JqjLhsq5GQNMOfag.text: Hobak is Korean BBQ done right ! We ordered one of the combination family meals which the staff cooked table side for us. Our combination came with beef and pork and you can tell that they were serving high quality meat. My favorite was the pork belly and pork jowl. What I love about Korean bbq, aside from the delicious meat, are the sides that it comes with (kimchi, radish, soups, etc.). They were more than happy to give us refills of their kimchi -yum!   We also shared a couple bottles of soju which perfectly paired with the grilled meats.   This place is a bit pricey, but totally worth it!

Omo_NuouH3Kn-9IF2q0BXQ.text: So my fiancee and I never had Korean BBQ before so we were a little apprehensive.  We got the combo for 2 which came with 4 different meats, 2 beef 2 pork. It was the first combo if I remember correctly.  First of all its alot of food !!! But it was sooooo good ! I really liked it to my surprise and my fiancee loved it. They cook the meat for you which was a big reason we chose to come here.  The service is unlike anything I have ever experienced. They are so on top of it !!   The combo came with dessert at the end . We got the strawberry flavor and I am stilllll thinking about it!!!   COME HUNGRY !!

SqXoSh4-HVisqB7Kkoy88g.text: 5 Stars for the Aged Short Ribs and Service!   Came in here with no real expectations at the end of a turnaround trip over in vegas, and have been hearing about this place for the past couple years. Half of those who came say its better than Kang Hodong Baekjong over here in LA.  Well, to start off we showed around 5pm on a Saturday and were seated almost immediately, but shortly after a crowd / wait started to build up.   We went ahead and grabbed a small family combo 3, and added brisket to the order. The banchan they have is super fresh, and they arent shy to bring you more, so request away, and lets get to the MEATS.   The Hobak Skirt Steak, Pork Belly, and brisket were all pretty good. Nothing too amazing, but they were good, but the surprise was the Hobak Aged Short Ribs and Spicy BL Short Ribs. Gotta say the aged short ribs literally melted in our mouths and the spicy was super juicy and flavorful.   Gotta say the Hobak Aged Short Ribs was a surprise and possibly the best kalbi we've all ever had, and thats saying a lot.   Throw some soju and hite in the mix and you're in for one hell of a meal.   Go head, and make sure you dont skip on the aged short ribs. That alone gets a fiver from me.

2bxmhKB3Ro-xyc3H6KColA.text: This place is a JOKE! We waited 30min to be seated which is np. But service was by far the worst experience in all of the Las Vegas restaurants. This is the worst place for Korean bbq. Look around, no one is Korean that's eating around you! All these good reviews are from people who dont know lol.  Be aware, the beef combo for 3-4ppl is the same amount you get for 2-3 but almost double the price. There are way better kbbq places on spring mountain than here. Save yourself $200

XW1v4N_LTvDf0v3nDVQ4-w.text: Not much was done right and no service recovery when it is mentioned.  Servers were nice, service was horrible. Small table, won't clear the dishes, small portions for a party of 3 even for large dinner combo. Party of 5 sitting on the table, we ask for more banchan, should double up on one plate. Slow... slow service for the meats and low fire. We hungry, get it rotating. Didn't even change our grill after our brisket to fire wire. Took more than 10 min to get our ice cream after we paid bill. We literally left without it because it isn't worth an additional wait after 30min for seats that we are keeping for the next group. Get your heads in the game, my gods. And top it all off, it was for my birthday. I didn't get anything. I didn't want the loud music and lights anyway.

oC2JawZX0GlKfDh2-wTG1g.text: Overall very solid KBBQ, it is not AYCE (but if were being honest I can never really eat THAT much). I like the aged meat that they offer here, and I will say this is my first KBBQ experience that used coal in the grill (yum).   My ONLY complaint here is that my husband and I do not eat pork, so they werent too adamant on altering the preset meat packages. I have no problem paying extra to substitute other things into the package but here it was not an option :(

LduQdJHOIcCSbJZ3Wcz5AQ.text: The food was off-the-hook delish! We had family combo #3 for two people! Thinly sliced pork belly, marinated beef . . . and great quality meats.  The sides were delish and generous! I really am starting to believe the kbbq you get at ayce places don't have the best quality because they are focused on serving quanity!  We had a great ice cream sandwich at the end that was made by the house. Although I had no room leftover !   The service was good and the guys came by to cook for us. Which was very nice because they cook well and it helps us relax.  We took an Uber there so they gave us 10% off and an additional coupon for 10% off for another visit!   A+++!

We ordered the Hobak family meals and it was a great choice. The skirt steak and short rib was so good.  It's awesome that they cook the food for you too!  The only downfall we experienced was that we had one lady that cooked our meat for a party of 8 using two flames, she was nice but she seemed overwhelmed working several tables besides ours. We also ordered rice, added onion salad and egg soup and they forgot those as well until we reminded them.   So all in all, the ice cream pop was yum (green tea was good), the food was great, and even though the service could have been better, we will still be back.

Kjs05SeSr3MO6GYU2gYLcg.text: Great Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas. Located on the edge of chinatown, this place has got the traditional smokey feel of a Korean BBQ place although they have many sophisticated ventilation and exhaust ducts. Good choice and selection on the menu, and long tables have 2 grills. Also, lots of good banchan (Korean appetizers). The spicy pork belly was great, but the short ribs were a tad too sweet for my taste, but still good. Also good sohu.

YNLHj-4e19TJ4qydqtQIyQ.text: Delicious! One of our Las Vegas favorites for Korean BBQ. Everything was fresh, service was excellent and the food was absolutely fantastic. If you'd like a great experience, this is the place!

hWa0--L70KA6Ydgb8cxhiQ.text: Amazing food, pork was a little fat go with the beef all the way. The spicy beef was amazing. We'll be going back tonight

URIhyvKl-jlLyBZmxmo0zg.text: Ok Hobak, you win, I submit.  There's a lot of buzz going on about this Korean BBQ restaurant. I've seen the pics, saw the reviews, yada yada. But eventually, it was bound to happen. And boy, did it.   Hobak is located in a small business strip mall off of Spring Mountain road. Lots of parking, so that's not an issue. Walking into this place is a trip. It reminds me of a an 80's Korean city street. They have the modern vent systems, which is great btw.  I've made this argument before, and I will continue to in the future, Kbbq that is grilled over charcoal is different and tastes much better than when it's grilled over gas. And this is the only place in town that has it.  Onto the food. Hobak advertises themselves as having black angus beef. So, I had to try it. The meat was fantastic. It's the creme de la creme. All the sides were well prepared, especially the steamed egg.  The service was great as well. The server was great and attentive. She also cooked all the meat perfect. Just great.  One of the best Korean BBQ places not only in Vegas, but one of the best all around that I've ever been too.

qnGUhwgwANYNPYFrJ8PRxQ.text: This is my favorite Korea BBQ. The environment is so good and the food is super delicious! I went to Korea a few months ago and this place is just authentic and even better! I like the friendly staff and they refilled the side dishes even before I asked them. Today is father's day and they gave us a free bottle of rice wine. Very happy day at Vegas. If you are going for korean BBQ. This is the place you must go. Highly recommended!

Aykf6sNfkeJqm69xasfOvQ.text: This review is based entirely on the lack of service and poor procedures. After waiting approximately 40 minutes, our buzzer went off. We handed it to the hostess, who told us we would be seated next.   During the next 20 minutes, 4 additional parties were seated. When we asked why we had been told we were next and yet other parties were being seated ahead of us, we were told that because we were a party of five we needed to wait for a round table.   However there were two round tables that had only two people seated at them. In fact, the party seated just prior to our buzzer going off was a party of two that was seated at a round table. In addition, she asked a party of 2 and a party of 4 if they would be willing to sit together at a large table during this 20 minute window.  The manager came and told us that we just needed to wait for the round tables that are large enough for 5.  We asked why parties of two were being seated at the larger tables and he said they do not seat parties of 2 at the large tables despite the fact that there were two separate examples of this right there!   When we asked how much longer it would be for a round table, we were told perhaps another 20 minutes. We left without trying the food.   I'm sure the food is excellent and worthy of some of the higher star ratings, however the management needs to know to seat smaller parties at smaller tables and seat the larger parties at the larger tables rather than make the larger parties wait twice as long.  In addition, the hostess followed us to our car to ask for the buzzer which we had turned in over 20 minutes earlier. I believe she had already handed it out again to another party.

30fODHOEB2vL9XGzE0Vo2w.text: This is my new favorite Korean BBQ! The quality of meat is on point! Every bite is packed full of flavor and I can't get enough :) The service is bomb. The price for any combo set is such a great deal considering the quality of meats/food you get. It's got an awesome atmosphere. The bathrooms even have toothpaste, brushes, and mouthwash! If you're in the mood for Korean BBQ I would definitely recommend Hobak.

k5HmLhv-0p-xoN5lzZF6nA.text: If you're looking for a good Korean bbq place without the work then this place is the place for you. This is our second time visiting Hobak. Matthew was our server both times. He provides exceptional service & is very knowledgeable & entertaining as well. Not only is the food good & the service as well. I highly recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a fair priced kbbq with fresh & quality meat.

ND8KU2DYzt75UN8LgDUITw.text: This by far the best Korean BBQ place I've been to in Vegas. Our server was Julie and she was super nice and attentive.  It was very busy when we dined here and she still managed to make sure we were well taken care of.  The meat was very good quality and the establishment wasn't as smokey as it could be because of the neat vents they had over every grill. Very clean too. I really hope the service stays this awesome because it definitely separates them from all the other competition. I'm definitely a fan of Hobak!

7KTwRhdwGDUe1mHmNab05w.text: Been waiting a long time for this place to open, and I have to say it is beyond worth it!  This is authentic as it can get; cheese, spam, and bibs for adults!  I think i've watched enough Kshows about Korean culture to understand.  The Hobak Aged Short Rib ($27.99) is marinated while the Angus Boneless Short Rib (31.99) is not.  Get the marinated one. The beef is seasoned and tenderized so well making every bite glorious. The bits of charcoal spread on the grill intensify it even more.  For a side dish the BibimBap (aka Shaken Dosirak in this case) comes in a tin and shaken at the table.  It's even just as fun watching instead of doing it yourself. Rice, Yolky Egg, Seaweed (Gim), Spam, and Seasoned Dried Squid (Ojingeochae-Muchim) all jingled with a sweet spicy sauce (Gochujang).  I like the addition of the squid in my lunchbox.  Def good eats.  Hobak exceeds all my expectations so much that i don't have anymore other options in town for Kbbq.  Heck, i don't even have to drive to LA either to get my fix either!  *update* 5/5/16  Spicy pork belly is fire! Crept up nicely and flavor is there.    Combo set is the way to go. You get same amount of meat if you were to order individually.

6VjZeR5CIOxafG8enTKr2Q.text: It is our first time coming in this place...we were invited by our family for we are from Los Angeles,Ca it was long wait however same experience with other I guess good restaurants...but the staff are excellent educating us with regards to their menu. NbF-544aqLBdgFthPlPQ5A.text: Holy cow! Holy Angus cow! Watch out Las Vegas, Hobak is here to set the Korean BBQ scene on fire! Hobak is a Korean BBQ franchise/chain in Korea. This location is their first US location.   The interior is exceptionally clean. The way that they decorated the place reminded me of Asian outdoor food stall areas. In places like Hong Kong and Seoul, they have food stalls and there are tables around the area where the customers sit and eat. It's like a food court but outdoors. They also had old movie posters posted in certain places. What was best about this place was that the round tables were decorated as though you're around a huge barrel. In Seoul, Korea, there is this one hugely popular KBBQ joint where your party literally all stand around a barrel and cook your meat. There's charcoal in the barrel and you just grill it. So it's really great that Hobak gives you a little glimpse of that.   Before they sit you and your party, they'll prep the table for you. They'll set all the dished down with the banchan and they'll fire the grill up first. Now, this is the best part: when you get to your table, you'll see that their grills are gas based, however, they also put a few pieces of coal there. You'll have the temperature control of gas (somewhat) yet the smokey flavors of coal - now THAT'S definitely different. No other Korean BBQ joint in the city does this as far as I know. Also, the modern ventilation systems! Definitely a plus! The only other place that has it is Doh Korean BBQ I believe.   Their menu mainly consists of beef and pork. If you're looking for chicken, seafood, or the huge variety that a place like Gen offers then you're in the wrong place my friend. In fact, if you're looking for AYCE .. this is definitely not the place. Everything here shall be a la carte. Hobak in Korea is largely known for their marinated meats so of course two of their highlighted items would be their marinated skirt steak and aged/marinated short ribs. Aside from that, they also have combo meals.  For their combo meals, you either choose beef, pork, or combo. Each combo meal comes with bean paste stew, steamed egg, veggies, cheddar cheese, and dessert. My boyfriend and I decided to go with their family combo: it has two beef dishes and two pork dishes. It'll give us a good round about feeling of the place, their style, and their quality. However, there is a typo on their family combo .. the English part anyways. It says the combo comes with Angus boneless short ribs but it turns out that its supposed to be aged/marinated pork ribs. We didn't realize this until later on in the meal when the meats were out. Granted, if you compared the Korean symbols, you'll easily find the mistake ...   I typically don't care for marinated meats so it was a huge disappointment that all the meats in the family combo were marinated. Despite that, their marination was not overpowering and also not overly sweet. They definitely have a good control over that aspect. Their marinated skirt steak was amazingly tender and pretty much melts in your mouth. Their aged short ribs were really good quality. Their spicy pork belly was also a huge surprise: it was sliced thinly like they do for brisket. The pork belly was really really delicious. It just melted in my mouth. Although, I would feel as though the pork belly would be better without the sauce...you'll be able to taste the pork more. I tasted a whole lot more sauce than pork. As for their marinated pork ribs ... it took the LONGEST to cook but it was really good. Because it's not an AYCE establishments, they are able to focus on the pure quality of the meats.   The service was phenomenal. Our server was always close by and they actually cook for you. Of course, you have the option to cook the meat yourself and the server will ask you which you prefer. We decided to let our server cook for us. Might as well get some good ol attention here! Our server's name was Sim and he was really really friendly. We had some friendly chats with him about the restaurant, about Seoul, and a few general things. He even would cut some of the char off of the meat if it was too much! Hobak is probably the only Korean BBQ restaurant in Las Vegas to give me superb service like this. It's just unbeatable at this moment.   If it gets busy however, I can see how it'll get harder and harder for the servers to be as attentive. It wasn't a full house but they had a decent amount of people dining the night we went. It was pretty good for being their 2nd day in business. But no fear! There is a service button on the side of the table!  Being as new as they are, they definitely need to work out some kinks here and there, like fixing the menu. Despite that, my dinner experience was a five star experience here with their service and quality. Especially when you compare it to the other Korean restaurants in the city. Will definitely be back for their beef combo! :) I think everyone should give them a try!

jyjCM_bnqCu3ODnAUp8cPA.text: Randy is the best!! So is the marinated skirt steak! Only waited about 20 minutes and it was worth it! Definitely coming back next time I'm in Vegas

PK-s0RnRacMwPuEyH4bNtw.text: Best Korean BBQ in town. Love the skirt steak and the service is always on top of everything! Won't go anywhere else.

SsGrV4RswtKcUJjkbGayeQ.text: The food and service is great! The owner was even humble enough to come out and greet me and my buddy both times we are there.

xLT0Gl1XD1IKhkF2npZaag.text: best korean  bbq in Vegas.  service and food quality is amazing! if you're new to korean food the staff will go over step by step and help you with cooking all the meats from start to finish.  The atmosphere and vibe is fun and energetic. they even provide you with complimentary tooth brushes and mouthwash in the washrooms after eating all the BBQ and garlic :)  I will be a regular from this point on.

L74olSiKYuQ3G_RMUsDsPg.text: Minju Bum is the best service I ever had . He is very nice and helpful. Will defiantly Come back Again for him

NWbko7XZarLFEVixQc9mrA.text: I've never had Korean BBQ before but I will be back to Hobak Korean BBQ for sure. The service was excellent. Everyone was so friendly. The food was so good. I don't have a clue what exactly everything was but it didn't matter. it was all good. I was afraid the side dishes like kimchi would be too spicy for me but they were very flavorful but not spicy. Hot sauce and extra peppers were available for those who want hot.  We had the beef combo with brisket, rib eye and skirt steak. Brisket was my favorite. Now I will be looking for Korean BBQ in Portland since I only go to Vegas twice a year...

SCufB_p8vXVUnzwMM0u-AQ.text: Better than Magal. I tried pork combo S and it was good enough for 3 people including a guy! We loved the rice ice cream that they gave at the end.

n4diFcYxXvAKntAtdlKPAw.text: Pretty much one of the most incredible dining experiences I have ever had. Visiting from Florida I looked up this place on Yelp and we took a chance. I cannot say enough to about the deliciousness that is this place. I recommend everyone get off the damn strip and visit this jewel in Chinatown. We had the beef and pork combo. The meat was perfectly marinated and cooked to perfection by our waitress. Every course was spectacular and the service was second to none. The night before we visited a steakhouse in the strip that cost us over $200 (no liquor) and this place kicked that in the butt at least 100x's. Do not miss this place go go go!!

IOFcp-qKs8JQcNEfk8Bb1A.text: We were skeptical about their 5 stars at first! But after eating here I can sincerely say their food is the best Korean food we've ever had! We're from Los Angeles so our choices for Korean Bbq is limitless! The meat here is top notch and their tofu stew is amazing! Even down to the green tea ice cream sandwitch is amazing! Definitely recommend this place! Service was on point! They even give free slushy and free mini water bottle for ppl who r waiting!

N2sMiPSouMH_Nnm6g2ubGg.text: After trying many different kbbq places in California, I have to say that this place was hands down one of the best in terms of quality or meat and most of all customer service.  Our server Minju made our experience here amazing and very enjoyable. He is very personable, super funny, and extremely on point with everything we needed. He taught us everything about the menu and guided us through with how he grilled our meat. He was literally at our table the whole entire meal (at least that's what it felt like ) and cooked our meat to perfection. THANKS MINJU!!! We will definitely come back for the food and also especially for Minju to be our server.

7-AaHKKs8u08GngeLdxIEw.text: Incredible food! Incredible service! The marinated skirt steak is a definite must try! Being Korean I know what authentic Korean food taste like and YUP THIS IS IT!

o_O4QXf0_PHwD7dUbvLhWQ.text: Service was great (they cook the meat for you)! We got the hobak family combo and it came with a variety of meats. Bean paste stew and steamed egg came very hot and fresh. We will definitely be back!

dM5qi6VXDpemDC64fD4o1w.text: Bruuuuh... If you're checkin this page to see if you really wanted to try it out. Just go! Excellent service and food. Shoutout to Kevin.

0hsoK2vl15bKf8UJwdmVHg.text: The best Korean bbq I've ever had hands down. Only thing I didn't like was the steamed egg, it taste like burnt egg. Katie was great but James went above and beyond as our server explaining every dish and taking a little extra time with us. I will definitely be back.

5m-H_fVesj86yEe2qfR2Lw.text: This was simply the very best food we ate in Vegas, and we dined at all the fancy five-star casino and hotel restaurants. We would spend from 200-400 per meal from 2-5 people at some of the best restaurants Las Vegas had to offer. We absolutely love Asian food, and we went to the best Vegas had. Being skeptical of Korean BBQ my 9 year old daughter was not very enthused when we told her we were going to Chinatown for lunch this time. Boy was she wrong!! We ordered the Skirt steak, and had to order a double portion because my nine-year-old almost ate the first portion by herself. The staff was truly impressive, and their courteousness, and service reminded us of how we feel when we get together for Thanksgiving or Christmas with the family. Needless to say we only have three days left in Vegas and we are probably going to revisit this place at least two more times!! Amazing Food, and affordable prices. 5Stars all the way!!!

GVpDito2WRVIiJ0G1QiD4Q.text: Let me start off by saying I work in a Korean Bbq restaurant. This experience was beyond amazing. The meats were such high quality I couldn't believe it. My favorite was the skirt steak. It was so tender and slightly sweet. Our server Nana was always there to help out and offer suggestions on what meat would go with any sauce or side. I have to say I have a new favorite kbbq place. You can't go wrong giving this place a try.

8YBOhL3cUzzXtn2bywi9sg.text: Amazing food. Unbelievable service. This was our first experience with Korean bbq. I am a definite fan and will become a regular here. The family dining experience is absolutely perfect. Thank you I'll be back.

j2ZojKpv99RJD3MTcyRfTw.text: This is the best Korian BBQ restaurant in Las Vegas. Service is excellent. Nana was our server and she took good care of us. Very good for the price. Better than other Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. Try one of the combos to sample their food. All the meats were very fresh.

0jNej_Ry06adnm5MxVpd7Q.text: 3 stars is a generous rating... Came here because of the extremely high rating on Yelp. Disappointed is an understatement. Service was terrible. They kept forgetting items that we asked for and overall service was sporadic at best. We used the little service button on the table but it was mostly just ignored. They were trying to cook our meat for us but they were not around very frequently and we had to wait a long time in between the different meats AND the portions were small. We waited over half an hour just to get our checks and by that time the place was more than half empty. I've had much better Korean BBQ for a lot cheaper with better service.

y7szMBXfyBJ65xPBNlEjHg.text: Went here on a whim , didnt realize it existed until a friend brought me . Korean BBQ restaurant with a good ambience for the hip crowd . Service was great the server explained everything very clearly and was funny . We had a meat feast and everything was great .

oBY15AzS1krAB8B_Oxo2HA.text: Best BBQ ever ! It is not an all you can eat but it has a reasonable price . The meat tastes like heaven and the staff helped us cook the meat. Would definitely go back

Service was awesome, any place that cooks the food for me and cooks it good is an awesome place in my book!  The staff was very friendly and accommodating to our big table.  Clean restaurant as some Korean places I have been aren't the cleanest of places.   Pretty good priced food for the high quality meats. Unfortunately not AYCE but definitely better than other Ala Carte places.  Definitely coming back here ! If you're thinking of the lower end meat quality all you can eat places, definitely just spend a bit more and come here!

3uMSAl0ZVe5dKmDj2JFKbA.text: Went there on sunday night. The place is quite full.  We sat on our table and the set up is ready. Great!! What i mean by set up is all the side dishes are already on the table, the utensil in the package and the ice tea glass.  The service is excellent. They serve us right away. Taking the order n the food come out in a petiod short of time. They cook for us n change the grill constantly that way we always have a clean grill.  Food is awesome!! We loved everything. Its taste very delicious. We ordered beef combo and it fills us to the max.  We will definitely come back n recommend this place. Keep it up!!

eY4PovrOrBPLSA_Il_VXpw.text: Love their skirt steak! & their ice cream is really good. This is my favorite Korean BBQ place to come with Friends in Las Vegas. It looks really cool when people come celebrate their birthdays here!

iBP8oqQN9LAu1dJ1YCtqlA.text: Came here for my brother's 18th birthday! They made it really special by including a souvenir and a birthday firework candle! Of course the food is amazing as usual. The spicy pork was good but pretty spicy haha. Randy was an amazing server, really attentive!

a6OVAPU0F5nLVnMd28AvuA.text: My family group of six (with my parents and two kids age 8 & 10 was at this restaurant based on yelp reviews. We ordered beef combo and cold noodle (naengmyun), kimchi stew and bean paste soup. Beef quality was excellent! Kimchi stew was a little bit too sour but my mom liked it so much. All my family loved the meat and bean paste soup. Cold noodle (naengmyun) was a bit disappointing. Cold noodle soup taste more like an instant soup. But the ice cream sandwich was a hidden treasure. My kids wanted to go back just for the ice cream sandwich. We will definitely go back to this place when we visit Vegas. I almost wanted to take one star back for the cold noodle. But the service was excellent plus so I am keeping all five stars.

e0wr__TZnGMk48OsaDS3SA.text: Yes!!! Finally a good kbbq place in Vegas! It is not AYCE, so the quality of meat is really good. There are few combo options you can choose from either pork or beef. Their brisket melts in your mouth. Ohh & don't forget to leave some room in your tummy because their complimentary waffle ice cream is to die forrrr!!

G_UaqbJ8ZoECi-pOjAg5lQ.text: They have tooth brushes in the bathroom so when you're finished eating you can brush and be fresh. What else needs to be said. Mind blown.

zuc7XoYVYtYBwo2mAJdxFw.text: I've been to a lot of Korean BBQs in both LA & Vegas. This one is definitely on the top of the list. The meat is VERY high quality, the service is excellent and the portions are filling.  I got the small beef combo for 2, and it did the job.   Usually rib eye at kbbq at this price point is average, but this one's was phenomenal and easily the best I've ever had at a kbbq.  Nice new decor as well. Definitely a must visit.

m2gjRT5t718qRQjKYX1DEw.text: This place totally surprised me!  Def check it out.  Food, service, desert!!! Bring your appetite!

3I-BqQsKyKyFvwIcvmCrGg.text: One of my favorite spots in Vegas! Their meat is so tender and full of flavor. I love it! Great date spot. Also, a wonderful place to go with friends. Definitely check it out of you haven't already!

n2oM2CBzz2ZhZRxvsGfekg.text: Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas!  Unlike most Korean BBQ places, Hobak cooks for you. The meat is top notch. They have both marinated and non-marinated varieties of beef and pork. There were four of us, so we went for the Large Family #3, marinated beef and pork. All were outstanding. Excellent banchan, especially the kim chee, pancake and been sprout salad. And as if there was not enough food, ice cream sandwiches for desert are included. All in with a couple of beers and 20% tip for four -- with leftovers -- $150. A bargain for the quality and service. Hobak is a must.

PE3_t0_hJ-LY_roiXgZf5g.text: Come here really early coz it's always and i mean ALWAYS busy! We went on a Thursday night and we had to wait 30 mins to be seated. With that said, i know now why they are always busy. It's because the food is great. Bomb.com! We had the family combo number 3. All meat were delicious. They cook the meat for you while you eat. Staff are pretty awesome too. You can ask for sides as much as how you want. The ice cream that comes with the combo was delicious too. I will definitely bring more friends and family here.

dFjFrHZ6U4lgt2-NdYjSGg.text: We came on a Sunday night and our wait was about an hour. We came around 6 and got seated around 7 pm. We waited outside and we had people to talk to and the external heater to keep us warm so the wait was pretty tolerable.  We came as a party of 5 and got the large Hobak special. It was pretty filling. It comes with the egg souffle and the bean paste soup. You can get a single refill on those two options but the other side dishes you just need to ask and they will give it. We also got the angus fried rice and it was too sweet in my opinion and the one that was spicy was much more satisfying.   The special came with about 4 different meat with the majority being marinated stuff. The meat was tender and pretty darn good. I can see why all the tourists and locals consider this place number one!

pnUDnqgCWZwXkHl_ntytLw.text: I found this place on Yelp and decided to come check it out. I'm a local and I've eaten at many different Korean BBQ places here in town, this restaurant by far is one of my favorites!! The sides were absolutely delicious and the skirt steak was to die for. The prices are reasonable and the staff was friendly and attentive. I will definitely be coming back over and over again. It is now my GO TO spot for Korean BBQ! Thank you Hobak for a great dining experience.

sHv9T8KOGs-2lG-H6BM6pg.text: Quality meats! This place is such a really good find and their food was definitely worth stuffing yourself. They also have this beer/soju tower that's just the perfect addition to the meat. Definitely loved the spicy beef, so I'd recommend the Combo #3. Just be prepared for a large bill, even for just two people it costed more than a hundred. But it was definitely worth it!

6zoXaP5-wnyEHwTeRsq4vQ.text: Had Family meal for four. Meat was good. Server Mr Thai was terrific. Side dishes were substandard.  This made the entire food experience marginal at best.

P8irMQose6q_DVOxybNxwg.text: Food quality is pretty good. The only downside of this place is their bad service. They used to offer ice tea that they made but when we asked for it, they pretended not to know what it was or even give us an alternative option. Some of the younger male workers pretend to not notice us when we try to call for service. I can tell they're only do the bare minimum service. Other than that, I enjoyed the food but honestly, I wouldn't come back here because there are so many other great kbbq places around such as Mag gal or Goong.

TCCKD5gKmT0yZ1wvAugXrw.text: Amazing food and service!! First time eating Korean BBQ and definitely not last! Came back a few times to Hobak since! Thank you for a great experience!!

ES9vUz4xpHgRUPG0_6JJqA.text: Food quality: **** Ambiance: *** Staff: ***** Speed: ***** Decor: ***  I git the Angus aged prime ribs. Really nice cut. Great place. Ridiculous amount of sides with any entree. Don't think it twice come and eat here. More suitable for 2 and above. Wish they had a better tailored menu for 1.

TkKldIXC-k-1cIFHwxE9cw.text: Good Korean BBQ with several selections. A tad pricey for the amount of meat you get compared to other Korean BBQ joints in the city.

emrZ8571UkQ71Y8KgC2CrQ.text: I've been around when it comes to KBBQ. My BF lives in close proximity to K-Town in LA and there are TONS of KBBQ restaurants out there. I'm happy that my recent move to LV has given me the chance to try some new places, and Hobak was definitely on the top of my list. My friends visited this past weekend so we decided to check it out. We walked in at about 7pm on a Sunday night and the place was lively, we were seated after waiting about 35mins (beats the 1hr20 wait in LA already!!).   We ordered the Hobak Beef Combo (Large) to share between 5 people, the amount of food we got was more than enough to share. [1] Angus Brisket - nice marble, tender. [2] Angus Boneless Short Ribs - a favorite of the table, beautiful marble, tender meat, and grilled on a separate grill. [3] Marinated Skirt Steak - nice savory/sweet marinated. [4] Steamed Egg - standard steamed egg. [5] Bean Paste Stew - spicy and tangy. [6] Rice Pop Ice Cream - choice of two types of ice cream which is sandwiched between two crispy rice pastries.   Overall I thought Hobak was really good - the quality of meat was perfect, side dishes were good, and the service was excellent. The only things that I was disappointed with was that they didn't have rice paper or a house hot sauce. Overall great place and worth a try if you're ever in Vegas.

-DzjsTWFTDPhh7V9F4Z5ZA.text: Do plan ahead when coming here especially during peak times and weekend. With a good central location on Spring Mountain Rd. This place attracts a good anount of locals and tourists. My family and I had a good time despite the wait time and somewhat slow service. The reason for the not giving them the full 5 star despite the delicious meal we had was the missing items in our combo and lack of service. At times we were ignored by our server and drinks weren't filled accordingly. Overall the quality of their meats was good and banchan was delicious.  The upbeat and street-like atmosphere set this place apart from other Korean places. This was our first time trying out a Non-AYCE Korean BBQ Restaraunt and would reccomend this place based on quality.

jIAmr-4EA8CK9AdQyjpzaA.text: We come to Hobak frequently. The atmosphere and food are AMAZING! In all of the times we've been here, our server, Crysta, was most attentive. She made sure our entire table was taken care of. Great food Hobak! Great service Crysta!!

PbJoYOa7X5NPJf-CRa1UlQ.text: This place is the best in Vegas! Krista is the best server and very nice. Told us about her doggo while cooking our meat perfectly.

f8TiGbjvDeOVJXxuUQ30VQ.text: My husband and I love this place! We've been there at least 10 times. The meat is exceptional, but our first love are all the side dishes! The staff is friendly and keep the side dishes and drinks full and fresh. We are always satisfied when we leave. Thanks Hobak!

qJqwiLOz1VI2zkgga4Rx5g.text: I think this was my favorite BBQ place in Vegas (of the two we tried). We waited 30 minutes but it was fine since we were buzzed already anyway. I think it was around 7pm when we got there on a Saturday. Apparently it's a chain in Korea? But still pretty dang good.   Service was great. The meat... very fresh and adding the rosemary to the pork belly was a nice touch. I loved how they took a mallet to the bottle of soju to get it slushy. The sides especially the scallion salad goes so well with the different meats. The sauces were delicious as well. Pretty much experimented and tried it with no sauce and then with different sauces and different sides.

oA8AdB69h8dOuYYIox1_Og.text: Came here for the first time after several raving recommendations. Well, let's just say, it didn't disappoint. I like the decorations and it feels like you are at a kogi place in Korea, except it's much cleaner. The staff is attentive and cooks everything for you. The food is pretty on point but the meat still isn't what you can get in Korea. Maybe it's too much to expect here... In any case, if you are in town, this is a pretty good place to kick it with your party, have a few drinks and and have some BBQ...

qJp9T1pIsU_EOiAtCR-y3A.text: Came here 1 year ago,  and hooked. Now back with friends and they are not overly adventurous but came with. We all enjoyed and it was just as good as last year. Service was great, fast and they did cooking.  Beef was so tender and cooked medium rare, had great flavor.  Coming back next time in town.

eWvA0I7F0HbUASsFWGaFVg.text: Amazing food and great service. Randy and Boddens were excellent. They were very quick in getting our orders and making sure everything was great. Randy also explained as he cooked our food very fun time It far from our house but def. worth the drive. We will be going back soon.

4gLGZkYy5p1LJuBhTpybGQ.text: This was our first time at Hobak and it was such a great experience! Everything we ordered was delicious! Randy gave us great recommendations and kept us entertained while he cooked for us! Definitely will be back! Thanks Randy!

QwlISFIjPbG8SD2E3kyqfg.text: Delicious! The food was awesome and the service was too. This is definitely one of the best Korean BBQ places I've been to. They also cook your meat here which is a big plus. I recommend this place to anyone in the LV area and anyone coming from other places to visit.

L3OAgYj6fipQkMQ8jvz7dA.text: Really amazing KBBQ spot in Las Vegas. Our server was very attentive and answered all our questions about the menu. As you all know not all KBBQ spots are the same, and this one definitely stands out. The decor is unique and the service was great. Jaden was a pleasure making sure our choice selections were perfectly Cooked, and everyone had a share. He changed out the grills, which for me is a big thing at KBBQ spots, and he was very attentive. We went with the large beef combo. Everything was well seasoned and fresh. Will be coming back.

a25m880XNhohLZnkz0-rIw.text: This place has very good food and a fun atmosphere.   Our waiter Exo was awesome.   It's first come, first serve. However if you are not Korean, you may have others that show up later than you seated before you.

0zjMSEvDPmUZmL_a1MUZ7w.text: I had galbi and gochujang samgyeopsal. All dishes were very excellent! It was the most delicious korean bbq in the US I had have! All crews were very nice and kind, especially, EXO was very great! Thank you EXO!

jS213Xaym66l8d5QDxCCGg.text: Amazing korean BBQ, best I've ever had and I definitely recommend. All meat tasted incredibly fresh. Side dishes were all on point. Service was punctual, thanks Kevin! Must come here again!

7o0GxFo4IJqm80NfBYpthA.text: OMG just when I thought I've had the best KBBQ already I find Hobak! We were lucky to find a table. Well, we came at 3pm in the afternoon, that was probably the only time of day that they will actually have availability. Amazing food, superb service, and the restaurant itself has a great ambiance. Be sure to save some room for dessert!

IxTSIhXeNyQfBHjObn5BuQ.text: Hey just when I thought there wasn't any good Korean spots in Vegas. This place proved me wrong. I got to say this place is the bomb! And the service here is amazing. Without a doubt. It probably beats the service I get in the Los Angeles area at the Korean spots I hit up after work. Anyways I recommend this place to anyone who loves Korean food or who is willing to get some kBBQ!!! I always drink when I'm out and about and you gotta love it! Anyways great place to visit when in Vegas. Get some! Please come to la!!!!!!!

LnsekwpHHowZmTw5YURo2w.text: I want to say Mmmmmm good. AS you enter this place it feels like you entered a street venue in Korea. Food was great and the service was quick and wonderful. My servers and host we kind and attentive. Wonderful place to have good Korean food and BBQ.

7DDIGUrwLUgPnfhMVc6QSw.text: Do not miss Hobak while in Las Vegas. They provide free water and slushies while you wait, which i not long and well worth it. You will find fast, efficient and friendly service accompanying amazing food. We had the beef sampler - brisket, rib eye, and skirt steak - all prepared to order at our table. For the record, all were cooked perfectly! The sides are plentiful so come with a healthy appetite. Lastly, save room for dessert - you won't be sorry. All in all, a great stop!

The wait is definitely worth it. While you wait, there are free slushies available and benches to sit on outside the restaurants, equipped with mists you can turn on if it's too hot.  The food: mouthwatering goodness. We ordered a small Hobak Family combo and I'd say it was one of the best Korean BBQ experiences I've had. We will definitely be back, but with our friends next time!

26u5-1sggQhsjXvfbVGeyg.text: First time here and will for sure being coming back. The food is amazing and the service is excellent. The two of us got the #3 and it was soo much food. They even cook the meat for you! It's definitely a fun pace for groups or couples.

nUlnhIcWJo8fdyiRjUnfaw.text: This KBBQ spot has very similar vibes as Quarters KBBQ in LA K-town, but with limitations.    The first thing I noticed immediately was that a good amount of the workers here were not Korean so a lot of them didn't recognize dishes when I mentioned them in Korean. It would be nice to be able to order dishes in Korean at a Korean restaurant. Imagine going to a Mexican restaurant and asking for Carne Asada and the person working there saying "The what?"  We ordered the Beef Combo w/ jumuluk and kot sal which is always my go to. The beef quality was above average but nothing too impressive. The complimentary doenjang jjigae seemed watered down and bland which was very disappointing. Also there isn't too much banchan provided alongside the meal.   I'm still gonna say that my favorite KBBQ spot in Vegas is Magal. They give you better quality cuts of meat for similar price and they are going to give you a wider array of banchan alongside your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TQl0KjYh9hREhu-p9j0yyA.text: Thank you my fellow yelpers! You guys were spot on in regards to this restaurant.  This place was so good. We came at 5 pm on a weekday and were immediately seated. Service was attentive and efficient.   We ordered a small combo recommended for two people. We opted for the brisket, angus beef short rib and marinated ribs (marinated with a tare sauce that is usually made with soy sauce, mirin cooking sake, ginger, garlic, scallions, and fruits). The meat quality is out of this world. Perfect marbling. I love their ban chans (side dishes)- steamed egg, jji gas (spicy stew), spicy marinated bean sprouts, sushi rice and wasabi to complement your brisket, kimchi (this could have been more fermented though), iceberg lettuce salad.  And as usual, side dishes can be refilled at Korean restaurants.   We also ordered a bottle of soju. There is something special about soju and gogi (meat) consumed together.  They ask how you like your meats cooked- brisket we like well done, the rest medium. It was nice having everything cooked for you.   At the end, ice cream is given- strawberry, vanilla, cookies and cream, mint, chocolate flavors. We had strawberry- it was sandwiched in between a light and crispy rice cake- ice cream rice cake cookie sandwich with a thin layer of red bean. Not too sweet and we both loved it.   They have korean pop music playing inside. There's a meat display inside. And an open kitchen. Restrooms are very clean- single rooms for women and men.   I would definitely come back here when the mood for KBBQ hits whenever I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry rice cake cookie ice cream sandwich

et3K7gETsNMBdaf8f7ytxg.text: Great service. Just had fun our server was the person who made the experience all the best. Shout out to TY. Food was amazing. My wife is Korean and the whole time she was saying that this place is very much like the restaurants in Korea. Well done!

sr3HN9l_0UDcX42nkQ2Vcw.text: The ambiance was nice and trendy. The food was delicious. We purposely chose to eat at non-buffet Korean BBQ.  We find that AUCE Korean BBQ places don't have good quality meat. So for the similar price, we prefer good quality meat. This place has great quality meat. We still prefer Kang Ho Dong Baek Jeong meat, but since LV doesn't have one, we chose this place. All the meats, side dishes had good flavor. It was very authentic korean tasting. We would come back when we visit LV.

uhoFZ-hAjPL6HYbHSGqEyg.text: Every time we come to Las Vegas we make a special trip off the strip and eat here. There is a butcher in the restaurant so you know you are getting the beat cuts. The waiters do everything for you and check up on you often. I would say that you will pay more than most of the all you can eat places and you will get less food (obviously) but the quality here is leaps above. We always get a family portion and leave more than satisfied.

1-RAqLxQoHpd5yqN36ffZw.text: This is the best Korean BBQ joint in Vegas! The service is great, the music is awesome, and the food is excellent!!! We usually order the set menu and we can never finish the meat. Our waitress and waiter help us grill our meat and change out our grill when it gets dirty. Hobak never disappoints.
