cOcrWHim-t6zHz1U0dJ98Q.text: Little expensive but overall high quality and great tasting food. Service is quick and platters are reasonably sized.

7bGWduJMYy8KNVj3dw1MkQ.text: Without a doubt, the best Korean BBQ experience in Vegas. There's really not much else to be said other than every aspect is top notch. The quality of meat is excellent. The service is excellent. The fact that they are open till 2am is excellent. There was even one time, where our group had one person who couldn't eat beef, and one person who couldn't eat pork sharing a grill....and they were even willing to accommodate that!   Even though it's not AYCE, you're still going to be very full after this meal. Great side dishes, the bean paste stew and steamed egg are delicious. I think paying a little more for Hobak rather than the standard AYCE korean bbq place is worth it due to the quality, service, and experience you get.

-3tJxldBGmEkfzo7Qy4wRg.text: This is the best kbbq spot in vegas, hands down! Great environment, great friendly staff thats is focused on making everyone feel like family. Then we get to the meal, amazing cuts of beef and pork and the sides (pancake and egg) are amazing!!! You must must must try this spot on your next vegas adventure.

neVqGNm7fi6qUyhDaOHSTg.text: Ronell awesome. Manager- please tell Nana not to tell people your bones will cause cancer for the customers pets. How awful. Food great, as usual. I think I may try another spot before coming here again. Service really interrupted my experience tonight. Again, Ronell was awesome.

W0DmEko-iI9TYmhVZD43hQ.text: This place was incredible. Like, just as good as famed KBBQ places I've visited in Korea. I was hoping it'd be delicious, but it exceeded my expectations, to be quite honest.  My boyfriend and I brought his father here for a first-time KBBQ experience. We got the Large Beef Combo. We ate every last damn bite of everything they brought out for us.  The meat was incredible. Very high quality beef, suuuuuuuuper lean - I hate going to KBBQ places only to find that half of the meat you grill is pure gristle!  Service was great. We did have to wait about 20 minutes for our table, but the servers were attentive, funny, and made our experience fun and comfortable. My BF's father loved every moment of this experience and adored the food - success!  I wish we had one of these in the midwest!!!!

_ezCg3kcV4s4l0S_K-2tnw.text: Wow I finally came back to this place...holy cow the food is awesome! Expect a long wait So this place they cook the food in front of you and u can't cook yourself. Nice setting. I think they are understaffed they were scrambling not to burn the food. My spicy pork was a little charred but I like it that way. BTW spicy pork is the best!

r_m7CmiPHk5BX-t07Dm8yQ.text: Hands down the best Korean BBQ joint in Vegas at the moment.  This place gets crowded fast, especially on weekends are holidays. Their dinner-for-two has the perfect amount of food for two and even comes with dessert.  The only issue I have about this place is that the service is hit-or-miss. There is no AYCE, but that's expected with better quality yakiniku places.  Don't miss out!

cJZ17y08G4H3GnAMxVO19A.text: This is by far the best Korean Restaurant in town and probably one of the best restaurants I have been to in Las Vegas.  Period.  Their service is less perfunctory and more like an experience, which lets be honest is really what a restaurant should be.  Maybe I just got lucky, but I was a waiter for years and I have never had such good service.  This alone would get them 5 stars       Yet it gets even better. Maybe this was just me, but do not be put off by looking at the menu online.  I internet trolled this restaurant before  going and thought "this doesn't really look all that great or filling" and I was unequivocally wrong.  For starters for the price, their meals are HUGE.  Like every other Korean Restaurant I have been to, it is like side dish explosion except this place the food just kept coming....and coming....and coming to the point where I had a concern that my bill was going to be like $100 for just be.  It wasn't that they just give you alot of food but their food is also creative and so Delicious.  Presentation.  Taste. Service.  All of it is spot on and puts every other restaurant in this price ranger to utter shame.   This is an amazing place, and frankly one of stronger Yelp recommendations I have given since I have used this service. Go here.  Eat.  Drink.  Have fun.  Bring friends.

a_-otXJ9WkDYNHDrPjUEfg.text: Fun times and cool place. Awesome atmosphere for a group. A little loud.

19PcodFDoibAeX22GQiQlA.text: The servers cook your food for you and they were always hovering around; depending on your dining style that could be a negative or positive. I really appreciated that my server attempted small talk, it shows he 's putting effort on his customer service.   This is a good place for a group of friends, or for someone celebrating their birthday. For the birthday celebrant, they play music overhead, the servers sing happy birthday and bring ice cream sandwiches with sparklers.   My husband and I got the beef and pork combo for two, and I felt that it was just enough to satiate our bellies. The seasoning of the meat was flavorful.   Lastly, details such as a toothbrush station in the bathroom and the ice cream sandwiches remind you that they are exerting effort to stand out and place a personal stamp on your dining experience.   Overall, I felt like even though it's a little more expensive than other restaurants, the customer service, flavoring and the atmosphere made it worth it. It has been awhile a restaurant had enough quirkiness to make me smile.   Pros: customer service, atmosphere, taste, ice cream sandwiches!  Cons: price

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream sandwiches

ltUyGbqqe8KUWirp0FcYCg.text: This place has super delish Korean BBQ, greatttt! Service and ambience! We ate here twice and loved the marinated skirt steak! So juicy, and soft!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t9xJQGyeYv9kJR7wSdq6vA.text: Overall a solid Korean BBQ place which I will visit it again but I have couple complains.  1. The line is always long and they don't do reservation which I can understand but they don't even let you call ahead to put your name on the waiting list. My house is about 20 mins from the restaurant and a week prior our first visit my wife and I tired to go there and we called and the wait was about an hour. We ended up went elsewhere but if they let us call in to put our name on the waiting list we probably would have gone.  2. Our servers were great for the most part expect one of them screwed up my pork belly. It was over cooked and it was dry. She turned the belly to early and the heat probably wasn't high enough in the first place. Now I got the negatives out of the way, here's what I like: Marinated skirt steak was very good, tender and juicy with great flavor.  Kimchi and the pan cake banchan were very good. The kimchi was not too strong but still has a nice flavor to it. But others banchan were just okay. One of the best things was the rice pop ice cream. It's not a culinary master piece but it was very fun to eat. Great texture contrast. It's like an ice cream sandwich with rice cake which was very crispy and then I  bit into it then I had the nice and creamy ice cream and then I felt some thing grainy which was the red bean paste(I think). All different kinds of texture in one bite. I like it a lot.  It's not the best high-end Korean BBQ but I found great value to take my kids and wife to there. But if just my wife and I for a date. I'll go to another Korean BBQ place which is my hands down favorite.

Hhy2h59_xKb4CzXBnEFO3A.text: Well. All I can honestly say is that this place is the very definition of perfect. I mean, the crew was phenomenal, the meat was juicy with every bite, and even the bathrooms had complimentary toothbrushes HAHAHA! even mouthwash for everyone with small cups, like what!? Where else do you see that!? I will definitely be returning very soon. Maybe even sooner than I think! xD

Oimp0Mevm6XhqvBlFj3jqA.text: Great Korean Barbecue with fast service!  The food was really good and we are not from Las Vegas but when we come back, we will revisit this place!

SCD_Fm9dHPCuGzwnP-PexQ.text: This was my 4th time here.  The quality of the meats is good and their service is quite high. There Korean side dishes were tasty with free refills.

SoUymPIGAzmrC_gVH70XkA.text: Food - there were 3 of us and we ordered the family combo #3. We really Liked the beef skirted meat and loved the spicy short rib. The spicy pork belly was ok.  Service- great service.  Side dishes - loved all the side dishes especially the pickled daikon and green onion w bean sprouts salad.

EH-E7dIu9rayk7UIroAoPA.text: We love Hobak and we go there often. Service has always been impeccable until tonight. We waited for an hour which is typical as this place is very popular. For some reason, we had to always call the attention of any servers to check on our dipping sauce, rice etc. after eating, we waited for a long time for a server to offer our dessert since we have one of the combos. When the server showed up, we just had to go and ask for the check. This is very surprising tonight how the service was. It will take my boyfriend and I few months to come back and try again. We work in the hospitality service industry and at first this place definitely meet our expectations. Tonight is a different Hobak.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZtBXGnmRdd5UjCaUo3oEig.text: On top of all Korean BBQ places I've been to in Las Vegas, this gets the first place. Addition to that, the place reminds me so much of South Korea. They have great service, as expected. The quality of the meat is good. I also love the banchan(sides), they have the sprouts with green onion or the sukjunamul-muchim. You get steamed eggs with the family combo, which we had. Also, you'll get beef stew. The kimchi is okay. The price is just right for what you get which is definitely worth it. I love the vibe all in all. I would 100% recommend it to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This definitely reminds me of bbq places in Seoul!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was packed after I took this photo.
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea ice cream on freshly made crispies with red bean paste

6DpumGT4gmJth_Nscz7tKw.text: Awesome authentic Korean BBQ.   I must say the Managers and staff are top notch.   Get here early or you'll be waiting out in the heat...though they do provide FREE lemon and cherry slushies :0) Even though there were customers clamoring to get in, we never felt pressured or hurried...shows they care about their customers" experience over making a few extra dollars.  The only negatives would be that they need to up their banchan game and their egg dish was slightly overdone. As for the meats....extremely fresh and marinated really well....we had both marinated and not. We liked variety so we got the family set....1 large and 1 medium to accommodate 6 adults and 1 child.  We had the beef and pork combos.   Rice is complimentary but you have to request it.  If you are new to Korean BBQ, the waiters cook your meats for you by default unless you choose to do it yourself.   Come casual, don't wear your best because you'll come out smelling smoky.

mDfZHcOykhz3ifSkQIMdyA.text: Update!!! You know this place is good when you come for dinner and there's a film crew filming Andrew Zimmern eating KBBQ :D

xr-yIXZIzkoMEmdYft-uFg.text: Cool, fun place especially for groups.  We lived in Seoul and this is a great reminder of those days. Makeoli and the family combo 3 hit the spot for our group.  The place gets busy after 7, so if you don't want to wait, come before then.

2jU8I6VbOVgrI5gnD3hKKA.text: Great place for BBQ and they cook the food for you!! Got there after 5 pm and was seated within 5 min. Definitely got crowded by the time we completed dinner. We chose the Hobak Beef Combo(Angus Brisket, Rib eye and aged short ribs). The best of the 3 was the short ribs by far. Had about 1/2 left of the short ribs to go with the sushi rice & Kim Chee and it was my snack the next morning flight back home. The servers was exceptional at cooking and explaining each dish. The rice pop mango dessert hit the spot.

UFoKaTlvc2YIozqt53M6zA.text: I would have rated this place 5 stars if I didn't feel so rushed to eat. Unlike other Korean bbq places I have been to, the servers here cooked your food for you. Although the idea is nice, my family and I would have preferred to cook ourselves so we can enjoy our meal and company. The meats were fresh and the service was very attentive. The place also provided dental kits, which I thought was a nice touch. I would go back again, but I still prefer Gangnam Korean BBQ when in Vegas.

vMMwAYnV3NaSeJC1ZOcekA.text: Great Korean BBQ in Las Vegas! Meat is good, especially the angus boneless short rib. Look for Nana, very kind and helpful waitress that will recommend you the right kind of meat!! Cheers

-JTMVOwP8a05nCk9ZYz73A.text: I wont tell you how awesome this place is (sorry it is already too crowded). Just a hint: it has free ice cream cake if you order combo meal.

kWYlyct1fypdDM07vIrHEw.text: We tried the large combo for a family of 4. It was a lot of food for us but was probably meant for 3-4 adults. Everything was good, our kids really liked the ice cream sandwiches that were included. It just took a long time for the servers to come back for the ice cream order and to bring the check. We had to ask for assistance since the call button didn't work. Other than that the servers were really attentive. We almost felt our server went on break or something, we didn't see her again...

Bh951Ayh3exl8OusMTo_Dg.text: Omg!Hobak just became my favorite Korean BBQ place in town!! The meats are so best quality, the customer service were sooooooooo good!!! Our server is James and we love him soooo much, he provides a really really good customer service, he is definitely one of the reason we want to come back!!

wzE-4H3oYsaFcVybrT4c1Q.text: Big fan of The Old Homestead, but the marinated short ribs at this Korean BBq restaurant  kicks ass!   Very good service and great atmosphere.  Will definately be back to try the beef combo!

CYvbqXoqKxewZOI7igMGdg.text: We absolutely loved this place! The employees were so welcoming,  very attentive, the food was amazing and definitely affordable for being able to eat a variety of meat AND it being cooked for you! The vibes inside this place was great! I definitely recommend!

kSYirZ3JOFxnZGm9FSQe7A.text: Went to Hobak for the first time Friday night. Got there around 820, the wait was expected. 30-40 minute wait was actually an hour. We had a party of 4 1/2 (10 yo doesn't eat much) and settled on the Beef/Pork combo and an order of brisket. Not an AYCE joint :(. My favorites were the aged Angus and skirt steak. I wasn't impressed with the banchan, not much choices. The servers were very attentive but I prefer to cook my own meat. The hubby kept picking up the tongs to turn the meat and our server would turn up out of nowhere and take over. Dessert comes with the combo, rice pop ice cream. We decided on green tea and plum wine. I recommend the plum wine. Sooo yummy. Overall it was a nice experience, cute setup and great service. I'll stick to AYCE Kbbq though.

g1611ZNCSS_XwaskVIATig.text: Amazing amazing amazing! We were complete newbies and had NO CLUE how to do anything, but our waitress Jamie was super nice and helped us figure it out. We split a small family combo between 4 people and felt like it was a good portion for each of us. The beef is. So. Delicious! Highly recommend :)

4aa5CLmfeSwDuBi4etB4PQ.text: This is not an ACYE Korean BBQ but either ala carte. However if you get a combo it is definitely enough food for normal people. The quality of the meat is what you are paying for and it is definitely worth it. Marinated skirt steak is must.

w8tEJerI0i_9m9Y6N9HuYA.text: Great service and the food was amazing. We had a big party total of 10. We ordered 2 large family combos and we still had left overs. I would recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing

5Wy90mJqhpvW9_Dnn1e-xg.text: This place is amazing!! Our server Denise was the bomb! She was very attentive to our tables and she able to manager several other while we visited this restaurant! She was very polite and on point with her customer service. We will definitely come back here just for Denise!

w8Of1o88y42IGySUIQl50g.text: Great Korean food!!!! It is mother's day today and tons of people in line but still the wait was not bad.  Very busy but still the service is very good.  Everybody is working like a well-oiled machine.  Felt rushed tho.   Will come again with friends next time.

Aw77NYOlUV7Jhzr_4m2SVg.text: Wait time was very short and the service was great! I went with 5 other people and we ordered the large platter for $98. It's recommendation was 3-4 people but it was enough to satisfy all 6 of us. The meat was fresh and wasn't frozen. The servers cooked the food for us in entrees and we were always wanting more. Definitely bringing more people here!

ClB1k1XIcoYy1bbz3a79-A.text: Wow! This place is all around fantastic. The food was amazing, portions were massive,  the decor and ambiance was wonderful, and the service was impeccable. I don't have a single bad thing to say.  Definitely will be back and will bring friends. (because you'll need them to help you finish it all! )

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Th9tqmE3FstossuKWP2j0g.text: I've heard a lot of positive things about Hobak so I decided to try for myself. We were seated pretty quickly despite it being dinner time. While you wait, they serve slush for free so you can cool down from the summer heat. The interior looks great and unique compared to other kbbq's in town. You can definitely taste the quality difference with the meats compared to any ayce. It's a lot better! They also change the grill depending on the meat that is being served so most of them are tailored to cook specific meat. To top it all off, the service we received was great! Nari explained everything to us and made us feel welcome. She and Ryan served us really well!! I would definitely come here again. (:

0VdNV-x-A5xY7PluRhzyIg.text: Best Korean BBQ in town! Fragrant charcoal smoldering on the grill flavoring the awesome protein to perfection! Plenty of tasty bottomless side dishes too. Long lines unless you arrive early. Worth the wait, best Korean BBQ in LV.

j6GRB2PDlujtgDJkQbflqw.text: Just spent the last 2 yrs living in Korea and thank fully theres a place in Las Vegas that has the exact taste that I love of Korea.   All is legit, from the drinks, the layout of the restaurant that reminds me of the years I've spent in Korea.   I would want to say no one go, so I'd have less of a wait to eat, but I can't do that. hahah  It is slightly pricey, but honestly it doesn't stop me from wanting to go again and again.

uZo4hRwn3_AuGcJqr5V4gA.text: Fave Korean restaurant in this city! Can't go wrong with marinated meat with delicious sides. Our faves are the marinated short rib and spicy marinated black angus beef!!! So flavorful! I Love coming here!

lcjQBVX4SyOl-6nVs9LEYg.text: Awesome service! Our waitress cooked everything for us, she explained what everything is and how to eat it. She was very nice and friendly. Her name was gela. Thank you gela for the great and informative dining experience.   We ordered both beef and pork packages. I preferred the beef but the marinated pork was great too.  Oh and free slushies while you wait to be seated too!!!

mJP7KnjOS-Nd5_hIkL0AHg.text: Service quality has dropped. Wait staff now is unable to properly cook the meat. I don't appreciate them throwing my food around on the grill (and having it fall on the table) and over-cooking it to the point of it being dry and jerky-like. Especially for the price they charge. I don't know why the sever had to throw the tongs on the table every time he "cooks"/throws our meat.

8zb53L3MxTOoySJRKM-peQ.text: First I have to say... this was my first Korean BBQ experience, so I have nothing to compare it to. That's being said, it won't be my last and I probably don't need to go anywhere else. Wow!!!!! GREAT food. GREAT service. The waitstaff was attentive and helpful and answered all my questions. The meat was so tender - and they cook it for you- right in front of you. They brought endless supplies of the accruements like kimchi. The only thing that would be better... they don't take reservations and it's always busy. Def worth the wait though!

pWIMXDOhTcfYXcxQ1Idnkg.text: This place was fun and inexpensive. The service was good and the place was clean. The meat was good but not the best quality. The kalbi was very fatty (more fatty than normal) but the taste was great. The banchan was very skimpy though. One of the fun parts of Korean food is the plethora of banchan but not here. And they didn't refill any banchan (not even the kimchi)   All in all it was pretty good but don't think I would make a special trip out to Chinatown for this place. After living in NYC and houston, I've had "to die for" Korean BBQ (albeit for 3x more). So if you're looking for a fairly inexpensive group dinner and you happen to be in the area, this isn't a bad choice.

o7eGy6N05ljAEVGIDgpVkg.text: Pretty large restaurant with really great service. Servers here will cook your meat for you and change the grill without you asking.   We were a party of 7 and came at 5 to beat the dinner crowd and luckily we came early because around 6, a lot of people started to come and by 6:30 there was a long wait. Our table was set up for us before we sat down and we decided to order 2 family combos $84.99 each, good for about 3-4 people. I didn't think it would be enough for 7 people because I saw that it only comes with marinated skirt steak, aged short ribs, aged pork ribs and spicy pork belly. It also came with tofu soup and steamed egg.   I'm used to AYCE kbbq, and in LA there are a TON but the meat quality and service isn't as good as Hobak. I didn't like how they only gave you 1 bean paste stew and 1 steamed egg per order. It was enough for the 7 of us though but we also ordered a kimchee stew and corn cheese. Also, they don't have rice paper or radish paper here. Side dishes were ok, kimchee was good, not super fermented/sour which is how I like it.   5/5 for the marinated skirt steak. It wasn't too fatty and literally melted in my mouth.  3/5 for the short ribs and pork ribs.  1/5 for the spicy pork belly. I think only one person at the table thought it was decent. Everyone else didn't care much for it. We took the portions to go.   Next time, I think I'll stick to the BEEF combo. Everything was so well marinated that we didn't need to dip our meat into the brisket sauce that they offered. They also have a sea salt and sesame oil mix as well. After the meal, we were asked what kind of ice cream we wanted and we were given the options of: mango, plum, green tea, vanilla and something else. We got green tea and plum. I guess its a rice ice cream sandwich sort of thing. My friends didn't like the outside so they just ate the ice cream inside.   I liked how they have air vents that moved up and down directly over the grill so smoke doesn't go everywhere. In the bathroom there are toothbrushes, cups and mouthwash for you to use after your meal.   Everyone was STUFFED by the time we finished eating. The bill came out to be about $222 before tip for the 2 family combos, corn cheese ($3.99), kimchee stew ($7.99), 6 sodas, and 1 sake which isn't bad!

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8R2RDnPIO75UvG2qJeeW6w.text: So far this is the best korean food in town..meat was very tender..and the service was awesome!

fkJSy6UIzLyoWb4bYxvXoA.text: Hobak is one of the best Korean BBQ spots in town. The quality of their meat and their service is why we keep coming back.

5xpWU_KL4Hhe8sEmE_ggWw.text: What a great experience. The service was top notch and the food was amazing. If you like Korean BBQ, you have to try this place. I'll be back!

abgmIz-yMgbFAZLBDrLIkQ.text: A must go to if you love Korean BBQ!   We heard of this place through a friend and wanted to try it for ourselves.  Definitely did not disappoint!  Everthing from the service to the decor was on point.  And of course the food!  Wow!  Just found our new place for Korean BBQ!  5 stars all the way!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I6S5jRiMaC0cTPLR5dEQOw.text: One of the best places hands down. I'm astounded by the incredibly amazing service! Our server, Nhi, was so nice and always asked us how everything was. She always checked up on us and cooked the meat perfectly (which we were grateful for -- cooking is not my forte.) Aside from the phenomenal service, everything was super tasty...and there was SO MUCH OF IT! In a table of seven, everyone left more than full and satisfied. Not to mention, they even offered additional red bean ice cream, which was a delight all in itself. Next time we stop by Las Vegas, I'll definitely drop by here!

yLDlCdlpSGx_cGkL5Q3rpQ.text: The Korean bbq was amazing. Every meat order was delicious. You can not go wrong with anything you order. A must eat for locals and tourist. Even if you are a first time Korean bbq eater you will definitely love this place. I did not even mention how great the desert was after. Full experience from start to finish.

MKDtgtaOr2m35g1cYROHUA.text: This place was AMAZING!!!! The food was TO DIE FOR! The service was out of this world! Without a doubt Hobak has earned every positive review. This is now my favorite restaurant to take people to here in Las Vegas!

MgpiwCNtyPITSI-egDHTCA.text: Spoke with the restaurant 2 times, including this morning, and confirmed our reservation for a large party.  Our crew is in from out of town and came from the strip to try this place. When we arrived, they said they didn't take reservations, that there was a 90 minute wait for a table, and the manager was really mean to our friends.   Would give this 0 stars if I could because of the customer service. Thanks for wasting 50 of our dollars on Ubers.   The frozen drink machine looked gross anyways. I think we dodged a bullet.

8AfKCp8nvOaCUZe8hw3cyg.text: This review is mainly about the lousy service.  Food is okay had better.  But when cheese is added it brings the taste to a different level.  The person cooking was great.  Jonathan did a good job.  As for the rest of the items that came with our meal it never came and had to ask several times to have them deliver the food.  So nothing happened until the lady with the yellow band around her arm finally took care of it.  But overall they could have done better. I think everyone got good service except us.

LQQIR6TJaCkMaJzuU62ppA.text: Great food and service but it was REALLY hot! Short rib and spicy skirt steak and squid were our favorite!

l4C8db5_1W20czrb0Iu_Rw.text: Came here with my friend and didn't need reservations. All the workers are fairly young, but accommodating. We ordered from the combo menu that was around $60 for two people, which isn't too bad. We ordered the Family Combo #1, which is designed for 2 and included: brisket, pork belly, pork rib, and spicy boneless shortrib. We had the steamed egg, which was tasteless and the stew that was pretty good. I had to order my cheese corn because that's my favorite at any kbbq, but the corn was a little overly cooked because they were dry. However, the taste was still there. We left too full to finish the pork belly, but the briskets were my dealbreaker. They were too big of a slice and not cut thin enough so it was chewy. The ice cream they served at the end was also very unique because it was a thin crispy texture with ice cream in the middle - rice pop ice cream. They accidentally brought us two, so we got one on the house. Very far from the strip and a bit hard to find by rideshare.

hvvpVSyHc18fo0m233-2yg.text: Really enjoyed the food here at Hobak. Great service and variety of food for all. Great spot to go with friends and catch up. The only downside is that sometimes when it is busy the wait can be long because they don't allow for reservations. Overall it's a fun place to go and I appreciate how the severs are fast when ever you have a request. I'm hooked on Korean BBQ!

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ctYD0-5SaEOPFympaY5p6w.text: Best KBBQ I've had. Please consider opening one in LA. I couldn't find KBBQ joints are have aged beef/pork that are priced so reasonably. Please.

QaUpL5tVCGiswTi32tGjHg.text: Clean, fresh and friendly service. The food was delicious. Ice cream green tea at the end is a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iHwdtWts3Is6L7q8f4ItSg.text: We ordered the Beef combo and thought wow, that's all the meat that comes with it? Like, that isn't gonna fill us up. Plate of brisket, some angus short ribs and aged short ribs. But it actually did. The bean paste soup was the bomb and all the side dishes. The servers were super nice, loved the kpop music in the background and everything was like the set up at Korean restaurants in Seoul. However the waiting area is very small inside. It was 110 degrees outside and the waiting area outside was full too. The quality of meat was EXCELLENT!!! Will definitely be visiting Hobak again soon.

OLFSQ4OyFdMgYDAQg8Uk3w.text: It was my first time attending a KBBQ, so when I was being attended, I asked how to eat the meat and all the other things that were layed out on the table. They gladly explained everything and also showed me how to hold the chopsticks correctly.   The atmosphere of the restaurant is great and everyone's so kind. The food is great! Totally recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MAWASeWA73uE-Rt1sUieIw.text: Hobak Korean BBQ is by far the best Korean BBQ I've ever had, and this is a lot considering I am 100% Korean and have had my fair share of Korean BBQ.   It's one of the newer BBQ joints and completely outshines tofu hut, Goong etc. The meat itself is extremely tender and they butcher their own meat where you can come and purchase yourself.   When we come here we also get the marinated beef and spicy marinated beef. The banchan (Korean word for appetizers) are always fresh and endless.   The service here is impeccable with the employees constantly rotating so you don't have to worry about flagging down your server since all of them help. They also have a service button at each table should you need something. In addition they all wear radios so they are constantly in communication.   You can tell this isn't like any other Korean BBQ they cater to both the Korean culture and American one. Another positive to hobak is they also cook your food for you! Most places bring you the food and make you cook yourself.   To add they have complimentary popcorn and beverages for when you are waiting for your table to be ready.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q1k87ZGe2wfAYdheTdI3eQ.text: Legit my favorite kbbq place in Vegas... honestly better than the restaurants in ktown.. what made it such a great experience here was our server John who was super attentive and was super nice and fast about everything! Also the gogi quality for all the different types we ate was on point!! Lasly the soups were just right - bean paste soup and gochujang jjigae I will definitely come here again with my family

Ehzi7CpJM16xR8Dx72s-oQ.text: Today was my first time here while vacationing in Las Vegas! We ordered Family combo 3 and it was just perfect for five girls! First thing, our meat quality was SUPERIOR - super soft too! I wish there was a place like this in ktown la. Secondly, John was our server today and he is by far the best and super attentive.

38BuW7Sz_u8ByRqw3hGg-A.text: Great service, quality and taste. They grill the meats for you so you can enjoy eating without doing the work.

l51V0YopT7nyvdj91q2L8Q.text: O.M.G. O.M.G. O.M.G.  This was such a great break from SLC's poor excuse for Korean BBQ. It was very reminiscent of the Korean BBQ joints in LA's Korea Town.   The restaurant was bustling and yet had great service. The prices were incredibly reasonable and the food came in copious quantities.   The meat was amazing! It was so flavorful, the marinated ones were marinated to perfection - as was the way they cooked them. I normally like to cook my own meat, but our server had it down pat and there was no reason to mess with perfection.  I am planning my next Vegas trip solely for Chinatown and it's amazing restaurants.

uUGF5P3tUquQZzQWigLCzw.text: Lives up to the rating... Lively atmosphere.... Hip & Trendy design ... Fresh ingredients ... Friendly Staff ... (Thank you Annabelle) And, too much goodness to consume...

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert - oh so yummy!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In a nice nondescript commercial strip mall..Place is packed ... Worth the wait!

cd8lsg4iLP3lJVSZXXBNtQ.text: I was skeptical of a non-AYCE Korean BBQ place being worth it but it definitely was.   We ordered 3 large combos for 10 people and the servers took care of everything, from cooking/cutting the meat to distributing it to other ends of the table. They were very prompt with providing banchan/water refills. All of the meat was good and the ice cream at the end was a great way to end the meal.  The bathroom was also a step above. It was clean and they provided disposable toothbrushes and mouthwash.   Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll definitely try to stop by again.

pTlzTAEoVpMh6aczXaD3wA.text: Hubby and I cruised into town early afternoon last Friday and decided to give Hobak a go.  A quick call revealed that there was no wait.  What!  Cool!  The place is pretty neato looking....exposed ceiling, concrete floors and those cool pull-down exhausts.  Although there's no wait, it did take a few minutes to get seated because they prefer to set up the table with banchan and water before the seat the guest.  We were starvin' Marvin so we got the small beef combo. I went to restroom while hubby ordered and the server asked if we were very hungry, hubby said always so we were recommended the ribeye and marinated short rib.  I know some Yelpers really recommended the skirt steak but oh well!  Food came...brisket and rib-eye were amaaaazing.  The short rib was incredibly tender ("How is this beef?"), likely because it had been aged and tenderized by the marinade. Hubby and I didn't much care for the marinade but it was still delicious beef.  Other cool stuff: - Bean sprout banchan  - Pancake - Disposable toothbrushes in restrooms - Delicious bibimbap lunch box, shaken tableside like at Kang Ho Dong Baekjong - Most amazing yet simple dessert of green tea ice cream with red bean paste and peanut powder on rice crackers. - Service was great.  There was a slight communication error simply because they were eager to serve.  We told one guy to hold off cooking our meat for 10 minutes but right after he left, a lady came by and started throwing the meat on the grill.  Other notes:  Rice is not included in the meal but THEY DO NOT CHARGE FOR IT.  They just don't automatically give it to you but it is cheerfully offered.  Final note:  If you have a large appetite, the small meal was juuuuuuust right.  Hubby and I felt like if we hadn't each had a bowl of rice as well as the extra bibimbap lunchbox, we probably could have had another meal afterwards.  For those with smaller appetites, I would say, this may feed 2.5 people.  Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great dessert, green tea ice cream sandwiches
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flames!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye

oLZVofbJUE0yWNn_iJATpg.text: love this place for kbbq! def come for the quality of meat and relaxed fun Korean vibes~  been here a bunch of times and even when it's busy, we've never had to wait too long but either way I would definitely wait  usually get the beef combos and additional meats to share with a large group and they also give a bean paste stew and steamed egg which are both delicious. the meats are all really good - if I had to choose one, it would be the boneless short ribs  service is very friendly and they cook your meat for you. when it gets busy they don't come around as often, also wish they gave more refills on the corn cheese  interior is nicely done and well thought out - they incorporate pieces to give the space a Korean street style vibe and love that they play kpop music with music videos playing on the tvs  they also give free snack (popcorn/slush/etc) while you wait and they have mouthwash and toothbrushes in the bathrooms! Extra stars for execution and thoughtfulness of this restaurant

yns83nhLekVKMETuTI3pGw.text: I first came here around a year ago and did not like it much at all. Since then everyone always raved about how its the best kbbq in the area, so it was time to give them a second try. This time was much better! Our waitress was great. She was quick, attentive, and had us laughing a few times too. The meat was all great quality and tasted delicious. My only complaints were the side dishes were't my favorite and the meal was expensive. If you're looking to treat yourself or celebrate, Hobak is a great place and I'm glad I gave it a second chance.

4cBB_sYaBPz8yVpX5yEdsw.text: This place has to be my favorite KBBQ place period. I always like to come here on special occasions and I also brought a ton of friends from out of town to eat here saying it's one of the best food they ever had~! They left super happy and full, I know most places nowadays are "all you can eat" but if you want quality over quantity I would always go here~! Also considering the fact I don't eat that much. Overall great service, fantastic food and awesome times~!

N1Z1Iddx-m1quJrA41UC_A.text: Step 1: Stop checking out Yelp reviews and drive to Hobak. Like right now, please. Step 2: Put your name on the list, and okay-- now you can read more reviews while you wait!  I'm obsessed with KBBQ, and while I was initially skeptical that it could be THAT good, this has got to be the best KBBQ I've ever had. I had Hobak for dinner last night, but I'm dreaming about it today still.  1. Everyone else knows the hype is real. Line is long at peak hours. 2. Pick your combo. The short rib (kalbi) and skirt steak are AMAZING! Everything melts in your mouth!  3. Your server cooks it for you to perfection. Our guy, James, was incredible. Genuine vibes, so nice, and funny. He's rocking a sweet K-Pop frosted hairdo, so you can't miss him.   Even though it's not AYCE, we went home with hardcore leftovers after eating and eating and eating. I like how they cook each meat individually and wait for you to finish a round before continuing; normally not a fan of people cooking it for me since they dump it ALL on the grill at once, and it gets cold before I can eat it.  The quality is the food is so good.  Banchan unlimited, of course.   The staff here will truly make a good experience great. Since table turnover is a lot less (you'll end up spending two hours here), I'd recommend hooking your staff up with a killer gratuity if they did good by you. My first trip to Hobak was 5 star service that deserves 5 star appreciation!

39nZSPgmOLQI413OC-tKsA.text: Came here a second time with a friend on a Monday evening. Lots of people waiting. We waited give or take 30 - 60 minutes. Lost track of time xD   We were sat in the front corner but middle tables.   Service was great as usual. We had got the Family Combo this time around because friend wanted some pork.   Hobak Family Combo ($51.99 for Small, $84.99 for Large) - Hobak Marinated Skirt Steak, Hobak Aged Short Ribs, Angus Boneless Short Ribs, Grilled Spicy Pork Belly, Bean Paste Stew, Steamed Egg, Vegetables, Cheddar Cheese, and Rice Pop Ice Cream  We had also ordered a Peach Soju to drink for fun :) It tasted pretty good. One of the better flavored soju's i've had so far (including the red and blue ive had in Seoul in April, 2016). I still Q_Q at the price difference though... Lol   We were notified before things were coming out that they had ran out of the Angus Boneless Short Ribs which now i realized was a little contradictory because they gave me the option of Aged Short Rib not being available and able to get the boneless short rib or rib eye at an additional cost of $4 or brisket or angus short rib. But i still ordered the angus boneless short rib. Now im confused at the time of writing this review ?!?? LOL   WELL no matter. English barrier i guess.   I had been told by a coworker that the bean paste stew and steamed egg were unlimited refillable but being 2 people, we were quite stuffed and satisfied with just our order.   All the meats were amazing. The marinated skirt steak was amazingly flavored. Nice and light. Not too sweet or savory like most american KBBQ places. Reminded me of Seoul, Korea.   According to my friend, the grilled spicy pork belly was a bit spicy for her to handle. Yet she was able to eat the green onion salad. So those who don't eat much spiciness, be aware.   Short ribs both beef and pork were amazingly tender and well cooked.   Quite the amount of food for 2 people. We both food coma'ed after we went home.   I love the fact i dont have to cook... AT ALL ! at this place. Makes me lazy but i can focus on talking to friend(s).   Still my highly recommended place for people to try out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yZh-M0Ow3viSm3NRJu7qIA.text: omg YES. This is how Korean BBQ should be. I don't have to work. I just put food in my mouth and look at the Korean movie posters decorating the walls and watching their TV ads repeatedly on the 2 TVs  The meat is high quality and deliciously marinated. The family meals are not a bad deal. I think with tax and tip, it ended up being $35/person and we were STUFFED at the end, not bad compared to what I could look up about AYCE KBBQ in the area. The staff is always there and making sure you have all the banchan and water that you could ever want. The rice pop ice cream dessert concoction is incredible and I wish I could get that as a standalone dessert somewhere :(. It's a rice cracker (think maybe those like shrimp crackers without the shrimpy flavor) with strawberry syrup/red bean paste, and ice cream bundled up in an ice cream sandwich-like dessert. Both green tea and vanilla were tasty but I think vanilla won in the end. Also 10% off if you go in for lunch and the place was empty!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yleb9d9nKXkCXk11_5ed_g.text: Hobak Korean BBQ's rise in popularity in such a short timespan is well deserved.  I brought my family here during Hobak's opening weekend last month and we were not disappointed.   From the amicable and helpful staff, the retro-polished look of the restaurant, and the delicious assortment of BBQ, I would highly recommend this place.     Upon arrival, the wait for a table was minuscule and we were offered one of two slushie type drinks while we waited.  This place is not an all-you-can-eat spot but you get a hefty portion of meat for the price you do pay.   Different combinations on the menu and various pricing will land your table meats which may include beef, pork, chicken, etc.   We did the mixed beef and pork option for two people and it was a carnivore's dream.  The accompanying side dishes were fairly good.  The kimchee was delicious as was the steamed egg.  We did have to ask for rice (which ended up being free of charge) as it was not initially served to us.    The servers cook all your food right at your table in an encircled grill.  This was reminiscent to the NYC Korean BBQ spots I've tried though I do miss being able to cook the meat ourselves.  Like in NYC, I did see Yukhoe (seasoned raw beef with raw egg) offered and I'll have to order it next time to compare!  As far as I know, it's the only Korean place I know that serves this.  Dessert was included in the food option we chose which was ice cream sandwiched between rice popcorn-type rice cakes. It was great.  One more "above and beyond" service provided can be found in their bathrooms.  Mouthwash, packaged toothbrush and toothpaste, and mints can be found for those fighting the war on bad breath and cavities.    Overall, Hobak is a great and welcome addition to the sea of Korean bbq spots opening all over the Vegas valley.  Unlike many others, though, Hobak is making a convincing argument of who really is the best Korean bbq spot in town.  Yelp 100 Challenge 2016 - 25/100

vk-In2WNNUh67rol3UMDPA.text: Very well-deserved 5 stars!  Came here on a weekday early afternoon to see that a good handful of the tables filled. But that didn't stop the amazing service at this place! Once you walk in, a hostess will take your party size and offer you free slushie while you wait for your table to be ready.  We went with the Small Hobak Family Combo. You get a good amount of meat per plate as the servers bring and prepare one after another. Keep in mind that the servers will pretty much do all of the cooking so all you have to do is sit back and enjoy the food! If you try to even touch the tongs, you'll see that the they'll use their walkie talkies to alert one another followed by someone coming quickly to your table to offer assistance! (Shout-out to our gr8 servers Cody and Ryan!)  Hobak serves different banchans compared to other KBBQ places! Their bean sprout salad definitely takes the cake. It had a slight kick and it was so tasty on its own or with the meat. Meat-wise, the skirt steak was probably my favorite. Go try it for yourself and you'll see why (': But my favorite was definitely the dessert! It was a scoop of ice cream sandwiched between two Korean rice pop cake with red bean paste and strawberry jam. Never had anything like it before and I was SO amazed.  Just an FYI, this is not an AYCE place. But what you don't get in quantity, you get in quality. Plus, we were pretty much filled with all the other items included in each combo!  Definitely will see us soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior (POV)
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert!

8y_xXDw8c7zJHPZl4Q7OnA.text: Being a Korean in Las Vegas we all know that when it comes to korean bbq recommendations we all say ," it sucks here! just go to Los Angeles!" BUT FINALLY a place I can tell my friends to go to.  Setting: The interior is basically that of 1980's Korea with the classic high school camo uniform you'll see the servers wearing. The decor reminds me of how soyo's is set up but less post war appearing haha. The restaurant is nicely spaced out with non bbq options available but really you came here for one thing and that's to bbq! The bathrooms are nice and stocked with disposable toothbrushes, and toothpaste to get rid of that post bbq dank breath. Each bbq table has an retractable vent that ventilates the smoke very well but I'd leave that up to the servers to adjust.  Food: You can order the meats individually but I highly recommend ordering the set. Me and my friend opted for the beef set which made us beyond full $51 i believe. The black angus was nicely tender with good amount of marbling to give it that buttery consistency. The side dishes which i typically ignore, I couldn't at this place. Kimchi was really authentic with thick sauce that coats each leaf of radish. Water kimchi was perfectly sour and refreshing when sipping on. The brisket isn't the best but still better than most places in Las Vegas. Here they offer a cup of melted cheese to dip the brisket in which I found great.  The ribeye and the marinated beef ribs were on point! I wish I could've had more room to finish it.  Dessert: Is a korean rice cracker with red bean spread and a thick helping of vanilla or green tea ice cream all put together to create this delicious ice cream sandwich. I recommend going with the green tea.  Service: Never have I been to a Korean bbq place where the servers YES the servers can grill all the meat and cut it for you too! Usually it's my job to do that but very convenient to sit back and have them to all the work for me  Overall: The overall 5 star rating is justified and Hobak is THE korean bbq place in Las Vegas. Come on a weekday and call ahead, this place will get packed!

vX63wMNCdAS3GCtyZRVSfw.text: If you've seen my review on 8ounce, you know I get very tired of KBBQ very quickly. This is the second exception. This meat is also very tender and the restaurant has a very playful environment. However, it can get a bit loud sometimes, so if you want to have a close convo with someone, I recommend sitting VERY close to them. I would recommend their marinated beef. Hope this helps!

YaJOfbRPNCnU34hqezs7bA.text: This is a very impressive Korean BBQ place rated five stars from over one hundred reviews! I couldn't resist since it's scarce in Vegas to find a good quality Korean BBQ place. The newbie on the block, Hobak made it on my list for stupendous quality of meat and service!  - FREE slushies while you wait for your table - You walk towards your table and the entire staff     welcomes you - Table is ready with side dishes, water, and all     the fixins - Affordable prices, simple menu and three      different combos to choose from - Charcoal and gas grill combo are used - Server does the grilling and the meat cutting - Grill is changed often - Quality and flavor of meats are superb!   (Highlight: skirt steak and spicy pork belly 2          thumbs up) - Oral hygiene supplies are complimentary in     restroom areas  On a little side note.. I felt the round table was cramped for a party of four with all the dishes on the table. Although the banchan they offered were not all that bad, I prefer other options. The server does all the grilling and the cutting, but would rather do the work myself. To pull all things together, Hobak gave me a lasting impression that has persuaded me to come back for more! Hobak Korean BBQ newbie!                       You've earned my 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oral Hygiene Treats = Awesome!

b9nQk6jHVKXd1mC0ukaNwg.text: If you want some good Korean BBQ, you have to check out this place. No wonder we had to wait (only 20 minutes) before getting a table on a regular weeknight. Restaurant was clean and at each table, there was this vent that was above each stove. I thought that was cool since I don't really see that at most BBQ places. Service was wonderful and I never felt that we had to flag down someone before our meat caught on fire.  The side dishes were seasoned well and addicting. I had to pace myself because I knew I was going to get full before the actual meat came out. For BBQ, we chose the family combo #1 which came out with 3 meats. The way they cooked our meat was one meat at a time. By the time the 3rd meat was cooking, I was getting full. But the meat was so tender and flavourful that I had to eat it all. It was sooo worth it in the end despite the stomach pain later.   And if you think you can't make room for dessert, well you better. They give out complementary ice cream sandwich which was also good. The sandwich part was crunchy, cripsy, and addicting. Come check out this place if you are in the area!

3XGlgW_IsGGP-YBXhVV6Ag.text: Our server, Ryan is great! Such great service and paid attention to every detail. He made sure to cut and cook our meat perfectly. The quality is good and price is reasonable. Happy to find a good kbbq restaurant in Vegas!

9uFmxrBT8dfLAm7EP-rUCg.text: This is my second time at a Korean bbq restaurant (my first time wasn't good). This place has completely changed my mind! It was awesome! The food is sooooo good. The customer service is wonderful! And the atmosphere is so fun! My husband and I did one of the combo platters and a side dish. It was a lot of food (for me) but we have plenty of left overs! I highly recommend coming here. The price isn't bad (especially for a group of people). Connie was so helpful! She took the time to answer our questions and was so friendly! We will definitely come back.

_aVXzEMRIxpDmYNEOHNV1g.text: I was stationed in Korea for 2 years and it's been a decade since. I have always been looking for some traditional Korean goodness. My girlfriend and I saw that Hobak received a 5 star review overall. I was excited and we went. I was instantly transported back to Seoul! Very warm, attentive staff. The interior was very well thought out, and appropriate. Restrooms were a trip, lol. And very clean! The meal... We got the family dinner combo for 2. If you like Korean you will be super impressed!! Not only the best Korean meal, but one of my top 10 ever!!! We left very full and happy. Do not, I repeat... DO NOT MISS OUT ON DESSERT!! The green tea ice cream sandwich thing was probably the most complimenting and delicious desserts I have ever had. This place is now one of our go to spots! Thank you Hobak, see you real soon!!!

oGNQWoYqKZoYznvwTv1vAw.text: The quality of the meat is amazing. The service is also a 5/5. I ate here by myself and they gave me enough food for 10 people with all of the side dishes and soup.

m-H8IkQ8R2OZn4hAbYdk-g.text: Waited for about 30 minutes for our table on a Monday night around 8:30pm.  This place was great and well worth the wait.  Not AYCE but 8 of us shared 2 family style combos and it was enough meat to satisfy even the hardcore carnivores at the table. A little pricier than an AYCE price but the meat is a higher quality.  I would definitely come back here.

mXPjxGlVCAR3fEWoljSG3A.text: Hobak was amazing. Coming from Hawaii it was a different experience from what we have there. The meat was tender and we got a lot of attention. Overall I felt like the sides were good and the meat was prime. Annabelle and Exo were a good server and cook. Good service and food. 5 stars! :)

8O2nomZWqhLhF17we8u6kw.text: This was really great. Prima service and high speed delivery. The meat was excellent and all sides where delicius. The whole place was just cool and modern and the waiters where so nice. Our kids where tired and not hungry at All but they really woke up and shared the experince. Hope i will be back.

so0PnoPPKua5YQwEsrNjiw.text: the best kbbq by far!! Fav meat was the beef short rib so soft! nana is so hot and whole staff is great!  ordered family combo for my team we gonna be full fasho

9IvqubMzcZ5tqaf7K4xw-g.text: I only seen this type to Korean BBQ in LA, but once I saw this place, I was amazed. The food is fantastic. Well worth the wait, cause this place gets packed fast. Only if they take reservations, it will be cool, but I am not complaining. Worth the price and get service. My most favorite Korean BBQ in West coast.

yMcQ0PbYSXVh2VVQFe9mNg.text: Hobak is hands down THE BEST Korean BBQ I've ever had. And I've tried all locations in Las Vegas, trust me. Even the service is great quality; and I've had the pleasure of having Hyun Soo (I think that was his name) as our server. I'm not even going to complain that it's not all you can eat because it was more than enough for 2 ppl and the price was reasonable. Not only that but the decor was so adorable, I loved it so much. I would 10/10 recommend to friends and family.

25QS-1-MYNNgkLCXniUp3A.text: Oh my gosh, this place was so freakin good! It may not be All You Can Eat, but they use high quality meats and it's more than filling. Favorite meat would definitely have to be the short ribs. Sim and Andrea were awesome! I'll definitely be coming back! :)

wxllk3Et6ipYaBCAzd2K8w.text: I have always been a fan of Korean food, but to find this place in Vegas was pretty awesome! The Korean BBQ was AMAZING!! Randy who grilled our BBQ did a wonderful job. The tofu soup was delicious too! I will definitely come back next time!

BLsc7cTdvektDF7-mJFwLA.text: First time today, but was the best korean bbq I ever had in Vegas. Expect to wait at least 30 minutes and they do not take reservations. At least they provide free slushies and water while you wait. We ordered the family combo meal. The beef skirt and aged ribs were definitely the best. Very tender and juicy. We didn't care too much for the spicy pork belly, felt it was too fatty. The meat is cooked for you, which is great! The service is amazing, they are great at refilling your side dishes and refilling waters. I just wish they had radish as an option. The combo meal ends with a green tea ice cream (or vanilla) sandwhich with rice paper and was just perfect. The ambience of the restaurant is very modern. The tables even have call buttons to request service, your check, etc so you are never left waiting. Definitely give it a try!

PXjL9vLEOtMVQE8wbbFWFw.text: This place was so yummy! !! I felt like I was in LA. Their bibimbap was super delicious and came in this old school doshirak ! Our sever Nana was amazing. Rarely do I find a waitress who is so attentive and super sweet! She recommended what to give my kids and they gobbled up everything!  They also carry the flavored soju (thats very popular in Korea. .not the ones you get from karaoke places. ..a must try!) Ill definitely come back here!

I92iDj9sCQVjWSZi-Z4w_w.text: Wow this is the best kbbq I've ever ate at! The meat is so fresh and tender and the service is excellent! The family and I ordered the large family combo #3 and I'm glad we did. The amount of food was more ham enough for our hungry party, they started us off with delicious side dishes and cooked our meat in a timely manner. The dressing and sauces are soooo good! The atmosphere is great, i love the decore, very modern. I'm glad we came here for dinner, I've been looking for a good kbbq and this is it! I highly recommend this place to everyone! I will be coming back for sure! Nana was great, so sweet! We loved her!!

q0T8yiZmZIetFXN7rgBmJA.text: I know this place has a perfect 5 stars, but honestly...idk why. We went during business hours, so we understood the long wait. They give free smoothies and mini waters while you wait. The inside is cute and I like how the set up was already on the table, but that's about it. We ordered the family combo and the only thing I enjoyed was the skirt steak. Everything else had no taste and was very plain. We ordered a side of brisket but it was mostly fat, again no taste. Service was all over the place. They don't have anchovies, no bulgogi, which is surprising. Glad we tried it, bummed we won't be coming back.

1-EzusdP4TmFJ95qBnEfSQ.text: Food was amazing! By far the best Korean barbecue in town! The meat was so tender and delicious! I suggest you try this place out ASAP!

aU2bn_Xx4uMRJ7-29TLVLw.text: My sisters and I were pleasantly surprised today.  We have tried quite a few Korean restaurants in Las Vegas and they have all been disappointments, but Hobak did not.  We ordered the family combination and it was very good.  The side dishes that came with the meats were also very good.  It was nice that we didn't have to cook the meats ourselves.  The other good thing is that we didn't smell like barbecue, which happens in Korean restaurants with grills in the table.  The service was quick and the waiters were helpful.  Overall, we had a very good experience and would highly recommend Hobak to our friends.

3c_BCvlA89oLxh39WyzBqA.text: food was so good(I mean quality) and staff  so nice and friendly ice popcorn? was best!! this place is the best korean bbq in vegas.. I will repeat lol

eD1LPQJ24BQ3ZKQRZ5K2HA.text: Yelpers, do yourselves a favor and go to Hobak the next time you're in Vegas. Less than 15 min drive from the Strip & deserving of 5 stars. Our waiter, James was the best & explained/described everything to us in a friendly, non invasive way. The angus beef they served was top notch. Great service, amazing food, easy parking, free slushies while you wait & OMG did I mention the ice cream sandwiches?!??? Our new favorite place in Vegas!!

Ub1MGB0V2xfEKeYFuWvCcA.text: One of the best korean bbq place I've been to. The ambience is modern yet traditional. The meat was high quality and marinated well. The service is ever present and attentive. This restaurant may be a little more expensive then some of the cheaper, all-you-can-eat options in Las Vegas, but it's worth it. But yea, my Tinder date wasn't what I expected, but hey, at least the food was good.

vnncijLjDsPnxjtz75tjRw.text: This is one of the best place for korean bbq. Galbi is very delicious!!! Worth to wait for seat.

SC8VuTmweh87RlVc_4Y-Hg.text: Food is delicious. Waiters attentive. My family is Korean and make the best Korean food - this place was Mom approved!! Yum

U5lQ773dUACKMFzrBGc3pg.text: Came in around 2pm on a Sunday with a party of 4 and was seated right away. This was our first time having Korean BBQ in Las Vegas and at a non-all you can eat restaurant at that. I will admit I was a bit skeptical, but ended up being floored by the quality of the food and service. We decided to go with the large Hobak beef combo and I was worried about the party still being hungry, but it turned out to be the perfect amount of food. They first brought out the many side dishes and took a bit of time before the meat was brought out. A server then proceeded to cook one of the meats at the table and left until everyone had a chance to finish it before proceeding to cook the next meat selections. The quality of the meat was amazing, especially the brisket. To top it off, once you're done with the meal, ice cream sandwiches came with the combo! We ordered the green tea and strawberry and they were cut in quarters. The "sandwich" portion was a crispy rice wafer that was the icing on the cake, or meal in this case.   And it gets even better. Once we were done eating, I stopped by the bathroom to see it was stocked with toothbrushes, toothpaste, and mouth rinse for your use. They've seriously thought of everything!   This has easily became one of my favorite restaurants ever and will definitely be back the next time we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-og6ea3qQSvpTlZWir4QcQ.text: Where can I start...... waited 2 hours for a table of 6 but the wait was worth it. Got 2 hobak combos #2 and #3. The meats we got were prime usda grade meats. I swear its like the pork belly, the angus steak, the skirt steak and the pork fat just melts in your mouth. The steamed egg is too die for, everything about this place is good. The service is great, our servers name is Nana, she cooked our food and she had fast paced and professional service. Honestly it gets busy here but its worth the wait. The best korean BBQ in town. Please come to this place if you want best select prime meats and have your food cooked for you.

Dx5007vVyjFyrk5WG1g8ng.text: Prior to finding this gem, we were limited to eating at Ginseng BBQ for late night. Last trip we tried Gangnam. This places blows them out of the water. If you want good meat and good service, come here.  Location/ambiance: this place is pretty far off the strip (3miles?). But well worth the trip. It's set up like Kang Hodong baekjang (for those of you familiar to SoCal). Very clean and well lit. Individual fans and girls per table. Prepare to wait. Lines were still there at 10:30pm on Saturday night. Great for a group of people looking to hangout.  Service: similar to what you would find in LA or OC. Servers all over the place. You can grab any of them and place an order. It was busy so service was a tad slow. They would put your meat order and the meat was individual prepared by a butcher in the kitchen. Spoke mostly Korean but all also understands English.  Food: thy brag that the meat is "angus prime". The meat quality was good indeed. I came late to the party so only got to try the chadol (brisket) and Galbi. Both were wonderful. The side dishes were a plenty. I didn't get to try the mandatory salad so can't comment on that. The "lunchbox" was also good and a must order. I like their complimentary slushy machine in the corner.  I would definitely return. We hung out here til close to midnight.

C6a3DyNNm9qCzAqp2cyx1A.text: Today at decided to visit after a nice massage, and we arrived about 7:30 for dinner and had a 20 min wait.  We order a family combo and the food was amazing. I really enjoy the salad, I think it was nice that it's unlimited refills as well they cook the meat for you. I am giving them a five star, but I think it will be best if one server per table, as well it will give a chance to know them at better personal level.  This way I would give a better tip. My first server we really liked her and I believe she should get 25% tip but the last othet server took my tip for servers down to 20% over the food was great and har a good time

HDMvXHPq2bHxK6XyxvZK6A.text: I've always heard around that Hobak was one of the best Korean bbq to eat. Eating KBBQ isn't my first but it was my first experience with this restaurant. The atmosphere is great and the beef is delicious with savory flavors especially their sauce. However, we did have a server, Dennis with a attitude. Dennis hardly talked to us without a smile and that was fine until she cooked our beef with high fire that it was almost burnt. When my table and I told her to stop, she threw her hands in the air and said "whatever" then never came back and had a change of severs. Every other sever was genuinely nice and caring towards us. The customer is always right, we didn't need the attitude when Dennis simply could've said "okay" and lowered the fire. It all could've been avoided but, my family and I won't be coming back no matter how good the food was. Terrible service creates a terrible mood for dinner. Do not request to have Dennis serve you unless if you want your meal severed with a bad attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8tOyaF28hgNXH69-4IqQjA.text: I'm in heaven! Since we got back from spending time in South Korea, I haven't felt anything close to the dining experience ... This is it!  Service ... Amazing! Very friendly and helpful staff. As soon as you are seated, there is already food on the table. Servers, like Nana, are there for your every need.   Quality ... Everything is butchered on property. This is by far the best quality meats you will get. This is not the frozen crap all the other places serve.  We (two of us) ordered the small combo ... $52. By far it was more food than two people should ever eat ... but it was so good, I'm gonna keep eating!  Then they bring you included desert ... Unnmmmm, this is my new favorite place in Vegas!

XIHZL-6X8ffij93LQjtibA.text: I love this new Korean BBQ in Las Vegas! The ambiance is great! It's very similar to Korea town BBQ's in Los Angeles. The food and service is also great! I prefer this BBQ over Honey Pig. I highly recommend this place. Try your meal with Korean Makkoli.

qN7BNxEn7WIy3QVySnwk9Q.text: I am a big Korean BBQ lover. I've always been about "All You Can Eat" KBBQ and was hesitant if it was otherwise because Im always wanting LOTS OF FOOD and QUICK if I'm starving. However, over time I've experimented with other KBBQ places other than AYCE and OHHHH MAN, I've been TOTALLY MISSING OUT!! To me, its all about the quality of meat and hobak definitely does not lack quality at all! I always like to get their beef combo, which you have a choice of different premium cut meats. Not only is their meat so good, but the atmosphere feels different from your typical korean bbq spot... maybe thats how it is in Korea? I've never been but its pretty cool! I love their side dishes and BEST, I love their rice cracker dessert!  Price is reasonable! I mean here, you spend approximately on average $25-$30 on an AYCE KBBQ spot. Their small beef combo is $59.99 and that feeds 2. So realistically you're paying for about the same as if you would an AYCE spot which is great!  Oh, and service is always top knotch!

lZgMPldUkO4A35-Okwv7-A.text: Best Korean BBQ I've had in years. If you like disappointment, don't come here. If you're cheap, don't come here. The food is amazing and the staff is so attentive. I ordered the combo (just for myself) and it was so much food. The galbi was so tender and the rest of the meat was high quality. It was so filling. The combo also comes with the bean soup and it was so good. To top it off, it also came with an ice cream sandwich dessert. Oh yes!!! It was amazing. I also had to order some yogurt soju cocktail and it was quite tasty. I made a pig out of myself and I'm not even mad. I'm glad I was able to bring my wife to her first True Korean BBQ experience. She loved it. Hobak will definitely be getting more of my business the next time I'm in town. They say money doesn't buy happiness but Hobak proves them wrong. To top off the whole experience, if you've ever eaten Korean food you'd understand, they have toothbrushes, toothpaste, & mouthwash in the bathrooms for after your meal. Well done!  Our server Eric was the most amazing server and made the experience even more enjoyable with his helpfulness and suggestions.

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fondue!!

TNFjR61jJRp58ePeE9nYOg.text: We've been searching for a good quality Korean BBQ place for a while, recommended by a friend we thought we would give Hobak a shot and it didn't not disappoint!   We start off we had the the family combo #3 absolutely amazing! Skirt steak was amazing juicy and tender not chewy; next was the short ribs they were not my favorite but still delicious! #3 the spicy beef definitely had a nice kick to it but nothing that made me want to stop eating it! And lastly when we thought we were all done and were near full came the spicy pork belly which perhaps due to being nearly full was just not happening for me, however after a short break of delicious food I tried it again and it was great! I cooked this a little longer for it to crisp and that was perfect!  To end our meal our combo comes with a delicious ice cream sandwich we went for the green tea flavor and it was so good we we decided to write this review to get another complimentary sandwich after verified with a server! It's really that awesome!  Overall absolutely recommend this place, quality over quantity and will be returning for more!!!

7-N-1h4We3RVm2PMYhaZDg.text: Amazing!!!  We came here with some friends from out of town & we were amazed!!!! We often frequent various Korean BBQ places throughout town but this is by far the best. Our server was Annabelle & she was so awesome, friendly and knew how to anticipate every one of our needs.   The food is delicious ! We ordered the family meal and could barely finish it all. The ribs were the best. If you are looking for wonderful food, fantastic service and a great night then this place is an absolute must try. Yelp never steers you wrong & neither would I.   Ask for Annabelle !

7SIxdHM9wIt8eOl-WlSeOw.text: Food was super good! Would recommend this to anyone in vegas! Im only leaving this because of the free icecream ifnyou rate them  5 stars in yelp.

fnNdGWO6wfE51OlcBvuIhg.text: Great cuts, great soju. Service was attentative, and kept our glasses full. Cooked right in front of you, fun experience as a group.

3WI7pl76hScuOQ9bWcbOtA.text: Great! Best Kbbq I've eaten in a while! They're meat quality is great, as well as they're servers(Nana). We came all the way from LA but it was really worth while!!!!Whether it's pork belly or briskets, they're quality is just amazing!!  The surrounding it great, it bring the old Korea culture back!! To conclude it's amazing!! I think it's a must go if you come to Vegas!!!!!

LjkjCGQ6m1ZMKCO_EyFfmg.text: I always eat Hobak. Unlike other Korean bbq places they cook the meat here for you which is very nice. The side dishes they come with are great. Don't forget the cheese corn. They also have a great lunch box Togo.

5G-fVR2wxu99KlWj1AfXEA.text: This Korean food is the best in town. The quality of meat are very juicy. Friendly staff

We8-1Z4pTLlaRaReq76bNw.text: Best korean bbq in Vegas! I've been to so many and have never had such great food accompanied with fantastic service. You know how when you go to one, and the servers will ignore you after you've been served? Not this place! They spoke into headphones that would send servers straight out of the kitchen with your requests! The atmosphere was welcoming and unique. The bbq meats melt in your mouth, sides were delicious and plentiful, and the dessert was to die for. Oh and there's even a help-yourself slushy at the front! Say whaaaaat?! Will definitely come back!

uVUnhwc1aXQMceKL8ke2aQ.text: The salad here is bomb and the meat is always fresh and juicy. For sure my favorite Korean BBQ spot

dD5djH9e03g7bVvtcVawAw.text: Good food, good ambiance .... love that they cook it for us,  love their green tea ice cream, yummmm

gIzoWwfFFZAxVYDsIGJg6g.text: I wasn't a fan of these type of Korean BBQ places after my experience with Goong, but this place changed it all for me! When I say "these type" of places I mean the non ayce kine. I'm a big eater and I really want to get my money's worth, so the reason why goong ruined it for me was the lack of portion and overhyped quality. I can honestly say I got my money's worth over here and left with a full belly!   Hobak is located on spring mt and jones which is right before the busy part of spring mt, so you won't deal with much traffic or STOOOOOPID drivers. That's always a plus! When I first walked in I was pleased by the layout of this restaurant as it is open and clean! I feel like it's well ventilated and you won't walk out smelling like you been grilling all day.  My girlfriend and I were seated immediately. I assume it gets very busy during dinner hours, but we came around 1 and it wasn't so bad. We got the beef combo for two people and it was priced at 57.99. We got A LOT of food! They give a lot of banchan (side dishes) along with your meal. They also cook your food for you also!!You also get one order of steamed egg and soybean paste stew which was amazing. The briskets were my favorite... super chewy and full of flavor. Next we got the short ribs cooked medium rare which we loved! It was tender and our server cooked it perfectly. The skirt steak was my favorite! It was tender and cooked medium rare (I would suggest you get it like that), but what really made me enjoy it was the taste! It was juicy and with every bite you would want more. For dessert we got the dessert which was ice cream surrounded by some type of rice cake with red bean I believe. My girlfriend didn't wanna finish it because she wished she could save it for later. It was that good haha. Overall I had an awesome experience and 3 hours later writing this review.. I'm still full. Time to hit the gym!

MTPN34NAW4Y-DwnoZwHPwg.text: 1st time here, easy to find, lots of parking, clean restaurant, outstanding customer service, our waiter/cook Hawaii boy Mathew. The food was very excellent, we ordered different cuts of beef & pork, besides it came with all types of dipping sauces, many sides dishes of prepared vegetables, salads, rice. The ice cream sandwiches was awesome too. I've been to many different types of Korean BBQ, but this place to me is ranked the best too date. Keep up the awesome service & take care of our Hawaii son Mathew. .

rsW8ZNuXLO5W52pnxtGwsg.text: Ok first the positives: funky weird atmosphere; looks kinda like nostalgic hollywood meets koreatown-ish. Interesting little touches like mouthwash n toothpaste in women's bathroom, water misters out front, and yummy complimentary ice slush drinks while u wait to be seated. Also, unlike other Korean BBQ restaurants, the servers do most of the meat cooking for you in front of you. One other cool unique thing was the way they serve the dessert that is included with any of the large meal packages.  You choose your flavors of ice cream and they come in kind of a crispy wafer sandwich. Very interesting and very yummy. Now here are the negatives compared to other Korean BBQ places in town: since the servers cook your meat, it seems you have to wait longer for them to finish one meat and then come back and start the next one, whereas at a self serve all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ place you would be able to  choose which meats you wanted to put on the grill at which time so that you're not finished with one course, then waiting 10 minutes with no entree, then  waiting 10 minutes again for the next while you're hungry n doing nothing. The  side dishes come in mostly large bowls which take up way too much space, they are not particularly tasty and most are spicy which is not good if the person eating them doesnt like spicy food. Because of the cost you end up with less meat then you could get at an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ restaurant that may be more homey, but the meat there tastes just as good if not better. Also I prefer smaller side dishes that can be replaced when we run out instead of ones that take up too much space on the table and then you don't know if you're allowed to get a refill if you finish them. It seemed like the bussers were understaffed because tables near us took forever to get cleaned up after guests left and they almost never took away our dishes when we were done, which cluttered our small table. Also they have this odd gimmick called cheese fondue which is basically a small bowl of cheese that they let melt in front of you on your grill and you're supposed to dip your meat into it. However I did not feel that it added anything at all to the Korean flavors of the meat. It was just kind of strange. Also it was strange that for the four of us to get the bowls of white rice that came with our package, we had to ask three times before we received them. The service was just ok so considering all the factors, im glad i tried it, but I won't be going back.

99RcU38EIPnRA7zeWmcDfQ.text: This place is really great, came here on a Thursday night and it wasn't too packed. The wait time to be seated was about 5 min. Because they set up the tables with the condiments before seating. Just like a typical Korean bbq, they serve kimchee, radish, assorted veggies and 1 bowl of rice.   I honestly think that the waiters and waitresses should pay more attention to the tables only because we had to constantly ask for something. The meat was really tender and spiced just right.  I would def come back again!
