SLvUo_E9YpKykq7M3jp8zA.text: I would've given this restaurant a 5 star review BUT our negative encounter with the hostess ruined it.  However, the service from our servers was spectacular! They did not forget about us (unlike other restaurants where they're too much or the lack thereof with their presence) but these servers were on POINT! Aside from the excellent service, oh my goodness, this is probably the best KBBQ here in Vegas. My fiance and I are habitual KBBQ eaters, there's some decent ones in Vegas but Hobak hit the right spot .  We ordered the Set #3 which was enough for the two of us, not too much meat and not too little either. We were served with 4 different kinds of meat but I think the brisket was the best one out of them all (which explains why they saved the best for last )  Towards the end of our meal, they informed us that our meal came with an ice cream dessert. It was Korean rice crackers with ice cream in between - so basically a Korean ice cream sandwich. It was alright, could've gone without it but since it was included, then why not, right? We're definitely coming back again and we'll bring some friends along, too! Shoutout to our main server, didn't get his name but he was the real MVP.

bBszhQUyi9O4MY-6KFz3aA.text: This was our second time here and our servers Nhi and Mana were amazing!!! And the food here is so delicious. It may not be ayce but you get a lot with what you order. Definitely my new fave place to come get Korean bbq

D6fyPlQoI1St2FnlNTJr5A.text: I live in LA and go to town all the time so my standards for KBBQ are super high.  I got to admit that this place is awesome. The best service at any KBBQ I have ever been to bar none. Friendly staff who are happy to work here who cook all your meet for you to perfection.  The prices are very reasonable for the quality. Get a family combo and you can't go wrong. If you love fat get the pork belly, if not pass.  To recap:  Quality: 4.5 Location: 4.5 Service: 5++

8wAe-R1ArbH7AO0NumfGsA.text: I don't even know where to start. From the amazing side dishes to the incredible Korean liquor to the most tasty short ribs to the amazingly tender brisket. If your near this place then do your stomach and tastebuds a favor and go here.

hGYWqGDJBFkuPqp8QAtYZA.text: We have been to many different Korean BBQ's in various cities. This was the worst.   The menu is very limited and incredibly expensive.   They put down a huge variety of side dishes you can have all you like. But for the meats, you get small portions of low quality.   They do the cooking? They quickly pushed the meat around the grill, announced it was done and retreated. We had to take over, because we felt it was hardly done.   Also they have an exhaust fan they keep lowering and raising over the food. Found that very annoying.   So by eating all the side dishes, we had enough to eat, but it was all not very good, and you will have a worse taste in your mouth when you get the huge bill!  There are much better and cheaper Korean BBQ's around town. I suggest visiting those!

IWC27oUqSsJXCW0XgnBWug.text: Been dying to try out this place. Busy schedule and having a kid sometimes just doesnt warrant it. SO when my brother and his gf shows up in Las Vegas from Los Angeles, we just decided. This is it. This is the time to try this place. Boy oh boy did we fall in love.  Great meat, great food, great service. Its an absolutel must. Our beloved korean restaurant in Vegas is soyo. I think that just fell to number 2. HOBAK is in our beloved neighborhood of chinatown. My brother loved it so much, he pay the whole bill. What more I can say? Absolutely bomb diggity.

BEf7lsVMpbFKCywZj-gJCg.text: Well I can see why this is so highly rated. I was skeptical initially when I found out that they don't have bulgogi for dinner which is my fave KBBQ item but after dinner I can say I didn't miss it at all. It makes me a little sad that I've had the best KBBQ I've ever had and I live several states away from it. I've been to a ton of these restaurants and none could come close to this one. The meat selections were so good and tender and flavorful. The servers keep an eye on the cooking process for you and ours were very attentive. To end the meal you get an ice cream sandwich and it changed my life. All this to say that you will not be disappointed in dining here, just when you leave and realize that no other KBBQ will ever compare.

5mEhOYYDvv7cTH8tq-SiUQ.text: When you're in Vegas and you're craving some Korean BBQ, this is a great place to be! It's tucked in China/Japan/Korean town and the neighborhood has that feel of friendly congestion of cars and people that makes one feel a bit safer with all the activity. The staff are truly helpful, friendly and ready to answer questions. The craziest thing about this place is the wait time. 2 hours! They let you know well in advance and there are people who wait there. If you're there with friends and are socially capable, and not a phone junkie, it can add up to an interesting meal. For those not capable of sitting in a single location for that long, one can drive to TJ Maxx or a supermarket for an hour and a half. They really are timely in their estimate. The food is really tasty and I'm still a bit old fashioned so my date and I were surprised they literally cook, cut and serve you for each dish! Good quality ingredients and marinated nicely. The orders tend to be large for a group of two or three! But then Vegas is all about excess! Loved the short ribs! And had spicy fried rice with Kim chee. Yum! We will be back! And by myself if I have to!

05zUvn6S96ffQP-yieqRrQ.text: My favorite Korean bbq spot in Vegas! The vibe is very cool and reminds me of Seoul. The service is always friendly and helpful and the bbq combo platters are sooo good. Prices are reasonable for what you get. I'll be back soon!

-a3YVJ8fVHhvkQYU8bZJsQ.text: This place was amazing!! The vibe was great and the staff were so friendly! Our waitress was Nana and she was the absolute best!!! She cooked for us at our table which was really cool. There's also complimentary ice cream sandwiches. Definitely recommend!

TFaulbnt0WMPymmnIAZ1Yg.text: Everything from the food to the service was perfect! We were new to Korean BBQ, and Nana & Matthew had no problem going over everything with us and giving us recommendations. They cook everything for you at your table; you just sit back and enjoy!

vwMkbYLTrspFTL0Ul3wkUA.text: First time here and definitely a bank for your buck Our server John took care of us so well and kept refilling our side dishes~ will definitely be coming back and feasting

QNZVAWcviYY_wHhKuz51Yw.text: This is a Korean BBQ place that I'd recommend everyone to try out! Korean BBQ doesn't always have to be associated with AYCE. Instead it serves higher quality meat and amazing service. No wonder Andrew Zimmerman (from the Travel Channel) even made a visit to Hobak just recently. That's when you know you know this place is really something.  Apparently from all the other reviews, there's a long wait time. I was lucky enough to only wait 10 minutes on a Sunday night. Right when you walk in, there's a complimentary slushie machine by the door to sip on while you wait. You can always come back to the machine for refills even after you been seated.  The side dishes all look delicious! I especially love their potato pancakes. You are welcome to ask for more if you run out. They didn't hand it out to me unless I asked, but there's also salad and a bowl of rice. The salad had an interesting dressing in it which I really like!  My family of 3 ended up ordering the large beef combo which included three types of meat. We got the short rib, rib eye, and brisket. It was delicious!!! You can definitely taste the high quality in each bite. Unlike most Korean BBQs, this one has amazing service. The waiters are constantly checking up on you and cooking all the meat. They actually don't let you cook it yourself. At the end of the meal, there was also ice cream included! There was a good amount of flavors to choose from and it comes in a rice cracker-like sandwich.  Not only is the service and food amazing, but so is the bathroom! There's complimentary toothbrush, mouth wash, and toothpaste for your dental needs. Unfortunately it's only one bathroom per gender so it would be a long wait if someone was taking their sweet time. Apparently on the wall next to the outside of the bathrooms, they claim to have other services such as free wifi and chargers.  This was definitely one of my favorite place for Korean BBQ. A must try for all locals and tourist!

IwsOnFGBokknY0U2WTQQ4Q.text: This is a pretty good kbbq place in Vegas. Their combo orders are affordable and the meat quality was excellent.  We got the meat combo A large which was around $90 for three people. The portion size was legit large so we had trouble finishing.  Side dishes could improve but given it's kbbq, what they give you is typical and sufficient.  Service was great and yes they cook the meat for you. Soju was $12 so not too bad for Vegas either.  Pork belly and all the ribs are tasty. High quality kbbq!

PNhEJWzioXjTtSVau8xHnA.text: What a surprise to find this Korean BBQ restaurant that we enjoy more than the ones in LA!  The quality of the meat, we prefer the beef over pork, is very high quality.  The small combination dinner runs around $59 and is more than enough for 2 people.  Everything is included, from salad, to sides, soup, steamed eggs, a variety of meat, rice and ice cream sandwiches for dessert.  The meat is cooked over charcoal by the servers at the tabletop and all we had to do was sit back and enjoy!  Service was great and they were quick to provide refills of the sides when requested.  I liked the steamed eggs so much that I asked if I could have another one.  They did and it was complimentary!  It's hard to describe how good this place is, but we've been back 3 times and it was a 5-star meal every time.

VhzGcr62PKsxLWq99l2w0Q.text: When we stopped in on day last week for lunch, we were surprised that nobody else was there eating!  Not a good sign for an eating establishment. WePcmbGqaNDH4CI1fISAdw.text: Recently visited Las Vegas from LA, and wanted to have Korean BBQ. So end up at this place.  The food quality is really okay, it kind of lack that authentic Korean taste. A bit overpriced for what it's worth. The service is very friendly, but needs some improvements. It seems like the servers spent most of their efforts and time on cooking the meats for the tables, and shorten the level of service in other areas. It took about 20 minutes for them to finally come take our order and same for the table next to us. Paying for our bill was a bit challenging too, when we received our check, we immediately put our credit card on the table and it took them about 15 minutes to finally come by and pick up the payment.

_KYkqyrXjovt1n92vdoYHw.text: We have tried several Korean BBQ places around town and Hobak is the best.  Our server doubles as our grill side chef. The short ribs was our favorite and we totally enjoyed the hip setting.  The dish portion is of good size and no one will leave with an empty stomach.  It could get busy and noisy fast and so get there early to avoid the crowd.

eFdTmBIU5pIrMndqn9z85A.text: Absolutely phenomenal. Where else do you get basically a buffet of food, cheese fondue, grade A meats and dessert. Definitely coming back here again!!! Bravo Hobak

BPU6dJgH-PPUGSEEccoF1A.text: Best Korean BBQ I have ever had. Very friendly and helpful waitstaff. Tons of food. You won't leave hungry!

zl_bXlartwLDZByPR_cLvQ.text: Good to see this kind of quality in Vegas.  our tummies were filled with solid, tasty food and drink.  our server pretty much was working her tail off trying to keep everyone in her footprint satisfied.   just hope it'll be around in future years, instead of being flipped and have everything go downhill.

cnoBMT6aQNH6WDWDQywWjg.text: This place is rather an experience place, so it's not your typical ayce kbbq. Heck, it's not even ayce, but with that being said, my experience here was phenomenal and I'd like to give a huge shout out to Randy for taking such good care of us. At first I was a little surprised that such a new restaurant had 5 stars, with plenty of reviews to back it up, but after dining here, I could definitely see why.  My boyfriend and I had the beef combo for two. It came with brisket, your choice of beef, steamed egg, and some sort of soup. With Randy's suggestion, we chose the rib eye and skirt steak. Like I said earlier, it's not your typical kbbq so they cook your food for you, in front of you, ( which always makes everything taste better because you don't work as hard haha) and not only that, but the quality of each meat was amazing. He started with the brisket, which had very little fat (a very good thing). He brought out sushi rice and wrapped the brisket around each cube of sushi rice and dipped it in their hobak vinegar-y sauce. DELICIOUS. I didn't even touch my sesame oil and salt.  Then he changed the grill and started to cook the rib eye and skirt steak both medium rare. Another lady took over, Annabelle, and she even asked if we wanted the the fat cut off the steak. She cooked both steaks to a perfect temperature. I ended up dipping the skirt steak in the vinegar sauce as well and it really added to the flavor. And they also put taro and sweet potato on the grill also, which we liked to dip in the cheese fondue they had. The tapas were really good. I liked the bean sprouts and salad a lot. Just everything was perfect from our server Randy as well as the west of the staff to the dessert(ice cream inside a rice cracker taco... YUM) I could not rave more about this place...  I enjoyed every minute of it.  The saying "quality over quantity" definitely goes with this restaurant, and not only did I get full, but my taste buds were truly satisfied..   I recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

MSbad7zqpkk1GU5rGSpzJA.text: Exceptional service and food. The dessert ice cream is just the best. I'm hoping Hobak will open up in Los Angeles soon!

A8gRNnwvtb68Tw2YAUS9qA.text: We had an awesome dinner here tonight! Our server was outstanding -  actually all of the servers were incredibly helpful.  The atmosphere was clean.  The tables were comfortable and the food was AMAZING! By far our favorite was the marinated skirt steak.  We ordered the Family Combo and enjoyed the whole meal. The green tea ice cream was delicious at the end.  Because of the time of day we didn't have a wait which was a plus, but we would definitely go back given the chance!  Definitely a fun dinner that both my husband and I along with our two teenagers enjoyed immensely.

nS9S2r7_vcVKCjWl4gRWqg.text: Hobak was 'off the chain'! The food was great, the service was better... I guarantee you'll love this place!

NNeIplP4QRE25dhzlTzKXw.text: A few of my friends out here in Las Vegas decided to have a night out at Hobak Korean BBQ. Since one of my friends is living a True keto lifestyle, I figure it would be appropriate to support that diet. First thing I noticed when we got there was a febreze station to spray yourself with when you left the restaurant... odd if you've never had kbbq, but so relevant if you've had had it before. I will say right off the bat, the proteins are  NOT all you can eat (AYCE), but the bon chon (side dishes) are. Still a nice little spot with a spacious main dining area and an attentive wait staff... I  think it was worth the price.  We got the large family combo to split between 5 that came with Angus brisket, premium pork belly, aged pork rub, and spicy Angus boneless short rib (see photos). The portions were just right and the sides definitely left us all feeling full. Of all the proteins, the premium pork belly stood out the most. The way they lacerated the meat had the pork belly cook evenly and fast! And yes, they do cook for you so you can focus on eating! Always a plus at premium kbbqs. The spicy short rib was served last and it did have a nice kick to it, you have been forewarned.  To top it off, tempura ice cream was served as part of the combo and you get to pick your own two out of 5 flavors. Twas a nice finish at the end of the meal.  I definitely recommend this place as a spot to hit up because of the great service, the amazing food, and the social atmosphere.  These guys thought about every little detail including the free toothbrushes in the bathroom while playing "Learn Korean" saying overhead. Definitely would recommend this place to anyone!

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Premium pork belly was the definite winner tonight
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large hite beer around 7ish dollars

UEIMNKnAE53TeguUrYemkg.text: Went here on a Friday late lunch, so we only waited about 5 mins for a table of three.  We ordered a large family combo $108, came with four different meats.  Enough food for family of three.  We didn't like the spicy bulgi meat was very chewy.  All The other meats were good.  The sushi small rice was really good with the meat.  The ice cream sandwiches were delicious!  The staffs cooked for us.  Foods came out fast and the staffs were friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6v_teWs8H-e45AEQ8p6uaQ.text: My friends and I came here kind of late -- around 8 or 9 PM -- and it was still really full. This place is really popular, so expect a long wait!  Hobak is not all you can eat, but when you split about 3 or so meat dishes among your friends with all the extras they provide, it honestly winds up being cheaper and the food you get is much better quality. Attendants also drop by to cook your food to perfection, and all the while you feel like you really get to know them and they are a positive addition to the KBBQ experience.   Finally, with regards to the food: the beef is fresh  and delicious and so are the sides. My favorite one had to be the spicy marinated dish, but I love spicy food. There is enough variety to please everyone! Also, as weird as it sounds, Hobak has some of the best water I've ever had. Sounds weird, but their filter must be amazing because the water tastes so crisp and good, and you need a lot of it to wash down the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z9jz2jLSPng49gD9CBIISg.text: So we were in Vegas & my husband wanted K-BBQ. I start yelping and find Hobak~ once again, Yelpers did not let me down!  So it's in Chinatown pretty far down Spring Mountain. It was super busy & we had a 40 minute wait, but we walked 2 doors down to the adorable coffee shop. It's a great place to check out while you wait for your table! If you're waiting inside or outside, there's a cute little popcorn machine to tide you over if you need a little snack!  Once you get called in you'll notice 2 things:  1) the decor is adorable! (it's like you're in a cute little restaurant in South Korea)  2) it's not AYCE or cheap!  Hobak is for people who appreciate and don't mind paying a little extra for PREMIUM meat! We ordered one of the combos & loved everything! The meats were all just so tender & juicy~ you taste the difference right away. We weren't expecting quality beef like this & were shocked at how good it was. Our non-Korean friends who we brought here agreed that the meat was amazing!  Plenty of banchans & different soju options from basic to fruity to the fancier expensive Hwaro! Don't forget to order corn cheese if you've never had it before~ SO, so good with BBQ!  Our server was super attentive, friendly, & cooked our meat for us (another plus that I LOVE!)!!! We were there for a while with friends & never felt rushed or lacked anything. A few other servers who helped us were just as friendly as our waitress & went out of their way to make sure we got everything we needed right away!  Dinner at Hobak was just a phenomenal meal! Everything from food to service to atmosphere were all 5-star for a casual dining experience! Will DEFINITELY be back whenever we're in Vegas!

HVKnMG5VPjEVvg-zPFtZWQ.text: This restaurant is about as Overrated rated as  the QB Jimmy Garropolo ... To start the meat cuts were too fatty... I ordered rib eye and it had more fat than any Pork Belly!!!! The meet had a horrible propane gas taste and the meal was waaay over priced for what you get!! The sides were not good at all. The service however was excellent and friendly... There are no knives to trim all the fat either... Save your money and hit Tbones or a solid Steak house!!!

-bKojeUXWk7o592rXiJwsQ.text: Was in town for the weekend and wanted to try this place since my husband tried it recently and liked the food. It's a fun, festive environment and will have a wait time on the weekends. The inside has a small waiting area (read: one bench) but there are several heat lamps outside if you want to chill outside.  We waited about 30 minutes and were called in. A few banchan plates were already present (kimchi, cold soup w/ noodles, cucumbers). We ordered the combo BBQ beef w/ skirt steak, brisket and another beef cut (don't remember). For the price we paid, the quantity of beef seemed on the paltry side and the quality was meh. I've had much better beef at KBBQ places in Garden Grove. Also, there wasn't a ton of variety in the banchan (no japchae, glass noodles, etc). The soybean tofu soup was average and super salty. The best item was the steamed egg and it was on point. The fried rice was too sweet and kind of greasy.  Overall, I thought it was very average and would not likely come back.

oD58e5E503_qHoIPuQvaxA.text: I have been here about 7-8 times here. My family made it the birthday dinner location. The food here is so incredibly delicious, and the vibe can't be matched. I compare every other Korean BBQ I eat at to Hobak. The customer service is incomparable and always on point. Nana was our server today and she was super informative and friendly. I wish I could eat here every day. No joke, that good.

qB2uWweKevoAdmgwcP9IMw.text: Great food and great customer service! Too many plates tho. Still 5 stars!

GXX3PID_1rOgVOQCUxRfzg.text: There are obviously a lot of great things going on for Hobak including attentive servers that diligently supervise your meat, grills that burn charcoal with sufficient ventilation, late hours for those wanting to avoid the rushes or are hungry for late night grub, and combos that include bean paste stew, sushi rice, steamed egg, and rice pop ice cream.  Meat always tops the priority list for me and Korean barbecue, and what sets Hobak head and shoulders above every other place is the quality of their meats. The beef is Black Angus that's been wet aged for 21 days. And the pork only comes from the Heritage breeds. They always slice the best cuts that when cooked appropriately by your servers, results in proteins that taste clean, are juicy, and melt in your mouth. I've been staying away from the marinated meats lately just so I can enjoy the superior flavors of this beef and pork alone. I can't get enough of the pork belly when I come. It's not a slice of bacon sized cut. It's thick, includes those savory layers of fat, and is topped with a sprig of rosemary while cooking. I'm confident Hobak will pass any taste test you want to put up against them.  The combos are the best way to get bang for your buck with choices of beef, pork, or the family combos with both. Prices for the combos range from $60-$100 and you usually get enough to feed more than the number of persons recommended. I wouldn't give the proteins much more than a kiss of salt to bring out that exceptional flavor. A Korean lager like Cass or Hite is the perfect pairing for your meal as the neutral beer won't overpower any of the other flavors whether it be the meat or kimchi.  Service has never been an issue with us as there at least two servers in each section keeping a watchful eye. Should you need anything it'll be delivered in no time as they communicate directly to the kitchen through an intercom system. You can also use the call button if needed, but we've never had to.   Time your visit accordingly to avoid the one hour plus waits and once you're in, enjoy!

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small family combo

yN7HekpBOVH5jNMopItA-w.text: Hobak is amazing! I am in love with the trendy, authentic Korean feel about this place. The decor is beyond adorable. All the waiters I interacted with during my time here were all so attentive and friendly. I came here with a big group of 12 people, and the waiters never failed to meet our needy requests for more sides. This is a non-AYCE place so do expect to spend $$$ and not be super full, but hey quality over quantity sometimes amiriteee?   THE FOOD:  -premium pork jowl, pork belly, outside skirt steak, both type of short ribs (HIGHLY recommend 10/10)  -brisket and grilled spicy pork belly (8/10)  -corn cheese (8/10)  -jap-chae (10/10)   Honestly, everything was really good, so don't read too much into my ratings :3 Treat yoself and get one of the Hobak family combos because the large really feeds about 4-6 people. Of course, the cherry on top of this entire experience was the rice pop ice cream and the slushie sojus that accompanied our meal. Do yourself a favor and eat here, you won't regret it!

ILI2DL8Hn4xpJjeT3XqOLw.text: I had dinner here with my brother, my dad, and my husband and we were not disappointed! The wait wasn't too bad and they had some nice benches to sit on outside.  Once we were seated, they started bringing out the side dishes. The pickled mustard leaf and pickled daikon were my favorite. My brother really enjoyed the potato pancake while my dad inhaled 2 orders of the kimchi and the iceberg salad. My husband, who isn't too big on vegetables, enjoyed the bean sprouts salad.   We decided to order the small family combo #2, which stated that is was good for 1-2 people. My dad, who had been there before, said there would be more than enough food for the 4 of us and he was totally right! They brought out a bowl of steamed egg, which was absolutely delicious and something I'll be trying to replicate at home. They also brought out a bowl of soup that had some vegetables, meat, and tofu. It was very good but the broth was a bit too salty for my taste. They also brought out some sushi rice.   They started rolling the meat out; beef brisket, angus steak, pork belly and pork neck. The brisket was yummy and perfectly sliced, this was my brother and my husbands favorite. Both of them said that they could easily have finished all of it haha. The angus steak was so tender and flavorful. This was easily my favorite and I'm not typically a meat eater. The pork belly was also good, I did feel like it could've been cooked a bit longer but my family enjoyed it. It was way too fatty for my taste. The pork neck was my second favorite and if we weren't so full, we probably would've ordered some more because there just wasn't enough of it haha.   After our meal, our server brought out the rice pop Ice cream, we chose the green tea flavor. They cut the sandwich into 4 pieces so that we could split it but honestly, I could've eaten the whole thing. Everybody really enjoyed it and we all polished off our pieces despite being full   Two complaints: Ventilation is very poor. My hair and all our clothes stunk up the car pretty good on the ride home. Our jackets are currently airing out in the garage. Second complaint is about the service. The guy that was doing the cooking for us was such a grouch and acted like he didn't really enjoy his job and/or didn't want to be there.   Other than those two things, everything else was great! We will be back for sure!

-41QtWEqqkv3a_9IiK3m0w.text: The atmosphere was trendy as soon as we came in, the service was fast, efficient and helpful.  The meat was so tender and cooked in front of you for the pleasure of the eyes. It cames with various Korean sides, a bean soup and some steamed rice.  Very satisfying experience !

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bqf-nNkpHdTNvhte2iTdVQ.text: My friend who lives in Vagas loves it here so when I visited her, this was the first place she wanted to take me to.    We arrived early like 5:30pm but it was already half full.  I was amazed how service was so awesome through out the night by different servers.    We ordered a large size combo with 4 types of meat.  I have to say my favorite was the short ribs, both marinated and spicy!  The meat was so tender.  Banchan was okay, but the ice cream sandwich at the end was refreshing.    They even had toothbrushes and toothpaste in the bathroom.  What a nice touch!  I have seen mouthwash before but not toothbrush.  The place was kept clean and the meat quality was good.  I can see why my friend likes it here.  Plus there is a  hot guy working here does not hurt :p

-N6BEZWr5edgoyYVE8Gpxg.text: Good ambience, KBBQ is pretty good, depending on what you order.  There were four of us and we ordered a beef combo (chadol, ggotsal, and galbi) and the pork belly.   Great Ggotsal - Very very good! Definitely my favorite from what we ordered, but I prefer my meats unmarinated. We asked for raw garlic and sesame oil, and they were quick to get this for us. The sesame oil comes in a little foil cup if you want to drop some garlic in there and put it on the grill Galbi - I usually don't prefer marinated meats, but I can't deny the tenderness of this meat. I also appreciated that there wasn't too much sauce and it wasn't salty. Service - our server (whose name I forgot, who's from Hawaii) was very attentive and friendly. She was always there and was good about asking how we like our meat cooked (they cook all the meat for you). I also appreciated that they frequently changed the grill without us having to ask.  Dessert - Our combo came with the green tea ice cream dessert. It's green tea ice cream with red bean and bbungtwigi on each side, reminiscent of a green tea boonguhbbang ice cream. My family loved it, and my brother said it was his favorite thing we ate! Ambience - I love the interior decorations. It flooded my parents with nostalgia, and they were constantly smiling and commenting on all the posters and signs.   Okay Naengmyun - we had both the bibim and the mul naengmyun. It was okay... I prefer Magal BBQ's naengmyun Gaeranjjim - I like that it comes in the stone pot and it's not poured in the side of the grill because the ones that come in the stone pot are richer and not dry  Bad Nothing special about the dipping sauces and the salt was plain Pork belly was terrible. There should be a good balance of pork fat and meat, but it was all fat. We barely touched it. I definitely do not recommend it.

wTvGL4qZK-vmZ2ZM38nSNg.text: I have been wanting to try Hobak for a while.   With all the great reviews, I had pretty high expectations.  We ordered the special summer combo meal for 2.  The combo came with Wagyu Bulgogi, skirt steak,  False Lean and maybe short ribs(?).   As noted by other yelpers, the waiters cook the meat for you.  I prefer to cook my own since some of the meat were underdone.   When the meat came out, we noticed that they were very fatty cuts.  I really don't like fat so I spent a lot of time trying to separate the fat from the meat.  I do like the fact that they change out the grill each time they cooked a new meat.  The sides were just ok.  Also, they served sushi rice instead of traditional Korean rice.  I normally like to eat my meat as a wrap  with traditional Korean rice, red/green leaf lettuce and fermented bean paste.  They didn't offer any of that.  The soup that came with the combo meal wasn't really that great. I've had better at other restaurants.  Overall, the meal was just ok. Nothing spectacular. Glad we tried it but this is not for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TZdAAx065IjMvpoKw6XqGg.text: Came here on a recommendation from fellow yelpers as I wanted to try something other than Magal.   I felt the banchan was lacking in variety, the prices were similar to other KBBQ in the area with better offering.   Service was great, you get refills on the soup which is a huge plus for me as I was sick and gross like undercooked eggs.   The set combos also offer free dessert. That was a great touch for us and we got to choose from 4 flavors!

7KqwkKxWvthzXvpfaUREhg.text: Shoutout to Vegas Yelp locals Greyson N and Eric B, who brought me here. I didn't know we were even coming here, so I did not adequately prepare myself for the foods. Having a short few days in Vegas meant I was already making the most of it by eating the entire time. Not even 3 hours before I had been stuffing my face already. This ended up being meal number 4 for the day.   Luckily, this was not an AYCE place. This is more like those Japanese BBQ places with a set menu, but with Korean banchan. They have a large variety of banchan including some dishes I've never seen before. All the items were very good. The meat itself was well seasoned and very tender. Of course, you get smaller but more appropriate portions of meats, which I definitely appreciated. Had this been an "eat as much as you can to get your money worth" location, I would not have been able to participate as well.   Unlike other KBBQ joints, they cook everything for you. Instead of wasting your time trying not to burn your meat or figuring out if it's done or not, someone else does it. You are responsible for just putting it on your plate or directly into your mouth once it's done.   We had great attentive service in a lively atmosphere. I am definitely going to try to come back here again the next time I'm around.

8XvefBNNQzzFWxa5lDYYlQ.text: One of the highlights of my trip to Las Vegas has got to be a visit to Hobak Korean BBQ.   Located at the corner of a small F& B complex in Chinatown, we arrived at dinner time and thankfully it wasn't very packed. The restaurant is moderately spacious and me quite fond of their interior design; retro with a twist of fun thanks to the colorful hanging lights - it really sets the mood and somehow they are able to recreate the feel of eating in the street of Korea itself.   The two of us were hungry (and greedy :P) so we ordered the large Hobak Beef Combo which are meant to be shared for 3-4 people. Our choices of meat: The brisket, aged short ribs and Angus B.L short ribs. Everything was scrumptious but my favorite cut was the Angus B.L short ribs -plenty of marbling and just melt in your mouth GOOD!!!   Along with the grilled meat, they gave us doenjang jiggae (bean paste stew) and steamed egg to relieve the grease, which were also highly enjoyable. Another factor that makes Hobak special is they have sushi rice (if you fancy something different) and the treat doesn't end there, they also compliment us with rice pop ice cream sandwich for a sweet ending :)   Pricing was a bit premium, with our large order costing $109, not including drinks, tax+tips, but it was totally worth it. The only downside I can think of was our waiter who did the grilling rushed the cooking process and start grilling new batch of meat before we barely finish with one. But that aside, all is well with Hobak and we left the restaurant with happy tummy and a lingering taste that made us craving for more.

-fiJnU5kmOGsHbwbAGqFtg.text: Randy Randy Randy! He is the guy you want as your server guys. The food was amazing and the service was even more AMAZING! Randy treated us really good. Definitely coming back

fihCbyEDYf2XgpYl-tsMmA.text: The greatest Korean BBQ I have ever had. Very friendly staff and helpful. During our very large group b-day celebration they had many people assisting to our 4 tables. Every employee helping all the tables. Great food, great location (not far from strip) great environment. Next time I am in Vegas I would definitely return and recommend this place to anyone!  Jayden and Jiyu were our main servers! Great people!

KMOe-1PXkb-Hzmz8PNM1TA.text: Just left this restaurant and I had such a pleasant experience! The food was delicious and the staff was super friendly. I'd definitely come back!

BF3CvfBAO84Y1tQOXEiZlg.text: Food was good BUT the place had the absolute WORST SERVICE I have had or seen at any restaurant of any kind anywhere. All of the guests all around us were saying generally the same thing: pretty good food, remarkably BAD service (seemingly intentionally bad - like Korean hipster wannabes). I will never go again and highly recommend avoiding the place (unless you like being treated like shit by bunch of loser 20-somethings).

YbLaRUJXLi_CJAe1Tr32VQ.text: This place is amazing! Black Angus beef!! This is what sets them apart from the rest. The texture! Yum!! We got into town around midnight (keep in mind it closes at 4am) and decided to Yelp an awesome Korean BBQ place. This will pull up and stay on the board!! You won't be disappointed with service of menu selection/portion. They have your table set up prior to seating you so you can watch them bring out the sides and set up the grill. The staff was very tentative as they work as a group staying on their earpieces communicating. We ordered the family portion which serves 3-4 (which comes with seasoned beef and pork). We were literally stuffed before they cooked all of our meat. We called a taxi before dessert came just because we wanted to "time it right". Saturday night taxi service can be hectic. Dessert was very good and light (if it's even possible to say that since we stuffed our faces). I would return here and with friends and family. **Note: we brought our own sauce "Laotian Signature Jeo Som" if anyone knows good Lao/Thai food... You know this sauce goes wonderful with many things .

QMEqjbcSbGdJlRHR8UyJvQ.text: Went to Hobak 2 weeks ago.  Honestly, I don't really understand why this place has such a high rating.  The meat is pretty tasty with the wood burning grill, however, that was it.  This place needs a better ventilation system.  The vent comes all the way down blocking views of people's faces around the dinner table impeding conversation.  The vent is loud and it's still smokey!  Be warned, this place is very loud, smokey, and busy.  One of our waiters seemed pretty put-out about having to work for some reason.  The other 2 waiters were very nice and attentive.  I prefer restaurants where we can cook the meat ourselves.  Having someone stop by the table every 5 minutes to lean over and cook, interrupts the flow of conversation.  The banchan (side dishes) were ok.  There was not enough variety in the banchan for those of our party that do not enjoy spicy food.  And for those who do like super spicy foods, none of their dishes cut it (even though we specifically requested super spicy for the soup). There are tons of great Korean restaurants in the Vegas area.  We will not be back.

Yo_9WAcd_SJuJ__VleGsJQ.text: You guys know I love me some good Korean BBQ, but Hobak was such a let down. I have absolutely no desire to return here. Two stars instead of one because the meat quality is very good- but there is a lot more that goes into a restaurant experience to make it worth while. I was in a party of three and we ordered the Hobak Beef Combo. They served us the combo for two people. Why? I'll never know. Was one of us invisible? Anyway- the portions were tiny and I thought that was okay because I wasn't super hungry at the time anyway- but after we had eaten all the meat they brought out I though there is no way that can be it. I felt like I had barely eaten anything and I was embarrassed for the guests that had joined me (I chose the place to eat) because I know that they were still very hungry. So we ended up ordering another order of the marinated skirt steak and it took over 20 minutes for them to bring it out. TWENTY MINUTES PEOPLE! This is not the way Korean BBQ is supposed to work. The service was terrible. They give you very little banchan (just kimchi and radish) and none of the dipping sauces I usually enjoy with KBBQ (Doenjang, the salt with sesame oil over it, etc.) There was no lettuce or lettuce salad (except for one with ranch dressing and one with green onions and bean sprouts- but I like lettuce with Korean dressing with my KBBQ), rice paper, or radish to wrap your meat in. There was some marinated radish that was good but it was more like banchan than something to eat with your meat. They split one of the rice pop ice cream sandwiches between the three of us. Thanks. When the check came all I could think about was this was SOOOOOO NOT WORTH IT. I felt so bad for my guests and had I known it was going to be like THAT I never would have come here in the first place.

-SZxgxUiQqBGNtepmpBR0A.text: I give the food and customer service 5 star because eveything was great!  We waited 40 min for a party of 5, but was really worth it.

25b-SoRYhISo_GYMqqQF4Q.text: Korean BBQ is a favorite of my husband and myself and I think we've just found our new spot! Hoban is amazing! Great service and even better food! We got the beef combo for two and had fairly healthy appetites going in...well we came out STUFFED! The brisket was great quality, and we chose the ribeye which melts in your mouth (my husband said probably his best ribeye ever) and the marinated skirt steak which was delicious, not overwhelming like I feel sometimes marinated meats can be...it was my favorite! The charcoal used in combination with the gas grill adds such a great smoky flavor to the meat also! Everything we had had SO much flavor, many items were a bit spicy, which we love, but others may want to be cautious. Our server BB was an amazing cook and super attentive to us. I enjoyed them cooking for me so we could just sit back and  enjoy our meal! We will definitely be coming back to this K BBQ spot, *and may never go anywhere else* hahaha!

IH-O4JONr3VbTWfUY0g5gg.text: So good we went here twice in one week  My fam who lives in Vegas agreed that they were happy to finally find another place to add to their Korean restaurant rotation. The first time the service was not great, but the second time it was stellar. I think our waiter's name was Peet and he was awesome. Did the family combo #1 the first time (delish) and marinated meats the second. We decided we love the marinated ones best, they're seriously good.

AXg4DP3VQz1CvHQ6nsfFRw.text: Great korean bbq, probably top 5 in my experience. Slow service. Very crowded. We had reservations at 6 pm but not seated until 6:45 pm.

The first experience was great but the wait was way too long. this time they were busy and did not have enough staff. We got the large beef combo for $90. It wasn't even enough to feed two let alone the 3-4 that was advertised. Overall value for price paid was not worth it at all. Also the service was terrible, how many times do you have to ask for items from the waiters. Is it worth the hype? Probably not.

6mzP5C-Jx7h7ZcYbD8M-Cg.text: We are at habok Korean bbq and food is fantastic and the service is awesome! Our server is Anabelle and she's the best server we have ever had. GREAT EXPERIENCE and thank you Anabelle!!!

bqXKNmQWAs4LIa2_EmfwgQ.text: I had the most WONDERFUL dinner here. I know everyone knows what I mean when the expectation for asian restaurants is below par service but this place is on point and this goes for ALL of the staff. Not only was the service amazing but the meats they offer are incredibly fresh and high quality. I enjoyed the beef combination dinner and the hostess did a great job explaining the menu as it was my first time at the restaurant. Jayden was not my designated server but he was incredibly helpful throughout my entire meal (so helpful that I did not realize he was not my server until my actual server presented my check). Jayden made sure to constantly check on my table and make sure that everything brought out was to my satisfaction in a non-overbearing way. I also appreciate that the grills on each table have a vent above the grill to suction the fumes from cooking the meant and prevent you from smelling like a bbq after leaving the restaurant.  From the staff to the food to the restaurant layout/decor, Hobak is definitely going to be my number one place for korean bbq in Vegas!

QMfI_jZWVm4WbmctkF2lPA.text: I have a Korean wife and we have lived there.  This restaurant is outstanding, and would be very competitive if it was in Seoul.  Nice nostalgia feel with posters from the 60s and 70s.  Outstanding service, we'll staffed for speed.  Another nostalgic twist - look for the staff member with the yellow arm band - this shows who is in charge and was worn in schools and the military commonly until the 80's.

qOwqWHY-syvmh5wUJM_YJg.text: The pros: Best quality meat I've had at a KBBQ place. Waiters come to your table to cook and serve you.  Flavorful marinades on their meats.  The cons: Not all you can eat! Can get pricey. Waiters cooking for you takes the fun out of the KBBQ experience. Their servings are not very big!

JgWgFn755dz501DWUi5Wkw.text: Finally, a place for great Korean BBQ! I really miss Woo Lae Oak in L.A., so finding Hobak made up for that in a major way. Food is cooked at your table by the hostess, which is better than Woo Lae Oak, where you did the cooking yourself. Love Hobak, but expect long waits on the weekend. We went on a Monday, so that was much easier. Also, this is a pricey restaurant with entrees typically in the $30 range, but they are shareable so that's good news. And they serve wine too, so you can't go wrong there. ;^)

oW8GDtm2jMpQsFHQMSBgog.text: Very fun dining experience! Great place to enjoy with several friends. Don't worry about the cooking because the attentive staff handles that for your table. We had one of their platters for the table and it was more than enough delicious foods. The sides keep coming as well. You will not leave this place hungry or disappointed.

1Yh1EIHIyJQHd3-jJ18k1A.text: Food. Not bad. Service not great. I really wanted to like Hobak. I gave it a second try after an okay first experience. Second time around, I brought my kids and Husband. Our grill was not working properly which the servers noticed. I'm not one to make a big deal about things as I am a cocktail server on the Strip myself, and I know that things happened. But, the staff just kind of overlooked the whole experience and went about their night as if it was no big deal. So, all in all, our food took longer to cook and no one seemed to care and that's unfortunate. I'll stick with WooNamJang for now.

GhS3A04mfBbtWSxsQ9qMxw.text: Wow, this place is a winner!!! After waiting an hour to get in I wasn't disappointed. The service was great, beer was cold and the food was amazing! I recommend the aged marinaded short ribs, complete wow factor. Can't go wrong with this place.

eosXSPsSQC1bAeg3Pbax-A.text: Best service and experience ever. Our server James explained to us everything and made us feel like we were at home.   We did the family style combo #3 for the 5 of us and were very pleased.   The Angus spicy fried rice was really good also, but if you don't mind really spicy food, it's pretty spicy.   We also ordered soju where they can hit the bottle and make it into slush, very cool.   The dessert: mango rice pop ice cream was our favorite over green tea.   Highly recommend! It's all tender and delicious.  One of my favorite is their thinly sliced meat - sushi creation. So addicting!   Best of course is their ice cream sandwich!

dkd2oVXXQnw46L1RkgmkWg.text: I always leave here with a smile. The food is bomb and the service is pretty good! No more deciding who will cook the meat in your party, they'll do it for you haha

wrNgUncm3N1BvTfVOfrGvQ.text: Humanely sourced meat! That's the biggest seller for me.  Moreover, the food and service are both excellent here. I lived in Vegas for several years and had to move away to start a business in Arizona, but I come back every 6 weeks or so for a weekend.  Last trip, we enjoyed Hobak so much that we went BOTH nights for dinner. It's just awesome.

vhIFQlID9DJqzNWtWk9q3g.text: Worth the wait. Meet quality is good and service is fast and friendly! There is a time limit for the AYCE though.

1QvDefgImIxeju7R6x6PUw.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.  I had a great experience at Hobak.  Even after months of being open, the lines are always incredible.  There will be a wait and they do not take reservations, just just be aware.  But once you get to the table you have a perfect meal with tons of food at a reasonable price.  This is a great venue to take friends from out of town, the family, or even as a date night.    We had the pork and beef marinated platter.  Cooked for us to perfection, this is for sure not a "2 person" plate like the menu states.  With drinks and bonchon, this is easily a 3 person, or probably a 4 person platter.  They have the typical soju as well.  Service was good and the waiter was actually talking it up as he was cooking so it wasn't awkward or anything which is nice at a place like this.  My main issue with Hobak was that it was Americanized.  They didn't have many of the sauces and bonchon options that you would see at a more authentic place and instead stood firm with sriracha as their hot sauce and bok choy as their veggie.   COme here for a top Korean BBQ experience in Vegas.  These places have become hot lately and are popping up all over, but Hobak is still right up their in the top 3 for sure.

o11YqCVuDDuqS7WW3Ynr5g.text: Hobak Korean Bbq is legit!!! I come here at least twice a week.   As soon as you walk in you feel the atmosphere jumping the music is rocking some kind of K pop or edc type!!    The servers are right in your face with the cooking and explaining of the food and the dipping sauces. Before the food comes out they load up on the side dishes.   I usually get the beef combo and you choose what type of meat you want. I get the skirt steak and the rib eye. This is to me the best combo  everything else  is  included like the brisket and steamed egg and spicy tofu soup. They call it spicy miso soup.   Then they start the cooking process and tell you what's what like the cheese dip and the sauce for the meat.    Now you have to appreciate the whole cooking process as these guys and girls are bending over cooking your food the whole time. This is cool as I don't have to get dirty... lol but the workers say that they are used to it!!    Then as you are eating they will come back and check on you to see if you need refills on any of the sides.  The dessert is next omg.... so if you have not tried this A-MAY-ZING creation that they bring you get down here!! Just choose your flavor of ice cream and they will do the rest! Vanilla, green tea, strawberry and mango.....   This place does not disappoint.... so why not perfect rating well I didn't like the fact that they bring you the bill and ask you to pay now as they are closing up... now they close at 2:00am but ask you to pay at 1:15? Weird but ok not the end of the world just felt like I was rushed out and they are still five other tables here still eating. Yes they asked all of them to pay.   So give this place a try and see for yourself and Happy Eating!!!!!!!

uH6-_EOKoFcsdYTsu4zTHA.text: I waited 45 minutes for my RAW meat. It wasn't until I saw someone who was sat after me get served their meat until I followed up on my order. They said something must have been wrong with their machine in the back because my order didn't go through. I would think after that mishap they'd be more attentive. Had to ask for my rice TWICE-that was supposed to already come with my order. Then when they were cooking my meat it was flying all over place/off the grill so there goes half my steak. To apologize for my experience our waitress decides to give me a 10% coupon for next time. WHAT?! Lol!!!   Lastly, this place is over priced and their meat is not marinated/tasteless. Go to an AYCE KBBQ place instead. Been to Gen, Tofu Hut, & Hwaro- all top notch!

Not as much side dishes as other Korean barbecue places I been to and I'm not sure if we got the cheese part in our combo? My boyfriend loved the dessert. Definitely will come back and recommend.

yfVzdnDisMzgIkzueQeinA.text: I wasn't a fan of Korean food until I ate here. A+, my family and I WILL be back.  We had the large family beef dinner which fed 5 of us easily.  Great ice cream deserts all for $87.

3a6RHV3dWbi8JXXE6bT-Lw.text: Jayden is the man. So polite and professional. I am Litty McQuire. I will be back for sure. Delicious Boyz

ljg976WSkTjX2SPhAJtt9g.text: Fantastic service and food - a definite must-try for Korean BBQ!  Very accommodating on additional sides and very very attentive to the food and drinks. Nana is super friendly and wonderful to explain our dinner.  We ordered the Family Combo and everything came out quickly, meats were marinated well and tender.  Will definitely come back!

sG7qsx6W4nqHDqjUAPmA5w.text: This place was really noisy. The server would ask me how I wanted my meat cooked, I responded "medium please" he replied "you want medium rare, medium rare is better" this bothered me. Then, he cooked the meat super rare, like, come on...I wanted medium. If you're going to ask, don't TELL ME what I'm having. Especially if you plan to undercook it. Also, is really pricey for the amount of ACTUAL BBQ you get. Disappointed. Probably won't be back.

ODMAzWzm3kISK6BGQg29Yw.text: A dinner with my mom turned into a dinner with 6 people. We were expecting only a 20 minute wait but a table of 6 would incur another 25-30 minutes. We we a little worried because my grandmother was also out with us but they were able to seat us in 15. The food was delicious and the service provided by NaNa was excellent! At the end of the meal, they serve a green tea ice cream rice cracker sandwich. It comes with a layer of red bean and peanut powder. We didn't know it had the powder and my brother's gf is allergic to peanuts.. NaNa saved the day by putting in an order of ice cream sandwich without the powder! And it was just as delicious! Thanks, NaNa!

g8XUWM1LXa6z0D83ExxMBw.text: This place is great!!! I can't believe the exceptional service that this new up and coming restaurant has. If you go here, ask Jayden to be your server he was a great help and a nice person. Thanks Jayden for all your help!!! A proud customer indeed!

46JRNsVVLWtq9P9o7cuopQ.text: One of the best places to try coming to Vegas ... Korean BBQ isn't so hot in Columbus. But this a definite must the side entrees were amazingly fresh we got the small combo platter # 1 and 3 with 6 people and that was plenty of food....

akDQqvo0LUjzREwrvEgIdw.text: Delicious, a lot of food , 5 styles of beef and pork very tender very good . Just make sure pork is cooked well . Egg dish very good .

EqVyzbvj33wpmk4GOhFPeA.text: Amazing!! I love the beef combo here. Great value for you money.   We love the brisket and the prime rib!!! Tasted so good. I9kStHOxhvtwHkoVeaDQ4Q.text: I was really surprised to find a 5* Yelp restaurant and this one lives up to its rating.   This restaurant is one of the best Korean Bbq hands down - including LA and the Bay Area (which can't really compete). The food, service, and decor are excellent. Most importantly, the beef here is well marbled, fresh, and cooked to perfection.  We ordered the small beef combo (brisket, rib eye, skirt steak) and a pork belly. All were extremely good.  Our server, Tawny even managed to cook our rib eye medium rare (every other person has overcooked the beef thinking any pink constitutes medium rare).   Don't miss this one when you happen to be in Vegas! 5* is well deserved.

1JuT1fl-qtR1GIPt-l7A4w.text: Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas baby!!!! This isn't your typical all you can eat Korean BBQ. You have to order the dish or meat you wanna eat. When I came here we just order two plates of the marinated beef and we got a bunch of free side dishes. ( what I love about Korean BBQ free side dish) let me tell you the meat is such amazing quality that the meat melts in your mouth like butter and the marinate on it is on point. Everything was just super delicious from the meat, rice, soup, eggs, salad, Kimchee, to the pickle veggies. And it's free refills on the side dish. One cool thing I like about this place is that your sever cooks the meat for you so can just chit chat with your friends and not have to worry about cooking. Check this place out if your ever in town. It's not on the strip and it's not 24 hours so you know the food is 10 times better and will be worth the time and money spent coming here to check this place out. This place does get pretty busy so come early to get a table.

-QIf5M7OxmO7Svqq05549w.text: Outstanding new Korean bbq spot in town.  Most Korean bbq establishments in Vegas specifically cater to the traditional Korean crowd to the exclusion of all others.  Not so with Hobak.  Here, I'm able to enjoy a great Korean meal with my family without the stigma of not being from Korea.  Moreover, the food is outstanding; the meat is fresh and the banchons are wonderful.    The service, something lacking at other Korean spots, is outstanding.  The servers are friendly and quickly meet the needs of all customers.  The staff is especially helpful when it comes to small children.  Without prompting, they offered to keep the grill nearer to the kids off and were quick to bring kid-friendly foods out early.  Try Hobak.  You won't regret it.

aevRUwnGSHlyIfsOcVr0Xg.text: This is one of the best Korean BBQ in Vegas. We been here a few times within a week. The server which I don't recall the name was very free fly. B9DV5CU4-rRJTuKCipPCKw.text: We enjoyed our dinner at Hobak BBQ. The pork and beef are hormone and antibiotic free, which is impressive given that most meat from Korean BBQ use low quality meat. All the waiters were very attentive and kind, except the floor manager who was not very accommodating when we asked if we could substitute a meat type we don't eat. I enjoyed the BBQ grill set up. I've never seen this type of ventilated BBQ before but it's keeps the smoke away. The waiters will cook your meat to your liking.

slcNpnKxWj-N3e9-m6dujw.text: Oh My MEAT! Kbbq Done Best!  Came to lunch with my friend today. We have been dying to try this place for a while. And finally we did!   We had the beef combo and soju. We wanted to try te family combo but the guy said it will be too much for us. But lemme tell you we eat alot for girls! So it wasn't that enough for us... But never the less the meat was awesome! The best quality I had so far. I had my faire share of Kbbq so when their  ( Kalbi) came out I thought this is like all the other meat. But lemme tell you this shit is AWESOME!   Service wise I think I never had this much of an attentive servers for Kbbq ever! 5 severs serving us?! I think thats like the best and we didn't even had to ask for to bring this and that or call to do our meat.   The best part of all of this was the green tea ice cream sandwich u get at the end of the meal. Beacuse it was AWESOME!!!

ALMX4plyW3_-JSIFGtqWuA.text: I love this place!!!! I went for my birthday then went again for my after homecoming dinner. The vibe isn't too formal but it's not too loud. I love their fish pancake thing so much!!! I also love their egg soup but the second time I went it was a bit burnt. One of the meats I tried (forgot which it was) had no flavor so it was a let down but everything else was amazing. Will be coming back again.

JYpeyduSApcnawj5Ef9t-A.text: Hobak (which means pumpkin or sharing something good) will now be my favorite Korean Bbq place. It has only been open for just over a month but is has raised the bar as far as Korean Bbq is concerned. It is not an AYCE bbq joint but the quality and taste of the short ribs and other meats more than make up for the measured portions. I would prefer quality over quantity. We ordered the family package good for 2. If you are a meat lover, you can order the larger family combo with more meat.   The servers cook the meats for you so you can just relax and enjoy. But since you don't directly control the pace of cooking you may need to allot a little more time when dining here. I would say it is worth the additional minutes. One of our sever/cook is Yooka. She is very nice, gracious and helpful.   We will definitely be back and we highly recommend this joint - great good, excellent service.  Short note:  they have disposable toothbrushes in the ladies room and a tube of toothpaste for anyone who cares to freshen up. Nice touch.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1kQmYlEhbTOCrSqIQKZ-cQ.text: I've been to several different Korean BBQ joints in Vegas and Hobak is by far the BEST!!!! Everything from the quality of food, service, atmosphere, and price is on point. I know it's not all you can eat but if you want good food/meat, AYCE is not the way to go.  Came here with a couple friends and was greeted by a HUGE sign that lists all the free services Hobak offers: bottled water and slushies while you wait, charging your phone, bibs to protect your clothes, bags to put your purse and jacket in so the smoke/smell won't permeate into them, toothbrushes and mouth wash in the bathroom, and no corkage fee so you can bring your own bottles of wine (up to 2 bottles!!). It's little details like these that can really up the restaurant experience! And this is just the beginning.   The interior of this place is adorable! Designed to look like the outdoor streets and alleys of Korea, the street signs, rooftops, and light posts are so cute. I love that the grills are on those circular oil drums, giving it an authentic feel. All the workers have coordinated black/white cheetah print outfits (don't worry, they're cool, not tacky!) and everyone is so chipper! The waitresses were very attentive and eager to serve.   The food was THE BEST PART! We ordered kalbi, pork belly, and brisket. The kalbi was amazing. The marinade was not too sweet and savory, the meat was thick yet tender. The pork belly and brisket were good quality cuts and came with dipping sauces. And for those who don't want to grill your own meat, the ladies will cook, cut, and serve the meats for you! Of course, grilling is half the fun but sometimes you just wanna stuff your face with meat. :) Our meal also included a soybean paste stew (freaking bomb!!!) and an egg souffle. The side dishes are not your typical side dishes (they're the street style) so don't be expecting no fish cake or pickled seaweed here.   After our meal, they brought us free dessert: your choice of ice cream flavor between 2 puffed rice crackers. Holy frick that was delicious and the perfect way to end everything off.   Hobak beats any other Kbbq restaurant in Vegas and the price is reasonable if not cheaper than the other places I like. I know this is gonna be a regular stop of mine every time I'm in Vegas!

vMek2Fq2H5Qw8h53JzhgOA.text: I've come here a lot and the service is always great! It's the best bbq I've ever had, I recommend their skirt steak. The meat is always well marinated and juicy and the sides you get are delicious and refillable! Definitely bring a group out for this place.

iF7PYkkuVeNYqJbqkazN0w.text: Been here two times for lunch and once for dinner and always had a great time here. The quality of the meat is very good and the prices are fair. Big fan of their beef rib eye and brisket. Very nice and hot jap chae too. If you order a combo you get a free I've cream rice pop which tastes so good. Mango is my favorite.   While not ACYE, the meat and service outweigh that. The servers are nice and cook your meal very well. And they come by often to check on your meat and to change the grill/plate so that your experience is hassle free. And the bathrooms are clean and even provide toothbrushes and tooth paste. There is even free snacks in the front while you wait. In the summer it was slushies and in the winter it was popcorn.   I've made sure to visit here when I come to Vegas last three times and I plan to do so in the future

Ib_r4WOWbTgDhgWLFnt3Qw.text: This is by far the best Korean BBQ I have ever had. I took my family here last weekend and they are still talking about how amazing everything was. The ambiance is fun and unique. This restaurant has lots of character and good vibes. The service was incredible. Our server's name was Nana and she was so knowledgeable about everything served at our table. I learned so much about Korean BBQ culture from her. I love that she helped us cook everything so we could just watch and enjoy the process. Everything from the Spicy Miso Soup to the Premium Black Angus Beef to the amazing Heritage Pork only fed 100% fresh vegetation, was out of this world. Oh...our rice cake ice cream was epic as well. We are already talking about going back to Vegas to enjoy another meal here.

XoiyavzrMf5GVdo7q1rkCw.text: This was my first time eating here and I will definitely be back. The selection of meat is great quality and the sides are plentiful. I highly recommend Hobak if your looking for a great place to eat Korean BBQ.

wOHqmeDQoKFBY0VxFDR0zQ.text: Went here while I was visiting Las Vegas 2 weeks ago for EDC. We went around 7:30 and waited about 10-15 minutes for a table.  Our server Jasmine, was so sweet and answered any questions we had. I love how they cook your food for you at the table. We ordered the beef combo and the quality of the meat was great and pretty reasonably priced. All of the bachans were delicious as well!

TR6Za9m2AfAhMIMyhutUUQ.text: Food: Not the Typical Korean AYCE (All You Can Eat Korean BBQ), it's  ala carte however the serving for 2 is enough for 4. The Side dishes were really good, tinge bit spicy salad was awesome, if your asian you can definitely get more rice. The Desserts has a limited selection however the sandwiched Ice Cream with Crackers was a good experience.   Ambiance: The restaurant's dining is typical Korean BBQ, each table has their own fan which removes most of the smoke from grilled meats so expect to smell like BBQ when you come out of the restaurant. The whole vibe to the restaurant is come in, stay and drink for awhile; great for get togethers talking to each other while cooking your food, so socialized drinking and dining!  Service: Service is pretty good, the waiter was attentive with our orders and definitely was on point with our request. Eg. how do you like the steak cooked, rice, extra side dishes, etc. The only drawback to the restaurant is that you definitely have to come in early otherwise you have to wait for 30 to 45 minutes to get a seat. (REMEMBER THE DINING AND DRINKING)   Overall: Definitely something to try out, and  definitely a new good KOREAN BBQ restaurant. Looks like Vegas dining is improving every year!

cqxMz4oPi-y60912_AWKdg.text: This is the best Korean BBQ place I've ever been to.   The banchan and meats were top shelf quality and the service was fantastic.   There was 3 of us and we ordered the sampler for two and it was tons of food. The marinated and non marinated meats were delicious. Beef or pork, you can't go wrong!   Forget about eating on the strip for over priced food with long waits.   Vegas is a great food town and this place in Chinatown exemplifies that.   The bill for all three of us including drinks was $85

PKPtUhoaQO4873DDPWruxg.text: My wallet was happy. Always hearing "Hobak" when it comes to kbbq was something I very much became accustomed too. It was a hit with my friends, and it seemed like it'd take a hit on my wallet as well once I heard the prices. It felt like my bank account would be experiencing the 2008 economic crash 2.0. It's not an all you can nor are the prices on the cheaper end, but it is so worth it!! IT WAS DELICIOUS. MY MOUTH WATERED JUST THINKING ABOUT IT. I LOVE HOBAK. My favorite though, has been the hot tofu beef stew, which was very much worth it's price. Whopping $9.99 and it comes with rice, a variety of side dishes, and a big tofu stew. I was so full at the end, and I still needed a to go container. I went with two friends whose stomachs are comparable to the Mariana Trench, and they too were having a hard time finishing everything, but we were all enjoying our meal. I didn't see any problem with employees, I enjoyed my time well. Really loved the food and establishment, thank you!

rPFHJqfJi3vGd3VXrQP6zA.text: One year ago, bf and I stumbled upon this kbbq spot while visiting Vegas and the beef was soooooo bomb! The aged short ribs blew our mind. The meat was so juicy and flavorful. Service was great. The wait was a bit long (~40min for party of two), but it's totally worth it.   There are a lot of great kbbq place in LA, but we still miss this place enough to come back one year later. This time, food is exactly how we remembered from last time. Props to the owner for consistent food quality! Can we open one in LA pleaseeeeee!!!

S35fS6dNoPCLAnXrg5g-ig.text: Hobak provides excellent service from food to drink to dessert . Krista was especially wonderful :) my bf and I would def come back :)

a-FGKltsckX3AFrRmJ0Uww.text: Coming from the East Coast, I've had my share of great BBQ in Annandale, VA. Hobak is up there in my Top 10, but there are things you should know/expect prior to your visit.   - They offer higher quality cuts of beef and pork compared to most other Korean BBQ restaurants. You can taste the difference and the flavors are quite good.  - They are NOT All You Can Eat. Most places offer AYCE for around $25-30. This place doesn't and after tax/tip your bill will average around $40pp. I include that because you're were for the Quality, not Quantity. - The sides dishes are okay. They offer the standard kimchee, radishes and other vegetables, but usually most Korean BBQ places offer 6+ different sides. This place had only a few. - Service was excellent and they were attentive with flipping the meat and getting refills.   Overall, we had a great experience and will be looking to come back next time we're in Vegas. Just understand that it can get pricey and you're paying for a higher quality of meat.

LFAQzBseFjfW1lB4q54rfg.text: Was first here last year around Christmas and the food was delicious! Now here for our second round and we are just as satisfied! Very good quality meats and friendly service all around. Definitely worth the trip and will make sure to stop by every time we are in town!

They're also paitent and understanding when if come to children (I have a 1y & 3y) . Thanks you so much for the experience.

RirW8bHTfZWMkBj8ZrcrTA.text: My favorite KBBQ spot in Vegas. I've been here many times. Hobak has the best value and quality imo. They have portioned sets to order according to your group size. I recommend ordering a set because a la carte can be pretty expensive. My favorite is the beef set. I look forward most to the short rib which melts in your mouth and the chewy cartilage that is stuck to the bone :)  Included in the set you get your regular banchan,  two types of salad, (a spicy bean sprut one and a mayo iceberg one) as well as a doenjang jjigae and steamed egg. To finish, a red bean cracker with your ice cream flavor of choice.
