Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red wine + beef makes me one happy girl. did i already say no corkage?!?!

-_3_0X-g1H9u4A6TVUcozA.text: This place is amazing. It a very fun place to eat delicious food. You could come as a couple but it is even better with a group. The staff especially Nan and, I am probably butchering his name so apologies, Hyun yoo took care of our party.  The meat was simple but fresh and tasty. Korean bbq is amazing in its beautiful simplicity and Hobak has mastered it. The decor is cool funky industrial look with lots curiosities to catch your attention and warm your heart. I completely see why it is so highly rated and completely agree.  The little touches show how much they care - there is mouth wash and disposable toothbrushes in the bathrooms and febreeze outside to help remove the smell of smoked meat.  We will be back on our next vegas weekend.

7wa9nK-Rox_qFNKC06NC9w.text: I've seriously never experienced such great service !! Awesome food and the employees really do take care of you !

3aXG2QLmjYPQDz0LqEvKSQ.text: Delicious food, friendly staff, really a fun experience. Best korean bbq I've ever had. And free slushies!

8MTT5PpPmtDjZg76xbuHRQ.text: Came in, half empty and two people in the counter.. No greeting and once we stood for good 5 seconds, we made eye contact. I said first how many were in the party and got informed to sit down and wait (Like more than half of their tables were empty). After a good 3 minutes we were seated. Ordered the combo menu and waited 20 minutes for it to come out and in the mean time we killed the side dishes. Then we got our steam egg and bean paste soup prior to our beef combo set. Then the server comes and tells us that they are cutting the meat right now and I'd ask how much longer and he said 3 minutes. And of course we waited longer than 3 minutes. They brought more beef brisket (of them apologizing for waiting so long) but it was a waste. We literally couldn't even eat half of them. Their marinated galbi was full of fat. Plus, while eating finally, cashier comes and hands us a bill (like are you serious?) and she said wifi is not stable so we need to pay before it goes down. Ok, but excuse me, apologize and don't force or rush. We lost our appetite. I'm sorry but won't go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left over food..
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quality of the marinated galbi.. Seriously?

bdEMxf7yHgQVcorw8-d3dQ.text: First timers here at this restaurant so here's my experience.  We got here around 5pm today (Saturday) and we're seated promptly in the corner of the restaurant for BBQ (directly straight from the entrance on the back right side).  I don't know if something was up with the plumbing but I kept getting whiffs of nasty sewer/bathroom odor.    Our "first" server came and asked if we were ready to order food but not drinks and when I started asking for some drinks ( raspberry wine and green tea/water ) he seemed confused about drinks and general and even more confused about them having raspberry wine.  He said he wasn't sure if they had it or not even when I pointed it out on the menu.  After a bit we finally got our drinks but no water ( our metal cups were still upside down on the plates and it's been over 10 minutes at this point ).  Overall this "first" server seemed not very attentive and didn't care about us which made me feel a bit heated.  Finally someone with a black shirt ( I think they're busers and white/black button ups are servers )came by and noticed if anyone's gotten water for us and we replied No and he got some right away for us along with some garlic and other sides for the meat which we were thankful for.    "Second" server came through and she was asking what we ordered because the "first" server moved to another section and she wasn't sure.  We ordered the large beef combo even though it's just me and my gf but we like to eat.  "Second" server was nice though she informed us about some of the dishes on the table and ways to eat with the meat.  I'll interject here with the food quality since my post is mostly about service so far, but that's a big portion of my first time experience here.  All the meats were cooked deliciously ( medium rare fans here ). We're picky on brisket cause usually it's too dry but this ones great.  Angus ribs were nice and thick and the skirt steak was really good.  Steamed egg and soup were good too but the meats where it's at and quality wise it's up at the top.  During the whole cooking of meat we had another "third" and "fourth" server.  Now I don't know if they have some kind of rotation going on cause from "second" through "fourth" they didn't say anything about the switch but proceeded to continue cooking our meat and making sure to ask how we like it cooked.  It's just weird to me since the "second" server made the comment about the "first" server moving to another section and not really knowing the order.   Our "fourth/last" server was nice I had no personal problem with him.  He finished the last of our meats and asked what flavor we wanted for our dessert.  We asked for green tea and waited for it to come.  10 minutes went by and still no dessert.  "Fourth" server came by about 15 minutes in and asked if we got our dessert which we said not yet.  He said he would check up on it and we got it a few minutes later from a buser.  "Fourth" server looked like he was running around a lot so I don't really blame him.  Nothing tops "first" server dude.  But the gap between main course and dessert was too wide a timeframe to enjoy as a complete meal.  Maybe we got the short end of the straw with our location in the restaurant.  Or just a bad time.  Meat quantity is okay but me and my gf can kill a 3-4 person combo by ourselves and we're not too big.  But quality wise is where it's at.  Left feeling satisfied but not full.  Worth the $90 or so for it?  Not for me but it was a fun experience.  Most the staff was pretty nice and accommodating but I have to take the experience today as a whole.  3 stars ( I've never written a long ass review like this but I really had to get this out.  Thanks for reading through if you did )

iica6ECVJd7TrCnlPlx96A.text: This place is deelish. When in Vegas, venture off the strip and make your way here, def worth it!

KpYPBjwp3oxnQyql0U0LjQ.text: I am giving this place one star because the hostess told us it would be a 45 minute wait, then after an hour and a half she said our table was ready, then gave the table to a smaller party that came way after us, and after 2 hours we ended up at a tiny table. Food was excellent but the host stand ruined the night and didn't really seem to care. Ask for James he was an awesome sever. Hopefully this place does better next time.

dnlxjho58JX3mDVUB5e0dA.text: The meat was fantastic!! The service was amazing and the small details like the free slushies made this place 5 stars! This is by far my most favorite Korean BBQ spot in Vegas. I had heard there are a lot of good Korean restaurants in Vegas, but this place has got to be the best. An old Korean uber driver told me it was legit and my goodness was he right! The price was outstanding for the quality as well. We went during Sunday lunch so luckily no wait, but typically I hear there's at least an hour wait for dinner. A ton of actual Korean people, so you know it's good. Take my word.

jIrvez1iGmGs-55HvNKGGQ.text: Great restaurant with great food, most tasty Korean bbq near LV down town, highly recommended

svhTIfC-8I_IQkNNzdhSlQ.text: First Impression: Hobak is located where it used to be literally a plaza with a whole row of non-occupied, connected plain buildings. Now, you cannot miss this spot driving down Spring Mountain with its little patio and red/white striped awning. The inside is amazing, super unique. You are eating inside but the interior design makes you feel like you are eating outside at a modern Korean marketplace with other seating sections that act as a little shop. Their soda cooler is the 'telephone booth.' Okay, you just have to see this HIP-ness for yourself! The restaurant was less than half full but we still had to wait 10 minutes to get seated for lunch.   Food: FYI, this is not a AYCE. Once we were seated, our table was already set up with all the banchans (7 total) along with our dipping sauces waiting for us to eat away! The banchans were all delicious which is usually rare. My boyfriend and I ordered the Hobak Beef Combo for 2 - $54.99 (Angus Brisket, Angus Ribeye, Hobak Marinated Skirt Steak) with bean paste stew, steamed egg, vegetables and cheddar sauce which was a plenty and enough for dessert in the end! Great food presentation and the meat is definitely great quality compared to all the other KBBQ places in town. I highly recommend the skirt steak as its juicy and full of flavor. The melted cheddar sauce dipped with the meat is to die for. Dessert is included in the combo and you can choose rice pop with vanilla or green tea ice cream. It's similar to an ice cream sandwich with ice cream and a layer of red bean in between rice pops (fluffy cracker like). It's a very interesting taste, nothing I've had before, yet it blends so well together.   Service: Our server was very attentive. They cook all your meat for you which is a plus so you can just enjoy eating. They always come back to cook your next type of meat once they see you've emptied the grill so no awkward wait times deciding if you should cook yourself. They pull their vents downward closer to the grill when cooking so you don't need to worry about being congested in smoke.   The Hobak hype is real! Easily the next favorite KBBQ spot in town. Even though it's not AYCE, the quality you get is worth it. I am a happy returning customer :)

DgsH7TIeTBFB-3uc2eS27A.text: Awesome food and really good bbq. Worth the price. They cook the bbq for you and answer any questions you have. Our waiter James was awesome and his recommendations were on point. Never disappointed and the dessert was pretty good too. It is korean fusion not authentic korean but still very delicious. I love that they switch out the grill when it gets burnt. Definitely coming back again.

aaPJkwXMR3Bm6523UtMzOA.text: Tawny and Bum were both awesome. I love this place. They are so accommodating, cute ambience ... And the food is top quality. The best part... They cook everything for you.

ZUq8pj8LpXEUq3tTh_gcVQ.text: 1 star for the hostess horrible decisions and communications. Didn't get to try the food yet.  Got to there place at 8:25. We have a party of 9 (7 adults + 2 kids). Told by the host it would be a 30-40 minute wait. Tey even gave us a buzzer. While waiting we noticed there were lots of small tables and no big table so we told the hostess we are willing to sit at 2 separate tables. Went up to check at 9:35 to see that they sat 6 parties ahead of us, even though we told them we were willing to sit at 2 separate table!  I'm sure the food is amazing with the 5 star reviews so with how much business you get why not invest in training your hostess with better costumer service. Train them on what to do with big parties. Before seating smaller parties ask the big party if they are willing to sit separately. It doesn't take a college degree to know that. Just common sense. Nothing is scarier than a hangry customer. My family are visiting from out of town and leave tomorrow. This was suppose to be a special dinner for the last night,  that's why we chose this place. So disappointed and upset to have our night ruined. 9 hangry customers. Don't wait until your customers are pissed off before you communicate with them. It's too late by then. Invest in a more accurate seating system and train your hostess to communicate! Seating 6 parties ahead of us is unacceptable and pure ignorance.

XnMgDX8ZxyDGzbYFPMfFqA.text: This is my 3rd time coming here and the food is awesome!! The first two times I came here, the service was a bit off but my last visit, service was excellent. Our servers name was James. He actually explained everything on the menu, how the meats were marinated, the ingredients that make up the dishes etc. He was very attentive. Hopefully we can have him as our server again during our next visit.

8PeGn9_ytbCZAiQv3O-a9g.text: Got here at 5 o'clock w no wait. Food is great, Service is great. I would give the pricing maybe 3 1/2 $ it's not AYCE so everything is a little pricey but quality is great 10/10 would come again

n61Bc-pmHJ0gqY9QFdpqDA.text: I have had quite a bit of Korean BBQ all over the California, Las Vegas and Korea. This place unfortunately did not meet my expectations as it's reputable five star status indicates. For the the following criteria were all below three stars in my humble POV: over priced meat selections, mediocre meat quality, service, ambience and wait time. The two pros of this establishment were the free slushies and one time use toothbrushes in the women's restroom. Other then that, I would go elsewhere, somewhere that has better meat quality, even if it's a little further AWAY from Spring Mtn., and even if it is a bit in the pricier side.

Sy27DhJrGlWysx2Wn8cFMA.text: This is the best place ever!! Nana is awesome! Great food, and an amazing atmosphere! You have to come here if you're in Vegas and looking for an amazing place to get Korean BBQ.

547cN4amsYUEBnFgW9qKSA.text: Great food, great service! It was an explosion of many delicious flavors. Randy explained the foods very well as he cooked it fresh right at our table.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our dessert

04faK9jTu4ESj8IPVW4nHA.text: I would say HOBAK and MAGAL are tied as the best Korean BBQ joints in Vegas. Don't expect quantity here, now quality you'll find plenty. ++ recommended.

Amos5L2tPkBP3jF0UGNQLw.text: The food and service was great! It was pretty packed but the place filled of smoke. They have complimentary slushies btw. They also have a patio. I def recommend this KBBQ!

TI3qrdooBOSps_2fc-KICg.text: Wow, just wow!!! This Korean bbq is way better than any others in Las Vegas. The meat was high quality and the taste was just breathe taking. The HoBak definitely can't compare with "All You Can Eat Bbq" The beef combo was the one we ordered and there is three or four (I don't remember exactly) different type of beef and many tasty side dishes and plus rice craker ice cream!! Full course with resonable price.   The atmosphere was very very unique and old fashion. I really like. Two thumbs up!!! It feels so warm and enjoyable. Services were great as well.     I can say it will be one of the best restaurant in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Every single side dishes are really tasty!! Yam yam

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

28jtaB9JZCX8lpXG1dFnVA.text: Today was my second time here and compared to the first, I would give it zero stars if I could. The food was decent, meat was okay quality, but for only 3 types of meat (we ordered the beef combo), that was supposedly meant to feed 3-4, one person could finish it by them self. Oh and I can't forget, all for $90. They forgot to give us our cheddar cheese dip that was part of the combo and we had to ask numerous times for side dishes that we eventually did not get.  We mentioned multiple times and they still did not apologize or sounded like they cared either.   Good taste or bad, from this terrible experience and poor customer service I would never come back and would advise the same to my friends and family. Do not waste your money or time here.

8QU6C8gA3C43C90VcMBajA.text: Their service and food are top notch. The wait staff would cook for you and often ask if you want seconds on your sides. The brisket and skirt steak were my favorite. Sadly, the boneless short ribs weren't as flavorful as I'd hoped. But I live for the ice cream sandwiches they serve here.  However, their extra amenities are really what put it over the top. Free slushies while you wait, free charging service, and even odor protectors for your clothes. The funniest thing was the bathroom. They have tootbrushes, toothpaste and mouthwash in the bathroom accompanied by a sign that says "Ladies, he hates bad breath."   All in all I will definitely be coming back whenever I'm in Las Vegas.

ZnGOCd8WwoYOh-LBgn_DPA.text: A favorite Korean BBQ whenever I'm in Vegas. So much delicious food. Great taste, modern Korean BBQ atmosphere, and good value!

vknd9Epnr9TG6WDx1afs7g.text: SOOOOO FREAKIN' GOOD! I can't get enough of this place. Of course the good places are always busy (almost 2 hour wait at times), but gosh dang its sooo worth it! Probably THE BEST KBBQ in Vegas, scratch that IT IS THE BEST. I'm craving this place just as I'm writing this. Ambiance is really cozy and cute and super fast service. Come here hungry and try as much as you can because everything tastes amazing.

81QGg9-1YnITPjM-N09Mug.text: Decided to go here based on the reviews.  Overall food was good, meat was up to par.  Service was a little weird as the girls were TOO ATTENTIVE with the food.  For some of us, we just want to dive in and cook ourselves.  Korean BBQ place but they didn't have Bulgogi on the menu.  I thought I read the menu wrong and proceeded to order extra meat, and requested Bulgogi.  The girl looked at me with a smirk and said they didn't have Bulgogi like an all you can eat place.  After she walked away and i thought about the comment, i wondered if she just dissed me based on my request.  Overall, not worthy of the Five stars that everyone posted.

yd1jqroIaHZefS98CSFRIA.text: What a great experience!  I'm giving five stars for the atmosphere, decor, service, and food.  Now I will say it's not really my cup of tea but overall it was a GREAT experience!  We came here for lunch with a group of 5, the seating was a bit snug for even the large round table.  Once seated, they bring out all the side dish; the kimchee, sales, veggie, etc...sorry I can't seem to name it all, but it was all DELICIOUS!  The menu is very clear to understand and I love the fact they made ordering for groups of ppl easy.  We ordered the large Hobak Family Combo for $89.99 (feeds 3-4ppl).  We did not go hungry for the amount of food in ratio to people.    Now here is the part that I wasn't a fan of...I'm use to going to a Korean BBQ, order my meat, and cooking it on my own time frame, here they cook it for you.  Now with a group of 5 people around a crowded round table where the grill takes up 80% of the table space, to have a server (a 6th person) standing in between you and another person, first, makes it hard to talk to that person next to you, and secondly, it became even more crowded.  So for me, it was a bit annoying, but it's not to discourage other Yelpers from going!  I definitely encourage everyone to go and try it out.  And decide on your own if it's your cup of tea.  It wasn't for me, but I had a great time!  Servers were all friendly and tentative, the food was amazingly delicious, and I definitely love the atmosphere.  The only thing I wasn't too crazy about was having someone cooking the food for me.  But again, this is my personal preference.  I encourage everyone to at least try it once because it was definitely a positive experience.  And I would definitely go back if someone was throwing a party or if I was invited.  I just wouldn't go on my own, only because I prefer to cook my own food.  Overall, it is definitely a great place to check it out and try.  And make your own call...you won't be disappointed!

AYK-xVw6OkY7CC3VKh8OBQ.text: We ordered family set 3. They cook the meat the table for you. The skirt steak was good. The short ribs were just ok. Overall, The BBQ is good but they rip you off with the worst  in town. 10 dollars for the worst . Overpriced.

TNmJCE4QjiH8XSVpcgs_og.text: First off our server #Andrea was super information , amazing and attentive.  She is one of those 3 P's I tell you about professional , pretty and polite.  She informed us on all of the meats.  Right away I told her I'm a snob in regards to Korean food.  Though the Kalbi marinade is not your traditional Korean marinade it was sweet light tangy and super delish.  The quality of their meat is hands down the best of any Korean restaurant in town.  To be honest however I was not a fan of their kimchi at all but that was not enough to take away any stars.  Each server chipped in helping other servers it was great! Like one big happy family helping wherever they can.   The  ban chan or side dishes , first off their dweanjang soup was so yummy, the bean sprout salad was my Absolute favorite and those  Bucheen Gae pancakes made with potatoes wow those are to die for.  You won't be disappointed eating here as a matter of fact I won't eat at any Korean restaurants in Vegas but Hobak for sure we'll lets just say I will be returning.  Make sure to ask for Andrea she was an absolute delight and the prettiest of all servers !  I love women who are gorgeous and super kind and not in that uber fake way. IJS

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our gorgeous server Andrea !!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More protein nom nom nom

5w_yG1v6ptI1YR7y4ezFFw.text: A bit on the pricy side but you get tons of foods and it is excellent. The dishes kept coming. Waitress was very nice and accommodating. Next time I drive through Vegas I will defiantly want to eat here again.

0a7S1VT-RbIyFM76OOg7SA.text: Wow! Just wow! First night in Vegas and I wanted to grill. The fiance wanted kbbq. I didn't want to pay to cook my meat. I was so surprised that they do all the cooking for you. Bic did an awesome job. The meat was perfect and very tasty. This beats all the other kbbq places I've been to in Los Angeles.

sNNP0vXO0h51oeJztBZSUg.text: This place is soooo good! My wife had been maybe three times before I went. The restaurant atmosphere is really cool, I love the James Bond movie poster(s). The quality is really high. It's a fun place for us to take our kids. They really like watching the food on the grill. Everyone should try it you won't regret it.

6VeZ4NXcQ6NBax0-AACesw.text: Went twice in a month because it was so good. All the beef dishes were great and the kim chee and bean sprout sides were delicious.  Service is fast especially if you are seated in the center of the room. Can use some more drinks on the menu but the meat priority is on point. Nice touch with the slush puppies at the entrance.

B9rdSPV0ox4-pbNVFM7TFA.text: Korean BBQ... excellent. Definitely one of the best places in the area. It has a nice atmosphere.

GG8JNen6vIM9IUX-F4RHsg.text: I wish I lived near here so I can explore this restaurant more. It was pretty apparent most people came for BBQ.   You are first greeted by free cold water bottles right outside the restaurant. When we went we were greeted by friendly hostess. There's also free slushie machine right by the cashier.   I didn't have time so got Korean spicy noodles. It was good! All the banchan, side dishes were fairly good. They had kimchi, Korean pancake, water radish kimchi, seaweed salad, mook (jelly), spicy root dish.   Service was good too. This yummy lunch with all the banchan was only about $10. Score!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banchan platter. You can ask for refill. :)
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy nangmyun/noodle. Go for it, if you like really spicy stuff!

qiHcmEbHUv-HUBFjVavjjQ.text: We love Hobak since they opened! We never had meat with cheese fondue but now we really love it!

i4X0uMfJNbuPyPhvyAZK6A.text: Great and friendly service as we entered the restaurant. I ordered the spam bi-bim bapp.....delicious.  It was spicy enough without the extra pepper paste.  Plenty of side dishes came out. We even got a 10% discount for coming in during lunch. (It wasn't that crowded.) We also got the ice cream...delicious.  It was green tea ice cream sandwiched by rice cracker.  Whenever my family comes back, definitely need to make a stop here to eat again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xVrtQkCJi6HSB65zEt8WXQ.text: As a Korean reviewing Korean BBQ, this place is pretty phenomenal.  I would totally come back if I lived in the area.  It was very busy, but service was still friendly, and the food is top notch.  Great quality meats and fresh veggies and banchan (side dishes).    Felt like I was back in Korea.  Go, if you like Korean BBQ, you'll definitely enjoy this place!

5WYljMPJfTyEfs4x5XU3bg.text: BEST KOREAN BBQ IN VEGAS!!   The meats are high quality, juicy, and absolutely delicious. The best (and my most favorite part) is the SERVERS COOK IT FOR YOU at your table!! =D They know exactly how long to cook the meat for the best taste.   We always order the Hobak Family Combo which features a mix of beef and pork. Combo 1 meats are half marinated, half not marinated. Combo 2 meats are not marinated at all (least favorite). And in Combo 3, all meats are marinated. I love Combo 3 but be wary as some options are super spicy like the Spicy Angus Boneless Short Rib. I love it but if you're not a fan of spicy, you can always ask for the non-spicy substitute. There's so much food in addition to the meat like the banchan (kimchee, salad, bean sprouts, kimchee water, Korean pancake, beef stew, steamed egg, etc.) and the dessert. Don't forget to save room for their amazing Rice Pop Ice Cream!   The dining room is so fun! Love the street decor. The bathrooms (1 stall for men and 1 stall for women) have free toothbrushes with toothpaste and mouthwash with funny signs.   They're also great for birthdays. They bring out a huge sparkler on your dessert and sing happy birthday with loud, attention grabbing music.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice Pop Ice Cream (Strawberry &amp; Green Tea)
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They seat you at your table that is already set with banchan =]

WEii2i93LFAfKpOFnujACQ.text: Excellent restaurant with so many amazing amenities, such as complimentary toothbrush, cork (BYOW), free charging cables for your smart phones, free popcorn while you wait, etc.  We had the #3 combo for two people w/ a myriad of marinated beef cuts & pork belly. The service was great w/ friendly staff, including the expediter. The banchans were fresh & delicious; & our favorite was the complimentary seafood soup.

woMQ_rCZP_Rqy7q0bNiJZg.text: There are a few places I want to give 6 or more stars, but the Koreans know how to get a restaurant right.  If you give them enough time, they'll build an iPhone killer or an luxury car replacement for less.   Hobak, I was told from a local, was the #1 Korean restaurant.  I was expecting something a hit cleaner and better than Ginseng or the holes in the wall, but you get the real deal that is usually only found in the districts of Gangnam or LA.     For the price as well, you can't beat it.  I've been paying for sh*t at these prices, but I'm walking away with so much more. I ordered two meals to go since the quality so much better than what I've been eating for the past 5 days.   It's a bit of a drive from the strip, but damn, it's so well worth it!

EyQ1P924BloNYoBLSfBvgw.text: I am quite disappointed with dinner at Hobak last night. After reading amazing reviews on Yelp I was expecting a delicious meal but that didn't happen.  Boyfriend and I ordered Family Combo #3 (Suppose to come with marinated Skirt steak, Spicy Angus Bonless Short ribs, Aged Short ribs, & choice of Grilled spicy pork belly or aged pork rib). The Server told us that they are out of the aged short rib and will replace that will extra marinated skirt steak, we cannot even add money to replace with anything else (which is weird). We also add an order of Jap-Chae (which is a huge disappointment!)  The combo also come bean paste soup, steamed egg, and ice cream. The side dishes were just ok , wasn't a lot of choices, also included a small salad.   The Marinated Skirt steak was the best meat out of the ones we got, but still not amazing. The spicy boneless short rib is very chewy, overly spicy and no other taste at all. The pork belly is just meh, doesn't feel like eating pork belly at all, kinda like stir fried pork slices.  Overall is disappointing and wouldn't come back again since there are other korean BBQ in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gu1peMWAgH0eW8zH2heX5w.text: Located in chinatown, about a $7 plus uber ride from the strip, this place is so good we came here twice in a row.  One of the better Kbbq places, comparable to kang ho dong in NYC. Everything is pretty good, the wet aged marinated galbi was probably some of the best kbbq meat Ive had.  they also have the korean shaken lunch boxes which is worth getting (KHD is better).  Obviously has beers and soju to wash all that goodness down.  Each table does have a vent but you will still smell like meat when you are done.  Price seems fair for what you get, and the quality of the ingredients.    One con that I can see: they dont have lettuce wraps, so if you are used to making your own wraps, its not possible here  Definitely worth a trip out from the strip, as with all kbbq places the more the merrier.

SYIoN44e0ZaqgmU8RAg4HA.text: The food was pretty good not going front or whateva (especially the angus fried rice) shit smack however the service is complete doodoo like they were so good to other tables kneeling down and checking on them and shit but then they didn't nothing to me. Lowkey discrimination but whateva. Food slap doe periodt.

-tvA0EZBuDbSadLZ8fJ4kA.text: Best Korean bbq and service I've gone too.  Food and sides were delicious.   They thought of everything.  Mouth wash to tooth brush to fabreze for your clothes.  That's service.

FEGAs_xMiF2ngOCoL1pd2A.text: We are staying at the Encore for a convention, and asked the concierge for a dinner recommendation. She recommended this place, and she is absolutely right!  Korean barbecue is prepared at your table. And it is an actual table with a charcoal grill in the middle.   First of all, this place is waaaay off the strip. Don't get nervous. This is the real Las Vegas.   We had a party of 6, and ordered a variety of beef and pork, as well as about 4 pitchers of Asahi. Our server Katie was awesome!  Fun all through all of the courses and excellent with her recommendations.   The meat was amazing. Done to perfection. Savory and spicy. I am in a food coma. I can't write any more. You have to try this place!  And BTW, our bill was $240. For 6 people. In Las Vegas.   Nap time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 out of 5 dentists approve.

tKKGszWSIq89bt8ER7BSyA.text: We have been here many times, but today. The service was bad. We did not see the usual wait staff, today. No, one checked on us after dropping the meat off. We had to wave down the bus boy, for everything!  We did notice other tables upset about the lack of service around us, too. So, it wasn't just us. The restaurant was dead, too. Maybe, this is why!  We got so tired of waiting for the check, that we just got up and went to the register to pay.  We won't be back.

6jZjtENHqOeyWUGpD4RdPw.text: I love this place, definitely one of my faves when it comes to Korean bbq. I've tried several but always end up going back. Great environment & service! food is really good and they're open late which makes it super convenient. Must try if you haven't

2ocAb45IQ_4SQyer2aymrg.text: Best Korean bbq in Las Vegas get the family combos pick all different types of bbq and soups desserts

4HUl5hlyluQrWZ1L50YmpQ.text: Hands down BEST KBBQ!! Quality food and service!! That is why its not an all you can eat kkbq like other chains in vegas. With each combo lunch/dinner you select you get complimentary icecream sandwiches with a variety of flavors! So yumms!Try and get there before 6:30pm though! It gets busy quick!

LZzJsgV58aPtObrf6xL_Ww.text: Amazing place!! Visiting from PNW and wish they have in Seattle too!! Service was fantastic food was tasty.

xbqmycUJglfR3Q9Ovkcm6w.text: This place is the closest I've gotten to eating an authentic Korean meal since I was last in South Korea. Everything in the restaurant reminded me of South Korea, even the posters hung on the walls.   We ordered the Small family combo for 4 adults and 2 children. The food tasted great. The servers cooked the meat for you. They cooked a small portion of each type of meat well done for my pregnant wife. The meal came with soups to start with. We had our side dishes refilled multiple times. The meats were cooked to perfection. We ended our meal with their cookies and cream ice cream.   Overall it was a great experience, the food was delicious, and the service was quick and nonstop. I'll be coming back again next time I'm in Las Vegas.

2d_rMPHYZ3X0JTGl1Z8Snw.text: My friend has been talking this place up, so I've been looking forward to trying it out. Personally, I believe KBBQ should be all-you-can-eat, but I I'm told the a la carte joints have higher quality meats.  Any way, the spread of snacks were pretty good. They had two salads, of which both were tasty because of their dressing. I've always loved the spicy bean sprout salad; I had a bowl to myself. I recall going to other spots with a broader collection of pickled goodies, but it's not that important to me. I did also have the scrambled egg dish, and the zucchini/tofu soup.   Oscar, our hwaro master, was great. I must admit, I did enjoy having our meats cooked so we could focus on chatting. He asked what temperature we liked our beef and took care of the rest. We ordered a large set 3, and all the meats were delicious. Unfortunately, they don't let you substitute meats. I will point out that their spicy marinade was a bit much for my friends. So make sure you can stand the heat before you order.  The combo also included ice cream sandwiches for dessert. The "bun" is a rice cracker, which was a great texture for the ice cream. I went with choco mint and cookies and cream; both were excellent.

4yBYWnOoREkxQDK0OSx4dw.text: Extremely good meat quality and a very friendly staff with a great atmosphere!  Best Korean BBQ hands down!

FkWv1oLipfS4xcDNUCudLg.text: This place is the best Korean bbq I had in my entire life the Service is the best I recommend the the family combo if you have many people

-0s41LWqha6tWuZAmdsg8g.text: This restaurant is prety good!! The food was delicious, the staff was friendly and funny!! Pleasant music on the background!! Very very good quality of beef!! I love this place!!

XiIO0mkYp8OQCU08NEd4gA.text: The quality of food went down since I've been there last time. It's just ok now nothing to brag about

1QuAJX-9LYtrbWWHuwVHUQ.text: Service is great even though this place is always crowded.  Been here about 10 times now, and have NEVER once been disappointed with the food nor the service.  For Korean BBQ, this is as good as it gets.  Just order your meat entries, and there are so many great sides that is included, and the sides are also all "bottomless".  I tend to go with 4 people, and we order 4 entries, and my groups have never finished all the meats.  I recommend to go here as hungry as possible to finish the food when it is fresh and great.

RjbtxckkdjXzqffQ2QDZtw.text: This is the best Korean BBQ ever! The meat taste so fresh. Serving is awesome. Everything is fast and clean. Too bad they don't have it in California. I will probably come to eat bbq here whenever I visit LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8c6KBMSLtGnW1_Iy0oJEQg.text: What amazing service and experience! We had not experienced Korean BBQ before but had heard this place was

jOdgGDlcKriexWxC92kRzA.text: One of the absolute best Korean BBQ experiences I have ever had! Had heard lots of good things about Hobak and had a chance to check it out during a recent business trip to Vegas. All I can really say is "wow!" , everything was fantastic! The selection of meats are amazing and the quality is absolutely stupendous! The service was excellent, all the sides and banchan were great. I will absolutely go back every time I am in Vegas and can't wait to try so many more things there! Absolutely recommend!

vJENRU4V5IRZCHVallv5Ug.text: Oh so yummy.  Love KBBQ and this was on par with Kang Oh Dong Baek Jong in so-cal.  We especially loved the free ice cream at end.  Never had my ice cream sandwiched between thin puffed rice cakes with sweet red and some strawberry sauce in the vanilla ice cream.  The chocolate and strawberry was good too.  It got a stamp of approval from all kids!  Slushie at front was nice touch for the 108 degree we walked in from.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream.  Yum.

3c1Kln6JAO0wt71677nSpQ.text: We've always enjoyed eating here. We really enjoy the quality of the meat. It gets a bit noisy inside but it's great if you go with a bunch of friends. One star reduction because some of my friends got an upset stomache after I took them here when in town. Hopefully it was a one time thing. Have no problem going back.

1nn3Enb6Y8Oc2QIfwtOVIw.text: Awesome atmosphere, especially when they bust out the birthday celebrations! Food was also excellent, however i feel you can get comparable quality for less price.

Q0c4SVXOVXeQkfiHqvOrPQ.text: I love coming to this place! They have great service and great food!!! The quality of their meats are amazing, tender and soft and filled with flavor. If you're looking for a great Korean bbq place you must try this place!!!

7C1aK7LTwQsqxu0nUS3OTg.text: Great food and fun atmosphere, every cut of meat was delicious.  Service was good, if you are looking for a different atmosphere and a lot of fun I highly recommend!  They don't take reservations so be prepared to wait but it is worth it!

mSYuNRxP-sjR7JYSBCcR1w.text: Came here while on a work trip and boy was it worth the drive off the strip and a 30 minute wait. We were a bit aggressive and ordered 4 different types of meat for 3 people. The spicy Kalbi was a favorite, never had that back in MD. Meat was perfectly marinated and not over marinated. Service was very attentive despite us needing water refills every 10 minutes. The meat sweats were on that night and we loved it! If you're eating here for the first time, make sure you ask them to describe all the side dishes. We were noobs so we didn't know what to do with the sushi rice they gave us that looked like mochi or something you had to cook. We almost grilled it.

Azu7jnCRDMLIVs0BoP5FlQ.text: Best Korean in town, possibly that I have ever had anywhere. Staff is INCREDIBLE and they give the best Birthday surprise. :)

i6mND1Hawk2bTBQT7jEWmw.text: My first experience having Korean bbq was amazing here. My boyfriend and I shared the beef combo (Beef brisket, strip steak and short ribs). The meat was extremely juicy and flavorful. Short rib were well marinated. Side dishes and soups were so distinct and fresh.  I was beyond full and happy with my experience.

PqQZvYIoOSr_IqbqUvuNJw.text: Nothing exceptional here except for the service. Everyone was great and got us everything quickly. We got the large family mix with 4 meats. I like cooking the meats as a group but they cook everything for you in front of you. The meats are so plain, but they are quality which makes up for the lack of flavor. The salads aren't bad, and the bean soup was delicious. If you're used to a younger, social vibe I'd pass on this place. Everything was very clean, and like I said, what the food lacked the servers made up for.

dKeFreWoKHxaOv-L-5R0kg.text: The meat is excellent quality. The people are nice and friendly but never bring any refills unless you ask. We had to ask for water 3 times. We had to ask for the free side refills as well. They were not good about removing empty containers either. The free sides are very pathetic. I have never been to a Korean restaurant with such a bad selection of free sides. The water refills sometimes comes in a steel container and sometimes in these horrible plastic things that look like someone's cheap used personal water bottle. The quality of the meat is most important, so I still give it 4 stars and it's rare to find  'nice' Korean food servers even if they aren't so good at the service part

cTki2eVOEeVis1lF6FSHFQ.text: Very busy place. Hard to get in without a wait. Very quick service as one would expect from a Korean BBQ. Will say to much meat, and not enough seafood/veggies. Spicy items are, but not over the top like some. We will go back to HOBACK! Just not in a hurry to wait 45 minutes like last two times. We are usually in big groups so this is surely an issue with waiting. But most go with at least 4-8 peeps.

pQajw_E_pEdP4RCKy9g2Lw.text: Exactly what Vegas needed.   This restaurant def reminded me of LA. This place has both the Quarters and Kang Hodang vibe to me. They totes stole the cheese dips from Quarters though.   They have a extensive menu for combos. I like how they also have a mixture of pork and beef for a combo.   I got the all beef and everything tasted great and tender. My favorite was the boneless short rib. Their banchan was also yummy! I love the bok choy and their kimchi. Hobak also gives ice cream at the end of the meal!   The service was attentive and refilled whatever we asked.

dxbFkaoms6vWfYk6J2Qa3g.text: First experience with Korean food.  Fabulous unbelievable huge portions. What a great dining experience.  The staff was incredibly helpful answering all of our questions.  Great place to take out of town guests.  BTW the bbq order for 2 is perfect for 4 people.

L512UBreRXDSQk0bvuaXUQ.text: The food was extremely delicious and the service was very good.  They were very helpful and very polite.  They made u feel welcomed and they even cooked your meat for you which was a plus.  The dessert was my favorite it was so cute and yummy!!!

2Rfssj185baQ0sHDu3FnKQ.text: If I could do more stars I would. This place is so upscale, clean, delicious, and attentive. The staff is incredible and the meat is to die for. Definitely the best Korean barbecue in Las Vegas. Give it a try and you will fall in love with the atmosphere.

QnfgmM9w5M_9GkYPMSMK7g.text: We went to Hobak after seeig the great reviews in Yelp and we are not disappointed. We ordered the large beef combo for 3-4 people and it came with a lot of meat. The Angus ribeye was the best BBQ we've ever had, and we eat Korean regularly in the NY/NJ area. Amazingly tender and juicy. We spoke to our server and he tells us this is the first restaurant the owner has opened in the US. We hope they bring their talents to NJ!

VbpZJmBA-uMXGBdGQJjoBA.text: At first I wondered why we had to wait for a table when I saw at least half a dozen available. Then when we were called and brought to the table, it was all set up with banchan. I appreciated that detail. We ordered the small family combo (beef and pork). They advertise that they use Black Angus beef and boy is it good! The beef is very tender and rich. The pork was just as good. One surprise was the cheese that was served with the meat. I had NEVER had melted cheddar cheese with my Korean BBQ. Tip: The cheese is AMAZEBALLS with the spicy pork! I can't forget to mention that the meat is cooked over charcoal grills. The variety of banchan was very good as well: kimchi, pickled bokchoy, pickled daikon, salad and bean sprouts. The combo came with steamed egg, daengjang jjigae and a wonderful (interesting) dessert of sweet bean paste and green tea ice cream between rice cakes. Overall, the experience was great: fun ambience, fresh, high quality ingredients, and great service.

4c1ASEuQSN0tJjUfyg-3dg.text: Absolutely best Kbbq place ive ever been to. Same pricing as hwaro but the quality of the meat and everything they offer is amazing. Although it's not all you can eat, they have packages that feed a party of 3-4 and it was the same amount of food I usually eat at hwaro or any other ayce restaurant. And when you do come if it's possible and he's not too busy in his section request Randy you won't be disappointed, super friendly and helpful and alert!

_C4frKipPqnqvpwrlcFqCA.text: This Korean BBQ place has no comparison nor competition. The genre can be considered modern and fusion, with steak grilled over coal, then dipped with a choice of melted cheese, sesame oil or a onion and jalapeno pickle. The marinated pork belly is amazing, the pork ribs are to die for. There is generous helpings of steamed egg, which is not typically done in Korean restaurant. I want to bring you guys to Austin Texas right now where I live!!!

qybz9RUR6wzhjE6noEHCUg.text: We give this place 5 stars especially for our server, Cody.  Not only did he cook but engaged in our conversations as well. Excellent service! We were a bit concerned with the hour wait time, but it was well worth it.

bRAoNUWGuVHtHVsQrkCtFA.text: Amazing service and amazing food!! Go see Jayden he is awesome :) don't go anywhere else, this stuff is so worth the money and the time.

YLoKPVtiWYEJ5nX4rw1rZQ.text: Very good spot. I love their desert, ice cream sth. Lol. Also, they have a very nice surroundings!

UX54vY_gSfY-P7ZxwozcsA.text: Interesting lively atmosphere. Food was excellent and the wait staff were very anxious to please. Food arrived quickly (perhaps to get fast throughput of customers as there is a waiting line for tables). Style seemed traditional and yet different - like serving short rib in "sushi" style meaning a piece of rib on a ball of rice with wasabi. We had the beef combo of brisket, rib eye and short rib and they were all tender and full of flavor. I would recommend this place to those in search of Korean BBQ any time. Dessert was included and was delicious served within a Korean style wafer. Overall the meal was good value

KGjSTKAqNj-wqvIfitj8ww.text: Past this place quite a few times on my way home from work and I was really feeling like kbbq. I'm not a fan of all you can eat style, more of quality so I gave this place a shot. The cuts of the meat were great and the ambiance is nice too. The Service is 5 star

-rgjggjlxUmmi--2HWxjPw.text: Hobak is the best place for Korean BBQ!!  It was amazing. I have been many restaurant in vegas , but it was the best. I ate pork combo, and it has really good price and service . Ice cream which served in last , it is very special. Ice cream with Korean cookie was really yummy  I loved it so much

4bo3NLJhZj9o4FAIOe_ORg.text: I dislike how popular this place has become!  I don't want to wait an hour to be seated when I am HANGRY (which I always am when I come here)!  LOL!!  It's a good sign that the food is amazing but it still sucks to wait when I'm HANGRY!   I do like that they give you free slushies as a "thank you for waiting so long" - it keeps the kids happy!!  Service is phenomenal and the meat is so freaking amazing!  I absolutely love the brisket on top of the rice balls and dipped in the Hobak sauce!  Oh Hobak Sauce - how I love you!!  I could eat anything and everything soaked in Hobak sauce!  The glass noodle appetizer is my favorite and the potato pancakes are a must for me!  You can't go wrong here!  It's also a great place for a birthday as they turn the music up and bring you a dessert with a sparkler.  The tables are quite small and there isn't much room for your belongings.  I choose to leave my purse at home when we come here.  Beer, wine and Soju are served here - no hard alcohol.  The bathrooms offer free tooth brushes.  Hobak needs to expand or open a second location!

aBD1oLFaTN7LAcvOVcfHaw.text: I don't usually do reviews but this is 5 stars for sure.   Food is great, employees are friendly and very attentive. Even when they switched the server for our table they still know what's going on and keep checking up us. The quality of the meat is really good for the price. 4 people for 100 bucks. We got the family combo. Definitely coming back!!

nc5QeEJyxnn_8vBBbHrK7A.text: Food was really good... great ambiance and the service is extremely good... our server was Julie and she was super friendly and provided great recommendations.

EZ9SrHsHgeWm6aIWkfF-HA.text: Was super delighted to discover a new Korean bbq open up while I was attending university. This place is nothing less than great service and top quality meat marinated to excellence. You definitely are paying for the savory quality and experience . If you're going to go out for Korean bbq, try this unique, hip place. The atmosphere and lighting is perfect for a date, anniversary, or any special occasion with minimal-average noise level. The service is excellent as they provide water bottles outside and free ice slushies to help with the wait. (There seems to always be a wait of about 10-20 minutes-but worth it). If you're new to Korean bbq, this is a practical place to check out because the staff basically checks in periodically and cooks the meat to your liking. Visiting this place is guaranteed to give you an unforgettable korean bbq experience. The portion is fair and will surely have you full. I experienced bbq in S.Korea, and I can say this restaurant definitely does not disappoint my expectation. I would take any of my friends here and recommend it to the avid meat lover. Bbq is cooked over charcoal to guarantee the best taste. Sides and salad are so great to bring out the taste of the soft and tender meat. The dwaenjangjjigae (bean paste stew) And steamed egg I found to be especially delicious and eaten alongside the bbq. You couldn't possibly expect more from a delectable dining experience.

YA9_JmeAYgVUYs6bEjWnNw.text: Went for the first time last night, which was also my first time going to any Korean BBQ restaurant. I had a really great time. The food was delicious, the staff was attentive and the atmosphere was so much fun. We got the small #2 family combo for the 3 of us, Which was Angus brisket, premium pork belly, skirt steak, pork jowl and had strawberry ice cream for dessert. It had us stuffed.   It's definitely a place to bring close friends and family (there is a lot of sharing) but I definitely wouldn't bring younger kids. I kept thinking if my 1 year old was there he would try to constantly touch where the food was being cooked.   I'm for sure down to go again, I think it's a great option for a fun night out!   (The pictures don't even come close to showing everything hat was included)

0ULOZzYE8XHkqbcBka2A1w.text: I'm a local and this is one of the places I bring every visitor. Everyone loves it and we're always ready for a coma when we're done. Highly recommend the beef combo with the short ribs and skirt steak, and get extras of the potato pancake (especially when they're hot!). Ask for sesame oil in your salt for the brisket - it's a game changer. Expert tip: after you eat the yummy bits in your soup, spoon the egg into the broth and let it soak up the flavor. Our server Matthew was very attentive and the entire staff will stop to help. If you're in the mood for drinks, can't go wrong with the blue soju.

N3fHTBBzZ83f7T51jF_yOw.text: Hobak is one of the better Korean BBQ places in town. Hobak can be busy especially during dinner time so I usually call to ask about their current wait time. They have good quality meats. I usually get beef brisket and the skirt steak. I also recommend getting one of the combos to save extra $$$. The combos also come with a DELICIOUS ice cream sandwich (MUST TRY). I will definitely be back for more at Hobak.

iJTnl-_QaOe_kPxg2GXRDw.text: This is the best Korean BBQ joint in the city! Amazing cuts of meat and great service. Also comes with all of the extra sides for the combo (steamed egg, Soy Bean Soup, & Desert)!  I think the best part is the actual flavor and quality of the meat. It's not all you can eat which in my opinion is better so you are paying for quality and receiving quality.  I have been to many other KBBQ in Las Vegas (Gen, Honey Pig, etc.) but Hobak is by far the best.  PS. Denise was awesome as well as all of the other servers!

Pv1x2yBF7_esV1OuqDJSkg.text: Me and my friends came here as our first time venturing outside of the strip and the food was amazing.  We were a party of 3 and we were unsure what to order at first.  We were going to go with ordering a combo dinner but decided instead to order the short rib, pork belly, and the spicy fried rice and it was a great call.  The perfect amount of food and didn't overly stuff ourselves and finished with the cookies and cream rice cracker desert.   Very highly recommend because the food was absolutely delicious.  Also...  cook the kimchee.  Delicious when grilled.

To7pNQxnLQUudYBGt9y23w.text: Amazing service! Shout out to Crysta! She was always on point and catered to our party of 10. Never had to ask another, very persistent and attentive. Much mahalo to your courteous attitude and great customer service!! Aloha Crysta

My friend and I went in 30 minutes before closing because we didn't know they had changed their hours and they still served us and they were all just really sweet overall. Loved all the side dishes. Would love to come back if I ever visit Las Vegas again. But beware it is very smokey in there and it that smell will stick to your clothes soo... yeah.

ItgtiAUh94ZTKVnBk9DAhg.text: Food: Korean BBQ. We ordered the Hobak Beef Combo. The Aged Short Rib was the best of all the meat. Next time, I would forgo this combo meal and just order all Aged Short Rib. We also ordered Jap Chae which they kept forgetting and finally it came at the end of our meal, which really sucked. This place is my husband's favorite, but I prefer the more traditional Dae Jang Keum (DJK), because I like the traditional side dishes and their jap chae is MUCH better.  Service: this is more service oriented than DJK because they cook the food for you (in front of you on the grill). I don't really like this, but my husband enjoys this level of service.  Ambiance: really cool how it's decorated so that you feel like you're in an outside street scene.  Cost: More expensive than DJK, so we call this the "fancy BBQ place".  Bottom line - food is better at DJK, but if you want a higher level of service and nicer environment, then go to Hobak.

2hZGeQn4FnVTReug6yVgeQ.text: Excellent quality meats accompanied by great service. All the sides were delicious, the meat was tender, not much fat. The whole meal was flavorful and it included complimentary soup and dessert.  We were stuffed by the time we left. The service was great, staff was very friendly.  We will definitely be visiting Hobak again.

AwBhXyY_8x8dQ_BnngmGqg.text: There are plenty of KBBQ places to eat, but Hobak is one my favorite places to go to. I went around 6:30 on a Thursday evening and we thought there was going to be about an hour wait, but it was only 10 minutes and they got us seated quickly and efficiently. They do not have an all you can eat options, but I was still full from the food we got. We ended up getting brisket, short rib, pork belly, and ribeye. All the meats were delicious and cooked to perfection. My only thing is that because the employees do all of the cooking, it takes away from the KBBQ experience, but that is just a personal preference of mine. Other than that I have nothing else to complain about!

JGQ4mjFmPKk-xOhHX07mow.text: Food good, service not so much. Felt like I wore my invisible clothes. Not sure I'll be back and it's 3 minutes drive from my house.

7SiBWg7Qdv2K9s0WElwOIQ.text: This is a really fun place and great food.  I found it on top 10 places to eat in yelp for LV. It's a hall to get there - it's about 5 miles outside the strip in chinatown.  it's worth the drive. it's a casual family atmosphere.   tables are around a grill.  they cook the food in front of you. we had a table of 5 and did family style.   we did the brisket, pork belly, spicy short ribs and something other pork.    it was all good but the spicy short ribs were the stand out.  go there.  you will be happy.

9iGmE442itCiwmDkAqZzIw.text: Brian is an attentive, caring and enthusiastic waitress that served me today  Great environment. Food here is amazing. The meat is really fresh.  This should be on everyone's bucket list if they are in Vegas and like the taste of real meats

34SxsHqJDn-GZvGa3Q5_YQ.text: Absolutely wonderful experience all around. I ate here for my first time two weeks ago with a good friend. It was easily within our top three meals of our lives. No hyperbole intended.   Just returned with our family including our children. This was a huge hit for everyone at the table. Excellent service all around and an delicious experience topped off with sublime Korean ice cream sandwiches!

dqJtZxgUYFV9OXYver0-Ag.text: Most restaurants in the area open at 5pm. We were hungry so we end up here.  Good quality meat and excellent service. We will be back.

tt6qJ-aS7HM-iNxlxPWnBQ.text: Customer services always a win! They try to accommodate you and explain the meats seasoning. A little history and friendliness will always have customer coming back. Great food average prices.

xOMBUlDqBW4TWFOzOUUzuQ.text: I love this place. High quality, delicious and a super rad, friendly staff. Second trip is just as good as the first. Highly recommended..

QjPpnAy6gUvdhion8J4PGA.text: 1st time here. The meats are fresh and service is excellent. The servers cook your meats and veggies. The sides are endless. Will definitely come back in the future.

qvd8i8bFKyfKtk-a3TMzAQ.text: We came here on Friday night. They told me the wait time was 45 minutes when we signed in but we waited over one hour to be seated... We ordered Hobak family combo for two. It came with soup, salad and all kinds of Korean side dishes. I ate too much of the side dishes before the meat came out. Everything was delicious! It said "for 2 people" on the menu, but it was enough to feed 3 people. The beef was so tender and the pork was seasoned very well (tasty!). I liked spicy pork with cheese sauce. We couldn't finish everything so we took some home. Plus, I got beef bones Souvenir for my dogs :-) there was a lot of meat around them. They loved it! The waiters and the waitresses that cooked our meat were so nice and attentive.  One hour wait was a little too long for me but I would LOVE to come back here one of these days... P.S. I parked in the mister zone right in front of the entrance door, but my car didn't get wet at all :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N89NYQMxKJUkkOmjUa5qcQ.text: Ate here for a weekday lunch and it was surprisingly busy.  Service and quality of food were both excellent.  A couple unique takes on KBBQ here that sets Hobak apart from other KBBQs were sushi rice/wasabi provided with orders of beef brisket (works surprisingly well), cheese fondue with pork belly, and that rice cracker ice cream sandwich in the end.  Add solid ban chans and this place really stands out above all the other KBBQs I've had including those from Los Angeles (looking at you Kang Ho Dong).    Pros: - sushi rice/wasabi and beef brisket - cheese fondue with pork belly - marinated skirt steak - rice cracker ice cream sandwich - easy parking  Cons: - no wait at lunch - is pricey without a coupon.  Same level as Kang Ho Dong.  Note:   - Came with a $20 off coupon from Christmas special. - Ordered the small combo that says serves 1-2 (easily serves 2-3)

SBBw74PW2Wfo9f-v9jzYEA.text: I'm 100% Korean born.. came to US when I was 13. Hobak might be one of the best KBBQs I have ever had in the US... they are absolutely incredible. There were few other KBBQ spots that opened around the same time as Hobak did, but Hobak is not like any other KBBQ spots in town. So they are killing it in KBBQ game in Vegas right now. It's their CHARCOAL FIRE GRILL that sets them aside from any other Korean BBQ places in town.  Their fire will cook your meat just like the  (CHARCOAL FIRE) from Korea. Nice sear on the outside and perfect inside. I have been to too many other KBBQ places where the meat gets cooked to death and I am usually annoyed by that. I love Med-rare meat. Too many KBBQ spots (especially if you let the guests cook their own) seems to torch the F out of the meat.  The servers at Hobak will always make sure your meat is cooked properly. Even the brisket (cha-dol ) is cooked perfectly soft!! & they charge out the grill every time they cook a diff kind of meat.  Oh! And they have some amazing CHEESE CORN (pics) The marinade on their Kalbi is noticeably tastier than other places, and their ribeye is to die for. I can honestly say this place is amazing me of the most LEGIT places in town. Go ask for our fav server Na Na!! Paul & Mindi Ryu

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FIRE!! Our Rib-Eye getting pampered on our CHARCOAL FIRE grill right on our table!!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only place you can get these puff rice ice cream sandwiches in town!!! Green tea and Plum are our favs!!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CHEESE PORN!!! CHEESE CORN ACTION!

LezHcSExKArPQkBPUYJMjQ.text: Meats are good but service is atrocious....I come here often...the way they ask when my nephew asked for 2 cups of rice is..."THAT'S EXTRA $1 each you guys already had 5 "Like Excuse me....we only asked and got 4 earlier...and how dare the person asked such a thing as if we couldn't affor $1 rice.....OMG

dusIvjTls3GW4B_D-ob3MA.text: Gives Kang Ho Dong Baekjeong (Los Angeles) a run for their money.  Pros:    Excellent meats    Great side dishes    Superb salad    Good service (They cook for you)    Reasonable prices    Soju, sake, wine and beer    Plenty of parking    Smoke managed well    Nicely spaced tables (Ample elbow room) Cons:    None

a_caDMAeOCXHyLgqkO52kQ.text: We love it here.   No corkage fee! BYOB.   We stopped at lee's to get a nice bottle of Pinot noir before we arrived.   This time we went later in the evening.   It has a super rad night club atmosphere going on.  Skirt steak is amaaaaaazing.   Hobak rules!  Yum.   Thanks for the free icecream sandwich!!!!

IBSmrRV2ag4OM4qsjg_ixA.text: Best Korean BBQ I have tried ever! Staff is very friendly and the place is super cute! Went for a friend's birthday and they sang to her with a huge candle. Food was delicious and the prices are very reasonable. Would definitely recommend that you try it if you are in Vegas and want a break from the buffets!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_aA6GQu0HJ0Pqv7G_yhunw.text: Great find outside of the strip! Sooooo much good food in the two person combo - can't possibly finish it by two ppl. I like that the waiter/waitress does the grilling for customers - we can just focus on eating! Omg so much good food! And very reasonable price.

JBpFIPuqaoxyYWTZ-8lC3w.text: From the service to the atmosphere to the food... everything was perfection. This is by far our favorite Korean BBQ spot. No where comes close. The combo for 2 was practically a feast, so make sure to come very hungry! Nana even packed up our leftovers, provided detailed instructions on how to reheat, and did so with a warm smile on her face. Hobak has earned a True 5 stars. Hands down.

asv5InjJyGvoRIiR--m1Xw.text: My Favorite Korean BBQ Restaurant in town. Food are excellent and good quality of meat.Highly Recommend.

0SlmVuhS2jmSZlYX1t-cSg.text: Had my Mom's B-Day there, we had a blast. For parties 4 or more, prepare to wait a bit. Meats are perfectly prepped and marinated to perfection. I enjoyed the pork combo but beef seem to be the tastier. Extremely inexpensive for the quality and service.  Wait for the ... insane!

73uQkdkBvM8ntv5wbYkqLg.text: It's always a good sign when you see many of the customers are Koreans with their families. It's an even better sign when your Korean classmate just randomly happens to be at the same restaurant on a random Wednesday night with his gf and gf's dad.   I had the small family combo (comes with brisket, samgyupsal, (chose) pork jowl, and some flank thing. The best meats were the first three with the flank or skirt being not to my textural liking.   They do an excellent job of cooking the meats for you. But even still you end up a smoky mess. The side dishes are well made and tasty. If it wasn't so far away I'd go more often.

jjFDRAwZXbmqx-aabbs1kA.text: NANA IS SOOOOOOOOOOOOOO AWESOME. Service is bomb.com and I frikin love the meat. Dude. Just go here. Especially if you're hungry. Love the vibe, as well. Fave was the spicy boneless short ribs for sure. Those were FRIKIN LIT (literally). GO HERE.

AwvtJLMMKbDzB6t34ish6A.text: I've lived in Las Vegas for the last twelve years, and as a Southern Cal transplant, it was nearly impossible to find a good Korean BBQ. I'm not talking run-of-the-mill all you can eat Korean grub that any non-Korean will go ahead and eat but rather the top shelf Korean BBQ that keeps you eating even though you really shouldn't eat any more.   Hobak is that place in Vegas.  and   is on point!

AcvUv3g9znLBMQxYRT83DQ.text: We ordered the small family combo for 3 people we were all stuffed! The quality of the meat were good and the marinate were fantastic.   Took a star off for the uncomfortable metal chairs. But the food were so good that we will definitely come again.

jYWs-8z5E7ilZS_W_FeSLw.text: This is the best Korean BBQ place in town. They have quality meat. Great service. We had a good and fun experience with our waiter, Exo. He was very attentive, entertaining, and great food recommendations.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ygrGtQyatoMPapibaudFLw.text: If you want Korean bbq with the highest quality meat and the most tender you have to try this place. The atmosphere is very nice and the staff is always very friendly.

BVS4gqI48b20gNv4sSF8Bg.text: Came in around 2:30 and was seated right away. I loved that the table was ready with side dishes and the grill was heating up.  The service and the food was great! The aged spare rib is a must.  Oh yeah if you come before 3pm they give you the lunch discount of 10% off the entire bill.

l0eRj8F6BEq_VZc4zcpctw.text: After eating here a few more times, the service has gotten a lot better and quality of meats has been consistent. I had since eaten the meat combo and after eating at other Korean restaurants their beef quality is much better. I would still recommend this place, now since we are becoming more of regulars I wished they would have a local punch card for dining in here and referring friends and family.   Nonetheless, still one of the best Korean restaurants to dine out here.

aICf-zy2ATX_6Ef9D423fg.text: This was my favorite restaurant. Amazing food and great service. But today they're very busy and service was beyond terrible. The waitress left in the middle of our meal, never to be seen again. We had to fetch multiple others to get some service: more water, bill, to go boxes, dessert. And the expensive meat our waitress was in the process of cooking - burnt.   Then the hostess proposed to charge an 18% gratuity because we're a table of 6. Proceeded to say then that since one of us was a baby, they would waive this rule. When I didn't leave a tip - she asked if I wanted to tip the server, I responded that we didn't get any service, so no. She then reminded me that she didn't charge us 18% gratuity! All of this is after my parents - whom I was treating - walked out.  So I had this conversation while I'm waiting at the register as the hostess ran out of printing paper and didn't know how to replace it with the new roll for a while.   What a disaster.

ma85tz_sseQSM9lyR0I4AA.text: We live in New York and we come to Vegas every year. We love Korean BBQ we come here on every trip. The food here is great. It is less expensive than New York too. The service is efficient and the servers are courteous.

aEXIVdYhSy7U9bAJYqgiqQ.text: They do not take the reservation. Try to make a reservation for the special occasion (5 people and some are coming into the town, just try Korean BBQ). Receptionist explained to me that company policy doesn't accept the reservations. I asked 6:00 pm sitting, she told me to come 5:00. No guarantee we will get a table or not, if we are lucky, we have to wait at least 30 minutes. I do not like the company policy and how they conducting their business. Our times are valuable as theirs, so I made a reservation at Magal BBQ. I feel relieved when I hear the pleasant and polite voice of Magal BBQ. I can't wait to try Magal BBQ!!!

zJlh0c-sXvj-17RRueOLZg.text: Best Korean Barbecue place  off the strip! I highly recommend coming hungry and getting the beef combo. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Korean Barbecue in Las Vegas! This place was so good I couldn&#39;t even get a picture of our food, it was gone so fast!

sHcg_H2Z4Ovykx6I9D1agQ.text: Quality - Fantastic. Their skirt steak in the family combo was so tender. Their short ribs are second to none.  Decor - They try to make it look like you're on the streets of 1950's Korea. It's beautiful at night with all the lights hanging above.  Service - The best part is that they cook it for you. All you have to do is grab the finished meats. They tell you when it's done so there's no guess work. Other places come by every so often and help you, but this one is full service.  Combo - We got their Large family combo for four of us. It's a good selection. The skirt steak was sooooo tender. The short ribs were marinated perfectly and top notch. The grilled spicy pork belly is definitely something I haven't tried at other places. They have a house sauce to dip and also a dry salt/pepper combo that complemented the meats perfectly.  Pro tip, there's a 10% discount on lunch. However, no pretty lights due to the sunlight coming in from the windows.

JyaQtTzq2aAzuIaAs5FLkA.text: My first time here, nana was my server and she was fantastic! She cooked all of our food for us and she didn't check up on us too often, but still checked up enough to not keep us waiting too long. The service was excellent.  The inside looks very Japanese but Korean like mixture of both. It looks like they're trying to put both cultures together. I like to order the first combo it has the best meats. But Like if you order brisket in the combo they give you rice and wasabi and roll it like its sushi.  I love the side dishes they give you, they give you quite a variety. The vegetables are plentiful too. The quality of the meats I HAVE TO say is probably the best SO far but maybe I'm biased haha. The way they serve it too looks very aesthetic.  Now if we wanna talk aesthetic I LOVE the bathroom they have tooth brushes in there if you wanna brush your teeth too! Lol  Definitely have cleanliness down as well it's pretty well maintained.  I also love the steamed egg they give you OMG they make it so good and same with the bean paste soul. Oh and to add they offer this really good dessert after and it comes with the combo and it's pretty good, well worth my money.  I have to give them a 5 stars for over exceeding my standards.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream sandwich desserts
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi ribs with our server Julie
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dreamed eggs

lN2ynmd7_asY3ksmJPFypw.text: I was in Vegas for 3 days... and ate at Hobak twice!! It was soooo yummy. Service was very good as well. First time I came we had one beef combo & one pork combo. The beef was okay, the only one I enjoyed was the Aged beef short rib, the others were meh. But the pork is where it's at for the BBQ!! Such delicious meats. Don't forget to ask for sesame oil & ssamjang dip for your pork! For some reason the server didn't serve us the spicy pork belly which comes with our combo.. but it's okay we were stuffed by then anyways. We also got the corn cheese... sooooooo buttery and cheesy. And the dessert was SO good. Simple rice cracker with red bean and ice cream. Second time we came back we just had the pork combo, my favourite!! Wish they had this kind of BBQ back home :(
