ZwHHsCtV2urAJ9Mqll-koQ.text: Combo #3 is still the way to go.  It is so much cheaper ordering a combo than the meat individually.  My favorite is the Hobak aged short ribs then the spicy b.l. short ribs.  The grilled spicy pork was ok, next time I'll probably try the aged pork ribs instead.  The spicy angus fried rice was still as good as I last remembered it

a0obXaOzs6syU45hb51MUg.text: If you don't want to share with some friends it's very expensive and you cannot have different choose. You don't have any seafood or fish. I was thinking it will be a place like the others where you have the grill in the middle and you can make what you want at the time you want but not really, we took the one we can share with differents meat but the waitress was the one who was making our food she was cutting us in the middle of the conversation everytime she was coming for to turn the meat, we couldn't breath between each plates. We didn't even finished 1 meat that she was cooking another one. I was very disappointed by this restaurant when you compare with the other bbq

hs05vyxXG9Buv7pNEyRLjQ.text: I won't say this place is average, but I want say it's the sh*t either. It's a fun environment. Emphasis on fun. Would I return? possibly. Alot of k pop blaring out the speakers if you like that. The meat is just standard. But mark my words, if you want to enjoy a great time with friends. Then I'll say Hobak. But you go to Goong Korean bbq for quality.

3nwTx0Qv95umZGYMbWpNBA.text: We were invited by a friend to join him at Hobak for dinner.  Another trip up Spring Mountain to experiment with more Asian cuisine.  We arrived at about 7pm and were seated within a few minutes.  If we had arrived 30 minutes later, we would have waited an hour.    The restaurant is open floor seating with the kitchen on the back wall.  You have a good visual of the chefs butchering fresh meat selections of Angus beef and Premium pork to be displayed in the glass case.   Tables are round with a BBQ grill right in the middle of the table.  Most Korean BBQ places I've visited in the past, you cook your own meat.  Not at Hobak!  The waiter cooks all of your meat choices to perfection.  Whatever your choice, they make sure it's cooked to your liking.  The meats come with a large variety of side accompaniments.  Salad, soup, sauces, egg souffle, pickled veggies, to name a few.  Everything is served family style to share.  We indulged in a few bottles of citrus Soju.  Served in a shot glass and compliments the meal flavors perfectly.    Waiters are personable and very attentive. Excellent service.  They all wore name tags that looked like mini-neon glowing signs.  Items on the table was kept fresh and full.  Side dishes were always kept an eye on and replenished as necessary.    The rice cake ice cream dessert was light palate cleanser and perfect end to our meal.     We enjoyed our "interactive" dining experience at Hobak.  It was busy during our visit, by not rushed.  Good quality meats and friendly atmosphere.  A huge step above the traditional grill-your-own Korean BBQ!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our alma mater mascot gnome enjoying Hobak!

KhhlZXsF4zUgrSSLcY2ivw.text: The BBQ was amazing! This was my first time trying Korean bbq and I will go back. The ambience was cool...sort of like a hip bar. We also had so ju for the first time. I recommend the peach flavor.

WFYgoexSfLFrqpInC84NLg.text: This is not AYCE. You can order a la carte or do one of their family combos. We ordered a family combo set with pork and beef dishes. They also serve the combos with soup, salad, and a tray of sushi rice. Surprisingly, I really enjoyed the sushi rice and ended up eating most of it. You can order more sushi rice or white rice on the side. The soup was really good too, especially since it was freezing outside. They serve alcohol also. We ordered $5 Jameson shots.   My favorite meat was the brisket. Nice and thin. Good quality meat. All the other meats were just okay to me. Nothing else really stood out. The pork jowl needs to be cooked until crispy. At least that's how I like it. The short rib was marinated and is good to eat with rice. Overall, it's an okay place to hit up for kbbq. I don't think I'd wait for it though.

yLqvae1EG4Wd1WYk3XVuZg.text: This is an excellent Korean BBQ restaurant. We eat here every time we visit Las Vegas. We always get a family style meal and it's SO much food. Extremely delicious and meaty. Save room for cocktails and dessert!!

GPtfkFZ6FGcXSuHRAbnFCQ.text: Beef Combo  Always so nice when Korean BBQ places help you cook. Angus Brisket, Angus Short Ribs & Skirt Steak . Be sure to go early to avoid the long waits.

W8LVnlg1Cfg1A955CiZkWQ.text: EXO is an amazing waiter! He's so funny and cooked our food well. I would definitely come back again. Awesome experience and delicious food! Two thumbs up :)

Xh98cuYd4krLmynl2ZSPAQ.text: This is by far the best Korean bbq restaurant I've ever had in Las Vegas.  Try their short ribs!!!! They are so tender!!!!!  Advise: Their beef is SO MUCH better than their pork items. Spend your money on beef instead of pork!  All of their side dishes are pretty outstanding, especially the radish!  Our server Jayden and Sim were extremely friendly and attentive! We enjoyed our dinner so much! :)

RjF3TDD6hcMxD9cX1lYHnw.text: Literally the best Korean bbq I've ever had. Excellent quality meat no doubt as a result of the in house butcher. Excellent service. Like really excellent. Perfectly cooked meats because staff does it for you so there's not that one homie that cooks for everyone. Ask for Annabelle. She'll take good care of you.

Av4C5f_CgZQ4rBz3rsm-Pg.text: Great midnight snack for people looking for a place around 2:00-3:00 a.m. (but don't get me wrong, I would definitely go during the day). The server explained the menu to me, before I was seated to my table, which actually helped tons when ordering. Drinks were taken, and after food was ordered it didn't take so long to come out (ordered the beef combo). The first meat set was brisket, and I love brisket, however the cook cooked the brisket when the oven top (which is heated by charcoal = amazeballs taste) wasn't so hot, so the brisket ended up being a little dry. My group and I ended up cooking the rest of the meat which was perfect for a group of three, when the server had said it was perfect for two (however I think it just depends on how much a person can eat). Definitely recommend if looking for a new KBBQ place to eat, especially since their grills are charcoal, you get a different meat taste.

1X099_h6A4uF_i_xpLTo1Q.text: Amazing. So glad my buddy recommended this place. Food is great and prices are really reasonable. The staff is excellent especially JOHN!  I would give this place 6 stars if I could.

2mzMV2mT9lBrn8ygNPd_Bg.text: Haven't been here in a while, though I have brought three other parties in the past because I enjoyed it so much, and wow has it changed.   The price point has gotten higher. Higher than most AYCE KBBQ places in town which now have just as good, if not better, food and meat. Except this place isn't AYCE and the atmosphere isn't even that great.   What really knocked this to one star was the appalling service. Everything felt rushed. They were checking on us every 3 minutes. They were cooking the next series of meat before we were finished with the first, or even second. They were bringing dessert (which is ice cream) while we were in the middle of the meal. By the time I got to eat it, the ice cream was melted. And then the check out process happened before I even got to the dessert with the pen to sign the receipt.   It was not that busy. I was there with one other person and we are the least picky people. We eat at an average, enjoyable pace. I have no idea why it was so rushed but with this and the prices, I will never come here again and I will not recommended this KBBQ to anyone.

pAUzX5QNdW9XIzD4UM5jpg.text: Top notch - some of the best Korean BBQ I've had in the US. The condiments/sides are generous and out of this world. My husband always has to have japchae and I had the fried rice and between all the dishes on our table that would have been enough, but we also split an entree from the grill (steak), which was delightful, especially with the salt & pepper and the sauce they offer. Don't skip the bok choy - perfection! And please if you don't do anything else, save room for the ice cream. I've never had anything like it and it was amazing (green tea ice cream served in a lightly sweet & crunchy puffed rice sandwich pocket thing?) Idk - just get one. Enjoy!

grmdJGAkrazy3jJqHa1Gmw.text: I love this place. They don't do all you can eat, but they have fantastic set menus for however or whomever is in your party. Reasonable prices and amazing quality of food for what you get. Just come, enjoy the food, the laid back ambiance is perfect. It's a busy place so be prepared to wait for a table and service can be slow, but all in all a solid Korean BBQ place for quality of meats alone.

sYDgtrbysCtlzsUH6_yXmg.text: Hobak is really good Korean BBQ. They cook all your food for you so you pay for your meat and it is more on the expensive side but totally worth it.  I've had excellent servers who have explained everything of the dining experience and others who just come by and cook. The bonchon is some of my favorites, I love the salad dressing and kimchi. Also, the desert ice cream sandwich they give you with your meal is incredible.  If you've never had Korean BBQ and don't want to cook or do all you can eat, I definitely recommend Hobak.

SLtGHVoDYySEksVf9KX-Uw.text: One of the best Korean BBQ places in Vegas! I am not a fan of all you can eat as I feel the quality I Is never good. I would rather order what I want and get better quality meats. This place has dry aged beef and it shows. I don't usually order the combo as I prefer I marinated meats. When the meat quality is good, I marinated really allows the meat taste and quality to shine through. The angus bl short ribs are my absolute favorite. It's the fattest cut of short rib that isn't not marinated. When cooked perfectly it is so juicy and flavorful you don't need any sauce or side dishes to elevate it. It's like the most perfect piece of beef for your taste buds. Our second favorite is the brisket. This is classic thin fatty meat which is perfect for a start esp since there is always a wait. If you are doing pork, we love the jowl. It's chewy amazing pork goodness. The neck and belly are always equally as good but we prefer the jowl for the texture. If you do the pork belly make sure to tell the server that you want it crispy. Its literally like crispy bacon bits then. Two pro tips: if you order the brisket it comes with a complimentary sushi rice platter. Do yourself a favor and try it with a bit of wasabi and two to three slices of brisket. It's amazing! The second is if you order any dishes you get a complimentary steamed egg. I love love this dish and how they don't overpower it with a ton of anchovies like some places do. Instead it is clean pure egg with some scallions steamed in. Yum! And if you happen to order a combo you get complimentary dessert which is their ice cream in between two rice crackers. We love the mint chocolate chip because of the crunch from the rice cracker and chocolate chunks. The best part of this place is the attention to detail and service. The wait staff come around to help you cook the meats perfectly and in the bathroom there is complimentary toothbrush and mouthwash. They even give you 10% if you take an Uber or Lyft to eat. Service, meat quality and taste are all amazing. Every trip to Vegas always starts with a trip here.

aSv5P0movPhS_7RVWbtc9w.text: After hearing and reading so many good things about Hobak I was finally able to come get this place out. Came here on a Saturday evening for a date night with the hubs. Got there around 7 and the wait was quoted 30-45 min. We probably only waited maybe 20. There is hardly any waiting room inside (l shaped bench that maybe sits 6) and zero standing. But there is plenty of outside seating with two stand heaters and canopies. They even have popcorn for you to pour a cup and snack on while you wait.   We were seating along the wall on a square table and was quickly greeted by one our our many servers. They brought out the banchan (5 or 6) kimchi, creamy dressing salad, spicy bean sprout salad, spicy daikon & some kind of green that I didn't like. The steamed egg & bean paste soup came out next.   We ordered the beef combo for 2 with the ribeye & skirt steak. We also ordered the fried rice (amazing) and the japchae (good but won't order again unless more people in our party).   Even though it is table top cooking the servers do everything except put the food in your mouth. Lol!   The brisket was first and was delicious. This is my favorite to get at any Korean bbq and you could tell the quality was top notch.   The ribeye was huge for two people. It was cooked to a perfect med-rare and was so tender and flavorful.   Finally the skirt steak. It was marinated but not over whelming. It was a little on the sweet side and I didn't care for it that much but the hubs loved it. He said that was his favorite out of the three.   All the combos come with dessert. A rice cake ice cream sandwich with a thin layer of sweet red bean. We chose strawberry and it was the perfect ending to such a great meal.   I will definitely be back again.

1aDvFpE8UdVrlSzm0-uVtQ.text: I wish I can give it a 5 stars!   I was looking forward to come back to Hobak since I have such a An amazing experience last time when I visited Vegas.   Came in here on a Saturday night the wait for a party of 3 was around 30 minutes wait.   We ordered the large part family combo.  The reason why I gave it a 3 stars is because the lady who were serving us are not attentive enough. Also she rush through cooking our meat. I noticed the pork was very burnt. So I told her I do not want to eat overly burnt food. She said it is normal how they cook the pork like this. I agree that yes the porn have to be 100% cooked but it was soooo burnt that is all dark over the meat. Just backing up with words so that she doesn't have to give us new meat.   Whenever she came to cook the meat it was in such a hurry.... the attitude doesn't seems so friendly as well.   I do enjoy the food I think it is very fresh and the environment is very relaxing.   However this time the server attitude was bad and in a hurry that truly effect the quality of the meat.   I hope management can do something about it so that the next time I am willing to give it another try  One last comment is , is a huge disappointment that they do not have salad that night. This is a huge Downside

FpNZt8NeEVQ-ycTWH1B7zQ.text: My family and I love Hobak - we knew we were going to be in love as soon as we pulled up in the parking lot. I gets busy as night so either come a little early or be ready to walk a little because parking is tight.   A small combo of any mix is enough food for 3 people. I'm a big fan of pork jowl, samgyeopsal, and kalbi. They also have CORN CHEESE - which is always so key to Korean bbq besides banchan, which is always very good here.   I love the atmosphere. It's got a taste of Korea but more contemporary and kind of reminds me of Kang Ho Dong minus the egg and corn cheese rim!   Combos include a choice of soup between jigaes and a fluffy pot of egg! So good! The sauces are great (add wasabi to the soy based one) and the service to top it off is wonderful!  I love coming here when I can get beat the rush! It's about $20-30 a person for a small combo and a couple of Cass! Can't wait to come back!

EyDtdmtFwQIZQU-V46eQdg.text: I went here last month and I wasn't too impressed. The portions of meat was small. Although the meat was of good quality. They do cook the food for you but the guy usually has a few tables and he gets so busy and takes a while to get back to your table and they don't really like it when you start cooking your own food or mix the meats together. So you can end up waiting a while for the guy to come back to your table to cook your food sometimes. Also they don't have a lot of the small side dishes like the other AYCE Korean bbq places. They also don't have much seafood there also.  The service wasn't that good. We waited a while for the waiter to come to our table if we needed anything. We did like that it did come with the steam egg and the soup. But we probably won't go there again.

8-2U-_McpkDPs62KpNhu5g.text: Price and portion size are pretty important to me so non ayce kbbq didn't appeal to me for the longest time, but I eventually came here with a group, and I was impressed. I've been back two more times since the first, and my appreciation for this place grew each time (a visit to 8oz made me appreciate this place even more, but everybody else seems to feel different).   You pay more than you would at all ayce place, but the quality, the flavor, the sides, and the portion size all make it worth it. I have a relatively big appetite, and I've always been satisfied well before dessert arrived at the end of the family combos.    So, yeah, I recommend you go for the family combo. My favorite is combo 3. I like the option for skirt steak because that's not something I usually see offered at the kbbq places I go to. And the spicy Angus short ribs are super tasty. The sweet and spicy is so well balanced - not too sweet with plenty of kick. I've had both the pork ribs and the spicy pork belly. It's hard to choose, but I do love a the occasional crunch of brisket bone you get with the pork rib that you don't often get as frequently with pork belly.   Make sure not to neglect your veggies. They're tasty, but it's easy to forget to give them adequate grill attention when you've got soup, meat, rice (don't forget to ask for some), and banchan to consume as well. Also everybody loves the rice pop ice cream sandwiches. I enjoy them. They're good. I'd throw them a 4/5, but whenever I come with someone their in-the-moment review of them typically feels like a 5/5.    Their service has been good every time I've been there. My only complaint in that department is Halloween. I would prefer they not wear makeup that mimics disfigurement. It didn't stop me from enjoying my meal, but I found it off-putting.   Also, I'm not much of a drinker but their Moscow mule with soju was pretty tasty. I don't know if it's worth the price cuz I'm not much of a drinker, but it was one of the better mules I've had.

K2SZIZIfaVt5XlrFdkvl4A.text: Atmosphere is fun and lively - not the best korean bbq bang for your buck - pretty $$$ but at least food is good and staff sting.  We ordered beers and there was a language barrier and a table top keg like thing arrived - way more beer than we wanted and way more costly than we were led to believe - had a good time and will be more careful next time.

4TEk6ItdVUVU3ryV0HPjjg.text: Introduction: WOW!  Wow! Wow! And WOW! I can officially say that I now had the BEST Korean BBQ of my lifetime.   I was recommended to this place by numerous customers informing me that Hobak is one of the BEST Korean BBQ restaurant they've ever come to.  I decided to give it a try and the rest was history.  Quality: 5/5 110% OUTSTANDING! We got the beef combos and everything was top quality, including the flavors.  I was informed by our waitress that the beef ribs are actually marinated for two days prior to serving. Which makes it super tender and tasty.  Customer Service: 5/5 AMAZING! From the moment we walked in, to the minute we walked out.  The waiters and waitresses come over to your table and help you cook your meats.  Which I love, in addition, you never have to wait to flag someone down for condiments.  Price: 5/5 It is not a buffet, so once again, it depends on how much you can eat. Personally, we got the beef "combo for two" portion and we had leftovers. Which we were allowed to pack it to go.  Most importantly, you don't get nickel and dime to death. For example, unlike my previous non buffet Korean BBQ experience, steam rice are FREE here. In addition, lots of amazing free side dishes. Such as, soups, salad, pancakes (not the kind of pancakes you're thinking of, but super yummy) free desserts etc.  Like I said, in my opinion, super generous for a non buffet place. Love it!  Cleanliness: 5/5 The place was immaculate! Yes, including the restroom, the seating area and the grills as well.    I noticed that there's complimentary toothbrushes (disposable ones), mouthwash and toothpaste in the restroom. So if you are that individual like me, who needs to brush his teeth after every meal, you are in great hands.  Tips: Hobak does not hold back in every way you can imagine.  The atmosphere was awesome, not over crowded, especially during lunch time, which I am surprised with a place this great.  Maybe I was just lucky.    One thing I love more than anything is that they have a vent on each table. Know what that means? You don't have to go home to take a shower after your meal so that you don't stink like a walking BBQ Grill. We will definitely be back.

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vent that helps you prevent being stinky after you&#39;re done with your meal.

fkOiAE5Pvv55D4R23Te06A.text: The price has gone up a lot much in a short period of time. Each combo is now $5-6 more. This place is always busy so wait time from 20-40 mins should be expected. Servers are nice and attentive. I ordered a beef combo. Freshness 4/5, value 4/5, side dishes 3.5/5. I had high hope for this place but it turned out not as good as I expected. Overall, I had OK experience here but probably i'd like to go try new places instead of coming back.

7gE0J1VgFFN7EnugeLwthA.text: One of the best Korean bbq in Vegas. Lots of meat choices. Gotta try the meat combo, I think it's the best bang for the buck. Great service and atmosphere. The dessert ice cream sandwich is the bomb. Only when you can't think it will get any better. Highly recommended and be prepared to have a long line.

rQKXQJrDFqFKugjTctrIzA.text: it saddens me when a restaurant at the top of their fame, starts to go downhill and quality suffers.  this is what happened when i went back there last month with a party of four.  Despite the romaine scare, they did nothing to offer an alternative nor make up for lack of with another substitute.  i noticed meat portions were also smaller for large combo price purchased and lacking in banchan offering only 3/4 fishers compared to 5/6 when last i was there. Meats were not marinated and lacked flavoring... I used to recommend my friends to frequent this place however i'd rather spend my money with so many good options available right down the street.

sdZOBuIKlYr_Ksj2mXBlIg.text: Had the 2 person combo between 3 people and it was very filling. Many sides and 4 different meats. My first time at a Korean BBQ place so I didnt know what to expect. Luckily, they cook the food in front of you so I didnt have to worry about messing up my own dinner lol Very popular and a long wait; took us 45+ minutes to get in. They had this rice cake ice cream (we got cookies and cream) and it was amazing! Cant wait to come back and try other things here. Thank you for making this a great experience

blLVor2yc3Pp8vDsFimG7w.text: Great quality meat !! Not all you can eat but they have family meals based on 2 or 4 group size. It includes rice/ sides and dessert

qKzGxPtD9mLih7hkwtUWpA.text: Very good k bbq. Server was nice and cooked our meat. Had a great dinner. We will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kY5E3o4r4aK9hCc8a9RteA.text: Hobak is amazing their cuts of meat are so tender and juicy and at a great price. I never leave hungry here. The only thing I wish they had was better and more side dishes. Otherwise I highly recommend it.

FF2PP60QnWteIjBYpIdlbA.text: Merry Christmas!! Came here on Christmas Day right at opening and already there was a big line but managed to get seated within the first wave. This is not like those kbbq restaurants where it's all you can eat and you do it yourself. Expect the waiters and waitresses to constantly be checking up on your food and flipping meat over for you. If you don't like doing anything this is perfect for you. If you like handling your own meat like I do, might take some getting used to haha.   Ordered the family combo one and it came with brisket, super thick pork belly pieces, marinated short rib fingers and some other rib pieces I think? They were all super yummy especially the marinated short rib fingers because it came with some melted cheese mmmm. Pork belly probably was least favorite of the meal just cause they were super thick and got kinda repetitive with the taste but still yummy! Also ordered the buckwheat noodle to have a refreshing taste with the salty meats as well as some tofu soup just cause it was nice and chilly outside.   Compare this to Kang Ho Dong restaurant (if you know what that is) and it's pretty much the same except I like the meat portions and taste here better for the price :) to top it off they give some ice cream sandwiches at the end! Great way to spend Christmas.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7MAONGVE2s4DdBw8ssx_1g.text: This place was very delicious! Wow I loved everything that came with the order. Me and my friend shared a beef combo that came with 3 meats. It was so yummy! They cooked it for us for the most part. They continuously came to the table to put our meats on the grill. They also continuously filled our side dishes which included kim Chee, pancake, and many other things I can't name. Seriously a complete meal with soup, rice, side veggies, meat and dessert! It was so delicious! My friend recommended this place and we will sure be back! And the combo without all the wine we drank was about $65.00 which is about the price of 2 ayce Korean bbq except for this place has very good quality meats and sides! We went at 5:30pm and it wasnt that busy. By the time we left around 7 ish, it was packed! Every table was taken! Very cool and hip atmosphere with loud music that goes off Every time someone's birthday or anniversary is announced! Love it here! Yummmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket all cooked and set aside!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bCXpmjGflYOd688loCfrQA.text: Currently my favorite KBBQ stop in Las Vegas. While a bunch of them have been popping up in the Las Vegas valley, none can top this place! I've been here multiple times and my experience is always great and consistent.  If you are looking for a cheap, AYCE KBBQ place with average quality meat then look elsewhere. I have yet to find a KBBQ place with the same premium quality meat and price point that Hobak carries.   As you enter in, you are greeted by a host or hostess and depending on the wait, they will seat you right away once your table is ready or give you a pager so that you can wait. Depending on the day and time you go, there can be a wait! I've waited as short as 5 minutes and as long as 45 minutes to an hour. Let me tell you, it is worth the wait! They offer some seating inside, and they've also added a nice roofed seating area outside as well. Right by the door, they usually have some kind of snack or slushy you can indulge on while you wait for your group to be seated. Last time I was here there was self serve pop corn and during warmer months there was self serve slushies.  When I'm dining with a second person, we like to order the Small Hobak Beef Combo. That can typically feed about 2-3 people (your hunger may vary) and as of right now that will cost you $57.99. Without going into a lot of detail, you are given the choice of Angus Brisket and either Angus Boneless Short Rib or Angus Rib Eye, then after you've chosen what you would like with your Brisket, you get to choose Marinated Skirt Steak or Aged short rib. Whichever ones you choose, the quality of the beef is always exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting for brisket to finish cooking. Juicy, top quality meat!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Combo

Y9nva6olUGv09_J288mXkw.text: Seems like this is a fairy new Korean BBQ place! We went on a Wednesday night and there was still a wait if about 20 minutes for 2.  As we got seated, all the side dishes along with a jug of water were set on the table. There was Salad with Sesame Dressing, Green Onion Salad, Pickled Daikon, Spicy Daikon with Jalapenos, Kimchi and Marinated Greens.   We ordered the Hobak family combo for 2 people; Set 1. We asked if rice came with the order and they said yes. Once the meat came out, so did the Bean Soup and Steamed Egg. The whole time we were there, a server was cooking for us. He started with our Angus Brisket. The meat was on the thin side but tasted great! The house made sauce was good too, and the salt on the side helped to change around the flavor. There was also constantly cheese on the grill which we found out towards the end that we can use as a dipping sauce too! Never seen anything like that but it surprisingly tastes pretty good. The pork ribs took a while to cook but it was good. The next were the Spicy Short Ribs which we were told was spicy but I honestly didn't know it would be THAT spicy. We couldn't finish so took it home. Non spicy people, watch out! Last was the Pork Belly, and I can say this Belly was 90% fat. I know there is a certain order for eating meat at Korean BBQ places as they cook for you, but getting Pork Belly last always gets to me since I'm feeling full but still trying to push fat down my throat.   The ball of rice is actually SUSHI RICE with WASABI and we were told towards the end that that was rice for us to eat. So weird.. I was totally expecting a bowl of rice, and not sushi rice..   Dessert was ice cream sandwich and you can choose the flavor. They give you a pretty big portion and it was nice for a change in flavor in your mouth.   The veggies were 2 slices of Potatoes, 2 Slices is Sweet Potatoes, 2 Mushrooms. It would have been nice if there was some lettuce and some garlic.

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Rib

dvZrYbmRwN1sW_-wkpZf_w.text: The food was great. Same with the service. We had three meats and all three were excellent. The side dishes were all hits. 100% would come again after climbing!!!

KzAZMmKzFKUgKh0aAd0bnw.text: Nana our server was the bestest. She said her name was easy to remember cause it was like the song :) the food was out fast and  delish !!!! I would def recommend this place, and will be coming back

dNiYv6zfrXKRoA_Hxyiyhw.text: The aroma from the outside was amazing! I could already sense the positive vibes of the business with how packed the parking was, and with the line almost beginning to form from the inside. It seemed really exciting and alluring.   The decor of this place is reminiscent of an LA Korean bbq establishment I frequent before. The place looked very trendy and the lighting was good.   We were actually seated rather quickly and was placed in a nice part of the restaurant. The service was ok but I was quite disappointed they did not have dishes I thought traditional places would carry. They had No Chicken or Seafood... Ouch!   The prices seemed on the higher side but the flavors were really good. The side dishes were not what I was hoping for while the soups did taste amazing.   Overall, I think this place is ok. Not sure if I would frequent it again as many of my friend do eat chicken and seafood. Foodies, please try it out and see for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice staff

5zT1ub1L0j3r8sQYCEcjuQ.text: No doubt about it, we love us some Hobak.   This is not an AYCE Korean BBQ restaurant, so the price of a meal at Hobak is higher than those kind of establishments, but the quality of the food is top-notch.  We usually get the Hobak Beef Combo choosing Angus short rib, rib eye, and marinated skirt steak.  The marinated skirt steak is definitely my favorite of the combo and I would be happy eating just that.  The meal comes with lots of banchan plus the rice pop ice cream dessert.  You get plenty of food for two people with the small combo order.  The staff runs around cooking the food for customers so you don't have to worry about anything except eating.  Because this place is so popular, we time our visits accordingly, arriving when they open or before the dinner rush:  getting here before 6pm is usually good unless you have a big party.   It's also a loud and boisterous place with music on blast, so just come here to enjoy the food and save the meaningful conversations for later.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi Bento
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea and vanilla ice cream rice pop dessert
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice to meat you

H6ejgKU0xVZsvIYCVWjpZQ.text: Amazing! Been here several times and the service and food is always spot on even when super busy. The quality is so good and so satisfying. Highly highly recommend.

zv_XB9lv1xB9LA81Hvyu0Q.text: Eating at Hobak has always been my favorite. The staff/servers are awesome, they're friendly and they do everything to make your dining an amazing experience. I recommend to try their family combo 2. The one with brisket, pork belly, pork jowl (we also like their spicy pork belly) by the way, did i just mention that the meat they serve tastes so fresh? We always get the small serving. But lemme tell you, we still have some left to take home. And still tastes so great!! Amazing isn't it!?

SDQIDmDA0djqur3J_85ySQ.text: We were searching all over for Korean bbq in Vegas but didn't get many recommendations so used Yelp to find this place hoping it wouldn't be a bust.  It wasn't!    For context, we've had Korean bbq a few times but usually with friends who have places they pick (Dallas, San Diego, etc).  The whole family really enjoyed this place.  We got the beef family combo plus the pork belly and a spicy rice side dish.  The meat was good quality.  I was hoping for a little more flavor, but it was still good regardless.  We finished the meal with chocolate and green tea ice cream sandwiches that were also really good.  I would definitely come back again, but hope to find another place to try too!

9a8ts5Zo3u3LCHtmeTQvCQ.text: We found this place bc we wanted to eat something different off the strip.  We waited over an hour for a table.  The food wasn't very good and the alcohol was really overpriced.  I didn't enjoy it here very much.  The service was slow and unresponsive.  This place is the most affordable bbq compared to others nearby but also when it's too affordable I feel the quality just isn't as good.  The flavor was a bit bland to me.  However they did have some very tasty appetizers and interesting name selections for them.  3 stars bc the service wasn't great and food was ok.

PKl9FFfRPEN2V7HjdG4Ppg.text: I've come back to Hobak BBQ each time after trying other Korean BBQ places around town in Las Vegas. Hobak has better meat, larger portions, better marinade and good service! This is my go to for Korean BBQ! Side dishes are unlimited. But rice is not unlimited. Come early, the line is usually long! But the slushes are free while you wait. And the ice cream at the end of dinner is sooo GOOD! This place is a must if you are in the Las Vegas area!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OqowSdfgeaa18OEx3ZCnJw.text: Came here after my swing shift, they are open until 2am! I had a bento box alone, I got a bunch of sides that come with the steaks and a complimentary dessert!  I loved the lively ambiance straight out of Korea, playing Kpop/ 80's Kpop it's so cute here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Melty but crispy sandwiched in Rice Pop!

04ovx4_5zetYpCj3VGwRaw.text: Hobak Korean BBQ is one of them"Saucy-est" place ever the staff is amazing and fun  thank you Nana, Pamela, Boddens, Brian and Zaddy aka Danny for making it a fun experience! Now let's get down to the food there was three of us and we got the Small family combo... #1 it was amazing it was more than enough food for the three of us and still under $70 and the little side dishes were a bonus!  So if you guys love great food and K-pop come here it's great.  Best,  K.Kaviar  And the other two I was with

Y3rlKBkdbBkHxlC3EIE8dw.text: A star for late night hours, a star for excellent service, a star for flavorful meat selection, a star for yummy unique dessert, & a star for the free perks.   Hobak can get fairly busy so prepare to wait. In comparison to Magal, Hobak charges for rice & has a less variety of food selection. My party had the beef combo for 4, pork combo for 2, green tea/Nutella dessert, mango/plum dessert, corn cheese, peach soju, Asahi draft, & cold unfiltered sake. No regrets for any of the orders. We didn't have to cook at all & I say it's worth the wait. Service is quick. Free slushy & water bottles while you wait & mouthwash & toothbrushes in the restrooms.   Cons- I personally think the corn cheese is overpriced. They should explain each side especially since we had first timers at Korean food .   Other than that, this is definitely a must try for locals AND tourists!

LkTPwdIIDaxQ8fGyuKDFzw.text: fire emoji. fire emoji. fire emoji. hands down the best korean bbq. denise was a great server.

4GzWT3WA94Az8tEWXjnzIw.text: I've heard so much good things about this place and I was really excited to try it today.  I came around 5 or 6 pm with my brother. Walking in, the interior looked pretty nice. I loved the decorations on the wall and it didn't seem like it was too crowded. As we were gonna sit down, there was probably about 4 tables eating in. We ordered the Spicy Angus Fried Rice and Hobak Beef Combo for 2 people that came with: brisket, Angus boneless short rib, and marinated skirt steak. Along with the combo, it came with bean paste soup, steamed egg, side dishes and the little balls of rice sushi things. First off, out of the 3 meats, I liked the brisket the most. However, I didn't think that the quality of the meats were that great. The bean paste soup tasted really good and the steamed egg was average. There wasn't a lot of sides dishes as well which was kind of a bummer since I usually love the sides when eating KBBQ. The little balls of rice sushi was pretty good too, but it kind of sucks since its limited. The spicy Angus fried rice was pretty good if you like spicy. Moving on to service; I understand that it was pretty slow for them BUT I don't think servers should just be standing around talking to each other like that. I noticed how the server would come to our table and then they would walk 2 or 3 steps back. They would be talking to some of the other servers while just staring at us eating and then come back 1 minute later to flip meat and then it would repeat. I'm not sure if that's how they usually do it, but to me it just seemed REALLY awkward having them just stare at me while I eat. The guy who was flipping our meats seemed okay as well. Didn't really seem that friendly or try and strike a conversation, but I guess I can't really blame him since it's not a part of his job I guess. He asked us if we were okay once or twice and told us when the meat was done, but that was all the communication we had between us. After finishing all the meats, a guy came over and said we had dessert that was included in the meal. He told us we had 5 different flavors to choose from and then told us the flavors. However, when he was saying the flavors, he started mumbling and we didn't understand any of it besides "vanilla." Then we asked if he can repeat himself and all he said was "We only have those 5 flavors." He looked a bit annoyed so I didn't bother asking the flavors again so we ended up just getting vanilla. Overall, I've experienced better quality of meats and better service from other places. I honestly think that this place is just okay. Nothing really special about it in my opinion. I'd definitely still prefer going Magal.

CzXGmE-PAPNA69XRNyAIXA.text: Tucked between a nondescript business park and KFC is a brash, vibrant, clean, and delicious KBBQ spot. I was apprehensive at first because it's not all you can eat, but it superseded my expectations in almost every way.   By the time you arrive at your table, there's a vast selection of banchan ready to be consumed. Every one of them is delicious and you will quickly ask for refills. My favorite is the kimchi and this picked bean sprout salad.  Picking a meal is hard but my personal favorite is the 4 course beef dinner. Through out your meal, meats will sashay your way and a server will cook in front of you. Perfect if you're lazy like me and you just wanna sit back and knock back a beer.   After noshing on savory and spicy meats, your taste buds takes a detour and your meal ends with a nice palette cleanser: an pop rice (sp?) ice cream sandwich. I left satisfied and I think my stretch marks grew three sizes that day.

s3g9BkH1-71D7EjMbF2uuw.text: This place was recommended by one of my co-workers since we were craving for some Korean bbq.  Heard that Andrew Zimmerman came here so you know what that means.  It's party of 4 for us and we got there around 1830 Wednesday night no problem with parking space and once we got there they have a complimentary slashed drinks by the front door while you wait for your table .  We didn't wait long to be seated.  We got the Hobak Family Combo L good for 3-4 people with the short ribs.  The dishes were amazing.  You do have to pay extra for Japchae and extra rice which is so worth eat.  And the best part of all they cook the meat for you :). Check out the pics that I posted so you guys can see what we had for dinner.  We suggest to come in early because they do gets busy.  Plus the ice cream in the end of the meal was to die for :)

LJhH1PYOTedANwVS8c71rg.text: Best kbb spot in Vegas. Highest quality cuts n great service. The wait time n higher prices are worth it. Only Ktown in LA compares

rFxjW8KAEXbvDnPzBPZtPw.text: Having been to many Korean BBQs in my lifetime, I would have to say that place is my absolute favorite. Everytime I come from out of town, this is a must and my number one recommendation for anybody visiting Vegas. From the moment you enter, you are greeted with an old school Korean ambiance accompanied. The servers are extremely friendly and despite arriving 4 min prior to last call, the servers accommodated and served all our needs. The food is amazing to say the least. Starting with the wide variety of side dishes, we ordered the family feast for two. I have to say that their "heritage" pork is the best I have ever tasted. The price and for this quality of food is worth every penny. Hands down the best kbbq restaurant in Vegas that will impress both locals and visitors.

GDkQ2E760i7oAM2VZEiCcw.text: Very authentic, tasty food! Great service too! We over-ordered though; the small family platter for 2 people is enough food for 3 or 4 people. It's worth a trip off the strip if you know and love Korean BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iJOHWj-k1E09m9edlPhbBQ.text: Hobak is delicious. The service is good too. I love Korean bbq and this place is in my top 2!

aV84U-t7xtE4rOiPLlr12Q.text: I was so nervous to try Korean BBQ. I've never had a dining experience quite like that, but my husband and I were feeling adventurous. The atmosphere was really chill and laid back, so we didn't feel awkward for very long.   We went for Valentine's dinner, so there was about a half-hour wait, which was to be expected. We were seated at a round table, in the middle of the restaurant, where they had laid out a whole spread of food to eat while we waited to order. We were offered complimentary plum wine for Valentine's Day by proving we were a couple, kissing on the lips. We ordered the first combo, and it did not disappoint!  We sat back and ate on everything while they cooked the meats right there at our table. The servers were very helpful in explaining what we should eat with each meat. The combo said it was for two people, but it was A LOT. Definitely make sure you go hungry, because you certainly won't leave that way. At the end, they even included the best green tea ice cream sandwich, complimentary.   I am definitely looking forward to going back for more! It seems like a great place to take visiting friends.

J5zt2WAiggG_tHcoMW8xoQ.text: The food here is sooooooo good. Everything they offer is great and tasty. My trips from CA are my complete without coming here.   The ONLY reason why I did not give this place 5 stars is because the service NEEDS to be improved. It takes SO long to get anything other than your main course.   I'd still recommend it to everyone because the food itself is amazing

cZ-3A-0AFkLr3JthQieSCQ.text: This was a great find.  My husband and I loved the food, but I think we ordered wat too much!

VLCs5Rg-Pr1UwXj0RltIsQ.text: Whoa!!!!  What a great time and they cook for you.  Evrything was exceptional and the restaurant is pack.  No wonder.....

ViT0Yb9rhJNI5mypavih9w.text: Best Korean BBQ I've had!  The food is delicious quality, staff is friendly, they cook the food for you which I thought was nice as many of the Korean BBQ I've visited leave you to do your own cooking, it's fine cooking ourselves sometimes too.

mPUNzFJX_CGt6bs78LR6bg.text: I was honestly expecting to really like this place more just based on the reviews on yelp. To be honest, I liked Magal way better. The service was okay. We had two servers were kind of reluctant to help us. They didn't even ask us for drink orders and then they would stop in the middle of cooking to talk to other staff AND their staff would loudly speak into their mics over our table which is kind of irritating and unprofessional. Our servers also didn't cook our meat long enough and said the basically pink colored short ribs were "ready to eat."...luckily we know how to cook meat ourselves so we basically served ourself the second half of our experience. It was a half hour wait (they don't take reservations) on a Friday night. They also have really small tables with barely enough room for everything on the table, but we also had a party of 5. We ordered the beef combo with brisket, ribeye, and short ribs. It came with steamed egg, bean paste soup, potato pancake, and dessert. The positive takeaways from this restaurant was the atmosphere inside the restaurant was really unique, their dessert, and their ribeye. Overall, I would probably not choose to come back here.

6guni8Rjf_17cA4tUzX-aA.text: This place is fabulous!   I have eaten at several Korean BBQ and this is definitely of top quality. Very traditional setting and interior. Very friendly and attentive service. Our server was Nana and I ADORE her! She was so nice and helpful at every step.   To begin with, she thoroughly explained the menu and gave her recommendations for meat and portion size. We chose the large beef combo meal ($89.99) as well as an order of premium pork belly ($21.99) (because that's our favorite BBQ meat!)   She was extra attentive at cooking our meat and made everything to absolute perfection! It was such an amazing experience, I will DEFINITELY be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat display case in front of the open kitchen where they slice and prepare the meat to order.
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The table setup when we arrived. The banchan was DELICIOUS!
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The classic and amazing brisket - part of the beef combo meal.

8QW-S8Mf1--oaBvokaO6AA.text: Hobak " which means pumpkin" according to my friend from Korea is amazing. It's a new upbeat kbbq place in town. They have various menu options but you can choose between a pork, beef or pork&beef family meal. The pork&beef family meal was able to feed 3 people. It comes with a soup, various side dishes, about 3 different beefs and 3 different porks. It's such a fun place to go with friends and just hangout/talk. I've been 2 times already and will probably go many more times! Definitely check it out!

mrGmERrgODZYxZ6euvrFGg.text: I guess this is the white people version of Korean BBQ. The food tasted okay. I would say probably one of the better Korean BBQ places in Vegas, but that's like saying you're valedictorian of summer school or special ed because most of the Korean BBQ places here suck. The price was a little high. Like I said, this is the white people version so its good for them. Not for someone who came from Korea.

M45Kv7L8Q6gTcf6iIGAR4A.text: This was my first experience with Korean barbecue. So I'm not sure if I just love this restaurant, or if I love Korean barbecue. But I did love this restaurant. My wife and I have been there twice now. I really like how all of the meats are cooked and you can have unlimited amounts of their side dishes. Also, even though we had never been to Korean barbecue, the staff was very nice and walked us through how the process worked. They answered all of our questions very thoroughly, without making us feel stupid. It was a very positive experience.

nsHx4-nPiYapvlkaoHWxUA.text: This place is a little hard to find.  The name on the sign is in Korean and in English it says Black Angus Korean BBQ .. Then in small print underneath.. Says Hobak, you won't be able to see until you are right in front of it.  They posted flags on the side walk to help but we didn't notice the flags until 2 U turns later.  We were warmly greeted and assorted Kim chi and pickles were set up prior to seating us.  Which was a plus since we were actually quite hungry.  We ordered the beef combo for two $54.. It was plenty of food for two people!! Quality of the meat was excellent! The aged short rib was my favorite, no sauce needed! Dessert was delicious as well, it's like an ice cream sandwich!  Service was excellent, multiple servers grilled our meat for us to our preference. They were friendly and professional.  We will definitely return with some friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Server grilling our brisket! Rib eye in the back

8elSx6VoNI5nxtW3co7kPw.text: Excellent as always. Tried the family combo this time at the recommendation of our server. It's was plenty of food and delicious. All the meats came marinated and the flavor was excellent. All the side items including the steamed egg, soybean paste soup, kimchi, salads were free refills.   The pork belly which was cooked last was burnt because our server/cook was helping others but but he offered to replace it. My husband tried to figure out how to turn down the flame but couldn't salvage it in time. We declined the offer for replacement because we were full from all the food already. He gave us extra ice cream to make up for it which of course made the kids very happy! Always look forward to coming to Las Vegas to stop by Hobak.

uXaKjSjR09ow8dp2osTdpQ.text: Very friendly staff. Food was amazing. We did the family dinner for 2 and there was way too much food. The only downside was the spicy beef. I'm used to spicy but wow it was intense, I couldn't really eat very much of it, and trust me I love spicy food. The wait to get is was a bit long, it was a Tuesday at 7pm and we waited over 35 min.

2EvFV3rcxiGaS-uUT88JqQ.text: Probably the tastiest Korean food Ive ha in Vegas. The food is plentiful and done right, high quality for sure. Cant wait to go back

YlZg-1l-IP2b6c2hRlc79Q.text: Great Service.  Who doesn't like misters while waiting outside.  They give you free icee while you wait.  THe food is not expensive and good and they cook for you.  Would come back!

c4MhVW7KPDwth4PDZHjdgw.text: Amazing! Heard such great things about this steakhouse. Unlimited sides and a great choice of meat selections. Will be back

qqgKDY1W3bXXiSCxhTt12A.text: Nice atmosphere, very friendly staff , it's not all you can eat but the quality of the meat was perfect . our server Angela was the best cook ever ! Oh yea they cook for you which is the best part . Don't miss out on the green tea ice cream at the end !

Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

auvdNBIAzYTkY4bxvww5dg.text: Well look what we have here. This KBBQ restaurant has been one crazy joyride. You get quality meat with quality service and the best damn experience you'll ever have. All the meat is cooked right in front of you like one of them teppanyaki places. They even put on a show. A fire show. If you're looking for a great place to spend time with your family and friends and have one hell of a meal, you need to come to Hobak. 100% satisfaction guaranteed.

F1fldN4wcWvJbm-wdl11GA.text: Hobak had a great selection of meats the prices were a little high and the service wasnt always there when you needed it but overall a good spot to eat at. The fried rice and corn were really good and so was the spicy pork belly.

6rBNDa5F0Oy2-RwTa5OLeA.text: I don't live in Nevada, but my friend took me to this restaurant when I visited. This is the best kbbq restaurant I went to in America. Even better than all the kbbq I went to in California. The meat was perfectly cooked and it was tasty. I really love the place and will definitely revisit whenever I have a chance to go back to Nevada.

e1t-gUxWxzNRQ4VmT7t-yw.text: my beautiful wife and i went here one time before we checked out some places in chinatown and had a pretty good time together eating some delicious barbecued meats. i don't really remember what we ate but what i do remember is that everything we had was really good and got me interested in going to more korean bbq places (thanks wife). i dunno if we cooked the meats completely because we both had to go to the bathroom pretty quickly after we ate, but regardless of whether everything was cooked correctly, it was all very delicious.  staff were attentive, waited us great, and didn't try doing any of that rando small talk i couldn't care less about. they were fast when we asked for the check as well.  the sujeonggwa is absolutely delicious as well.

ORoq4G9HJE3-wHfgng4tqA.text: This was by far the best KBBQ RESTAURANT I've had since I moved from LA.  Our server Kevin was simply the best. Me made sure that food was always cooked perfectly and even asked us how we liked our meats! Its almost like our own personal chef! Not only did he know how to cook the meat, but he always checked up on our table to ensure that we were having a great time.   Food is amazing, atmosphere is amazing and service is unparalleled!

FYfyMKuRbQnyKFM4K-Wocg.text: I was looking for a good Korean bbq place in Las Vegas and found this restaurant at yelp. We orders the dinner for two and it was amazing ! So much food . The marinated combo with beef ribs were my favorite. It was so good we went back the next week with friends and it was even more outstanding! I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good Korean bbq . They are open late too !

0Clo2v4WECJhDBFSLKtTqg.text: Very good non-ayce Korean BBQ.  If you've ever been to one of the kanghodong chains, this one resembles the feel and quality as well.  Tasty banchans, premium steak, fat pork bellies - I'm getting hungry all over again.  Service is top notch as they seem to come by every minute to cook the meat. A nice dessert at the end really capped the meal.

_Fg9QnlgYd5fP8mbvLcP_g.text: Best Korean BBQ I've had in Vegas! From the moment we walked in the door we knew we were in for a treat! The decor is great and really  transports you to another place. The service was great! Unlike other Korean BBQ hobak cooks all your food, they don't just get it started and leave. We got the large family meal 1. There were 3 adults and it was more than enough food, we even brought some home. At the end they brought out a delicious ice cream sandwich for everyone at no charge! It was delicious and gluten free so even my husband could eat it. Can't wait to go back!

nPmMJLgYOSk-dt-Qc_dRMw.text: This is the BEST Korean bbq I've ever had in my life. I'm not even exaggerating. 5 stars!

BJLCgiZxxWQW3KYZWYlzSg.text: I've been in Vegas for 4 days now and tired of the food on the strip. Found this GEM on Yelp and sooo glad I went. It's the best Korean BBQ place I've been to from taste, service, etc the place is on point with everything. We ordered the 2 person Hobak family combo and I ordered additional nangmyun. The nangmyun was soooo refreshing, and I have high standards for it bc my mom makes it the best. The combo comes with ricecake ice cream at the end and it's also a delicious treat! We got the green tea ice cream and it was amazing.  I felt like I was in Korea there at the restaurant, and the food we ordered was more than we could eat, although it's for 2 person family combo... It could have easily served 3 people plenty.  I would definitely come back here and recommend going, especially if you are having a Korean crave.

KvPEn04E5H1WibAIW83qNw.text: I am a Korean barbecue junkie. Unapologetically I may add. This was the best experience!  The food was delicious.  The meat was the most tender I've ever had. The sides were incredibly fresh. The service was perfect and the atmosphere was so fun. This is my new go to place. I cannot recommend it enough.   They have 17 of them in Korea but this is their first one in the states. Do yourself a favor and check it out!

E8VHUrvxD-iXGKpnxOMYIg.text: What a wonderful surprise. Absolutely great food and service. You guys deserve all the credit you get. What a wonderful meal.

AW0nYzW7XDStD-vSScWNRg.text: I've been to quite a few Korean BBQ places in New York and NJ, and none of them come close to Hobak. Upon walking in the industrial decor is gorgeous and gives you the impression of getting street food. They had free water and **slushies** available - perfect for a hot day!   The sides were plentiful and delicious. I love Korean food and tend to scrutinize the kimchi, and this is hands down the best kimchi I've ever had. We ordered the family package to celebrate my cousin's birthday and got an insane amount of food - all the different cuts of beef and pork you could dream of, veggies, steamed egg, tofu soup (my favorite!!), and more goodies I don't even remember.  Best of all, we didn't cook the food. Our extremely personable servers Jayden and Jiyu not only cooked the food for us, but took the time to explain what each cut was and what condiment went best with each one. They were not only accommodating to our large group, but friendly and funny, too! If the food wasn't already stellar, the service really blew our experience out of the water. The only negative about Hobak is that I don't live close enough to it!

Ah4KpMSmS5RCSwq1hsRuvw.text: Amazing Korean BBQ!! Among the best on the West Coast. Absolutely juicy and delicious! Highly recommended. Great service, atmosphere, and food.

LS9_Fb9XT-4-4HB8y4LQFQ.text: Best Korean barbecue in town. The meat is super good, and a very cool environment. You will smell like Korean barbecue for days after, so be careful what you wear

pde-5AAT-lYXixE3ntwylg.text: We came here for the entrees only. We ordered the beef soft tofu soup and the rice box. The soondubu was one of the best I've had here in Vegas. Rice box was delicious as well although a little on the smaller side. All of this came with the banchan which were all very good. The dessert ice cream is THE BEST. Very consistent quality.

fvtVt_SrsfMYmFwxiCIC_A.text: Perfectly marbled beef, smoky charcoal gas grill, no cork fee and servers that are friendly, efficient and overall great at their job in an open space venue??? Hobak isn't just the best Korean BBQ in Vegas, it trumps over LA, NYC and Seoul. The combo prices won't leave you overstuffed but you'll leave plenty satisfied. Sushi rice with beef is a pleasant surprise and every cut of beef and pork is phenomenal. Plus the green tea vanilla red bean ice cream sandwich at the end is focking ace.

b7HnNDlfJnGLjaa1s2HKYg.text: First time here and def was up to par. Before We sat down, the table was already set up with all the appetizers (kimchi, bokchoy, etc). I was impressed. They cook the meat in front of you as well & it's so cute of the mini grills in the table with the hood! We want to come back again and recommend it to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Yotf-G_64vXcVvoEDeLtXg.text: First time here and honestly was a 5 out of 5. Everything my friends and I ordered was amazing. The service was great also!!! They even cooked for us, which was really nice!

w_BUJyyrgBu4aPW_RgMKGA.text: Yum Yum great service they do all the cooking for you can't beat that, at the other places we've been to we've got a pay do the cooking I'm surprised they don't make us do the dishes.

82MOk20JLDn5dWXSU-nz8Q.text: The atmosphere, music, food and service is excellent.. Angela was my server and I was so impressed by her. She always made sure we were full of our sake drink along with enough side items . She also did an excellent job explaining all the foods and main dishes.. The meats were so juicy and tender as well. Great choice !

G7O5PuzSggCejCDuD73LLw.text: The service here is great. The servers here are super helpful and friendly. They'll cook your food perfectly.  If it's your first time for Korean BBQ they'll tell you what goes with what. Ventilation is better/more modern than most Korean BBQ places in vegas plus tooth brushes in the bathroom!  Helpings are pretty large. The small combo was able to feed my family of four. Make sure you save room for desert because the ice cream is delicious.

C_eWgtK8bDLhXKZLI1wjJA.text: The food was great. We ordered the beef combo for 2. It came with brisket, short rib and skirt steak and veggies. I loved the little cubes of sushi rice to place the cooked meat on with a dab of wasabi. The meal was very filling and with all that we ate I didn't feel like I ate too much. I would recommend this place to anyone who has never had Korean BBQ and is looking for a great experience.  I loved the rice cake ice cream for desert.  The wait staff was friendly and helpful.  Give it a shot if you are near by.

5aQkVN3JM97rhHSxxDLs6Q.text: The speed and quality of service here is amazing. The quality of food matches as well.  Came here with 4 friends and you just can't go wrong with bringing folks here for K BBQ

3IEvsyoODCo27BUxvS8b4Q.text: Our first Korean BBQ! Yooka and the rest of the staff were so kind to explain everything to us, and DANG it was all sooooo good!

GIuBwNwV5zU9uRP1LjXL9w.text: Best Korean restaurant and one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. The wait is super long because it's super good! They offer water and drinks while you wait and when it's time for you to sit down, water, appetizers and the char coal grill are ready. They have good combo menus so it took seconds for us to order. Julie has been a star the whole night! She took such good card us and was a great chef! Everything turned out ridiculously delicious. This place is awesome, the food, the atmosphere and the people... Can't get any better... Unless they develop a seafood menu. LOL.

3qG6E1IXICfqW_zqZU5I5w.text: Excellent food in a lively atmosphere. Music was upbeat but a little loud if you want a conversation. We had the beef family meal and enjoyed every bite. Lots of delicious sides including two salads, a soup, and egg dish, and pickles.

IxXcPdWZLc1y0tpJ6IPA5w.text: This place is awesome, my boyfriend and I have been coming since they have opened. Always excellent service, the staff is fast and friendly. Worth coming to eat, you always leave full and happy.

3AnPwhcblh03vvl4fVBaTQ.text: This is by far the best Korean BBQ I've been to in Las Vegas!! The employees treated us so nice and even cooked the food for all of us, a completely different experience than the others, if you visit this place, you gotta try the Angus Brisket!!!

G8bzoSEL8UnFV2BmNNFUhA.text: I was at another Korean BBQ spot down the street and it was really busy. The lady at the register was rude and it already rubbed me the wrong way. I put "Korean BBQ" into my maps and Hobak popped up. I called and the person who answered was really polite, said we didn't have to wait too long and so I headed out that way. When I got to Hobak the hostess was friendly, greeted us and said she would get my girlfriend and I sat in less than 2 min. The quality of the steak was amazing, and the side dishes were interesting but good! Our server Jayden was really sweet and took the time to cook our food! Overall, the experience was amazing and I would come back again soon.

I298c8rm5ZiYNNUVFevKVg.text: We always come here whenever we're in town and in the mood for Korean BBQ. It isn't really your typically Korean BBQ since your wait staff will do the bbqing for you, in front of you. But I suppose that keeps them in constant contact with you if you need their services quickly. Food is great, service is great.

JO6zPz9bN4HggC8tOmZXEA.text: This place surprised me. Thought it was just your typical Korean restaurant where you have to select your meat and cook it yourself.  Instead, you select your choice of meat and your waitstaff cooks for you. The amount of food was just perfect for 4 people (Small). The meat were all top grade! I highly recommend this place! It is so good and the staff are friendly and accommodating!

J4J3bqB-DjpGSGdIYHgHLw.text: Their meat was not good quality for their price. The ribeye was good, but everything else was too marinated and sweet to appreciate the flavor of the meat. The banchan is very limited and no effort, and bean sprout with sweet salad dressing is not a salad. They gave a lot of effort for customer service to make up for quality of the meat.

46YI59X5HZjqq9fIMV7y_Q.text: Love this place. The staff is awesome!! Food is spectacular and it's a lot of fun. The table is set when you come in. Pick what you want from the menu. It will be expertly cooked for you. You are in heaven . Just wonderful. Definitely going back!

8aMAykBF1plmnjnKuyPyJg.text: This is probably my new favorite place ever! The waiter Nana was so friendly and helpful! Nana told us what to order, gave us great recommendations! The display of the food was awesome! Would for sure come back!

3TYig1Frh5aP6X16K9c-Xw.text: Been craving korean food and haven't found a great place here in Vegas.  I honestly can't say anything bad about the food or service. It was spectacular. The meat is so tender and melts in your mouth.

0sooHchHExDdFiz0o_G_8w.text: Food was amazing! Love bringing all my friends here for good food and good atmosphere. Service was great, our server had always 'gotchu' us. Will def come back! Thumbs up*

SO5Ol0j0xuBU78C780InrQ.text: My Go-To Korean BBQ place!  Hobak is by far, my favorite place to go for Korean BBQ.  I take friends from out of town here, and my Mom asked if we could go here for Mother's Day, today!    You're never wrong going with the Family Combo, as they come with a nice stew and egg, along with a selection of meats.  Hobak is unique for me, in that the food is cooked for you.  This frees you up for conversation and drinks!  Most of the angus meat is not marinated and the ones that are, are usually spicy.    The only thing I don't like about this place is that you definitely smell like Korean BBQ after you leave!  There's plenty of parking in the plaza, and the atmosphere is very lively.  There are several TVs playing KPop music videos and KPop songs playing over the speakers.

7fa3o_aMtI1s3z6o8uVjtA.text: Excellent choice of meats. The service is great. You must have the soju as well. You will not leave this place hungry or disappointed. Must try!

nEddq5Clp6rEki3Vpk5cSw.text: Meat wise, the best Korean BBQ ever!!! I would have expected a little more variety in the side dishes (like other Korean BBQ places we frequent) - the soup was delicious and came with the family combo, as did the dessert  Service was very good and we never had to use the "call" button on the table  Definitely will be back to try different dishes

p5o6twSiWScrMK3hL5j_2w.text: We were a party of 10 therefore had to come right when they open or else we would have had a long wait. We had Eric as our server and he was outstanding. Give that guy a raise! We split our party into a few groups so we can order accordingly.   My group of 4 ordered the Family Combo 3 which includes Marinated Skirt Steak, Spicy Angus Boneless Short Rib, Aged Short Ribs, and we chose the Grilled Spicy Pork Belly.  Our combo includes a really good bean paste stew too. Does not seem like a lot food but it is. The four of us was well fed and not bloated full. For dessert, we had rice pop ice cream which was to die for. You had the choice of the following flavors, mint chocolate, chocolate, strawberry, cookie and creams, and vanilla.   I hope everybody will experience the best Hobak has to offer. Whenever my friends and I are in Vegas, we have to come and eat at Hobak. This probably has to be the best Korean BBQ place I have ever been to, hands down! Wished they opened a Hobak in San Jose, CA.

kvC2RFi5-ETG3CQsVKwyoA.text: Food was pretty good and service was excellent. I just didn't like the noisy environment where it's hard to enjoy food.  Servers run around pretty busily but always remembered to bring what we asked.  We ordered the pork small combo with one cold noodles. I was sharing with my wife and her mother. They both weigh about 100 and 110 lbs meaning they don't eat much. I would say portion was a bit on the small side

TrjtMt_K2oPsJkgLhdYJIg.text: Amazing food!  I think this may possibly be my favorite place to eat in Vegas.  Our meal was about $100.00 for two people with a four meat platter including dessert and generous tip.   Worth every penny.  Service is excellent.  Left there totally stuffed and already looking forward to the next visit.  This is a busy place, I would suggest trying to avoid peak eating times because it will be packed.

ImBmr7X5DDSmYvAhT8eXKg.text: Hands down the best KBBQ I've ever had in my entire life. I cannot leave Vegas without a pit stop at Hobak. We always get the Beef combo...and its sooo filling. They provide a ton of sides and even tho everything is really good... my highlights from Hobak include:  The free snacks while you wait (popcorn or slushie drink - depending on season?) Potato pancake - we always ask for extras Salad - the dressing is bombbbb BRISKET - we always ask for extra of the sushi rice... because the brisket on sushi rice!? GENIUS. I think I could eat just pure brisket there as its my fave of the meats.  Ice cream rice cake sandwich - comes with the combos. SOOO GOOD and refreshing.   ok. I'm salivating as I type this. someone please open one of these in So Cal!

1CUeLXH8LLqkrSpeF5EJhg.text: Not AYCE, but the meat quality is amazing and their portions are more than enough for 2 people .. definitely worth the price!

Xuj2sqC2cEtL3f5lJX4p-Q.text: If you want to experience Korean BBQ and traditional Korean atmosphere, I would definitely recommend here. This place is set up really nicely and the decorations make you think of Korea street.   When we arrived around 6pm and already there were people waiting for table. I think it was worth to wait. We ordered Habak family combo and it was pretty good. Side dishes was a little bland but very unique and memorable. Service was slow but friendly.

cjc90VYVHfU1KO-Om85_jQ.text: Hobak offers a great selection of Korean BBQ and side dishes. My gf and I tried the combination but found the beef had a peculiar aftertaste.   The amount of food was on lower end of the spectrum for how much you pay. Usually this isn't an issue where the quality offsets the quantity but the aftertaste just ruined it for us.   I particularly enjoyed the bento.   If the aftertaste wasn't there, I would have easily given this place 5 stars.

4PiuJgNoBpOki3cRNkUBZw.text: The best Korean BBQ spot in Las Vegas!! The food delicious and the meat quality is premium. Also, their customer service is amazing! Nana & Mason always makes us feel so welcomed! You won't regret your experience here!

9wmPMG7RV0hN9auB_cqkFw.text: Place was amazing!!  Best service I have had in a long time, especially for Asian restaurant. Everyone was friendly and super helpful. But the food was the best. Had a combo meal, cold spicy noodles and hot soft tofu soup. Everything wasn't just good, everything was great! And they finish you off with dessert when you get the combo. Coolest ice cream sandwich ever.   Def a new fav. But get there early. The line builds up quick and it's not a fast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They give you these cool bibs.

KT32-hu_ykA4jGRRBEYeCA.text: This place is the shit. Quality food guaranteed. Nana gives you the best customer service that you expect. Her staff here is phenomenal..!!!!!

ejG2uTH5XptXBpQGvuRHEg.text: Great food and atmosphere.  Best casual korean bbq in Vegas! Our first visit was good but our second visit was great!

L_WdGCsS243MjibyAGu6Gg.text: Modern take on Korean barbecue. Restaurant is set in a comfortable yet trendy environment, so your non Asian friends will also feel welcomed.  Great service..really good meat quality...sides were ok.  They grill every meat dish for you.  You don't have to do anything but pick which piece you want to eat.   The beef dishes are all good. The kalbi is good quality so you don't have to tire your jaw out.  The pork items are good also..but definitely try the kalbi!  Sides are decent but just few choices.

aaYkix6-YAKvOSCEYPjyBQ.text: I've been to Hobak twice now.  Both of the time has been great experience! Good service and good food!  That's enough for me ;)  It is a good place to go with your families and friends to enjoy some meat!!!  There are three combos that include dessert With small(2-3ppl) and large(3-5ppl) sizes.  Beef, Pork, and Hobak combo. If you like beef and pork get the hobak combo!

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy pork-part of hobak family combo

jyXijnaVWDVF1nA7vEvb5Q.text: Good food. Good friendly service.  We went on Sunday June 25, 2017 at 1 PM and there was no wait with a few empty tables.

E_rIvuncAx4JX40nQ2kFEw.text: One of my favorite Korean BBQ place in LasVegas. I love their dessert they give at the end too:)

tKBt1hxNUhkWywPbZeINeA.text: The Best Korean Barbecue in Las Vegas?  No.  The best KBBQ in Los Angeles or Vegas.  I wish they had built this place in Los Angeles.  It would be my favorite place after just one visit.  I would not be surprised if they opened another.  They have a formula for success from my initial visit.  Brought a group of 9 and everyone agreed that this was one of the best KBBQ meals.  The dining room has a modern feel.  With tall thin mobile hoods over the grills.  Clean and spacious.  They did a nice job of making it feel good inside.  The Angus beef was better than anything I have had in L.A.  I not talking AYCE.  I comparing to Kang Ho Dong, Quarters, Parks.  We had a large party of 9 so ordered 2 large beef combo with all four choices.  The ribeye steak was incredibly marbled and flavorful.  We ordered another.  The beef was very high quality.  Marinades added to the flavor instead of over powering the beef.  Side dishes were fresh and quickly refilled.  The beef is cut as ordered and this adds to the fresh taste.  NOTE - It is not uncommon for KBBQ places to open a restaurant with great meat and the quality declines with time.  I hope that is not the case for this place.  I plan on coming back.  Service was quick and attentive.  Requests are quickly radioed by your server and things come out fast.  Like many premium places, they want to cook your meat.   The dessert sealed the deal.  It has a crunchy rice cracker filled with ice cream.  Very light but tasty.  Bathrooms are super clean.  Always a good sign.  They have toothbrushes for you guys on a date.  This was one of the best KBBQ meals that I have had...ever.  It was really that good  Note.  They currently have free corkage for wine.  That is very cool

photos.caption: Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hobak Korean BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UCGfY7xhVexqgcxIOycpbQ.text: My first time here. My daughter graduated from UNLV today and wanted Korean BBQ for her celebration lunch. I found this place with great reviews so we thought we'd try it. We were not disappointed.  Great atmosphere.  Great food. Great experience. Great customer service. We had the large family meal for 4 of us and had leftovers. I even got a free wine drink for Mother's Day... a day early. Definitely recommend.  Definitely go back.

D6VNDo7phmlEjRSBmIl-vw.text: If I had  though that anything could not have gotten better after yesterday's visit at Gangnam BBQ then I was 100% wrong. Me and my family came to the restaurant early in the day for lunch and we're not dissapointed.  This is the best korean bbq spot I have ever been to in the United States. This place was absolutely incredible. Everything from the Banchan to the  to the  was absolutely delicious. There is no better spot in the US to me so far.   The ambience is very good for everybody. People who are not korean will get a nice look into korean culture and feel authentic. Also the Korean natives will get a flash from the past with a decor to match a 1940s korean architecture.   The meat is absolutely incredible. The quality of food is just so good and literally every cut of meat is tender and delicious. I can't describe it more because it was just all so good that's all there is to say.   The service was beyond incredible. The workers pretty much slave over your bbq pit and cook everything for you themselves and are more than willing to oblige any request that you have.   If that isn't enough the food is ridiculously cheap. Me and my party of 5 ordered a meal meant for only 2 ppl and we were so full by the end of the meal. This place is a must go to if you like kbbq. GO EAT HERE   Edit:  Something else worth note they have a nice little freshen up station in the bathrooms that includes mouthwash and toothpaste and lots of disposable toothbrushes. This may sound weird but actually in Korea most people like to brush their teeth after every meal. Also if you're on a date here it definitely doesn't hurt to brush after a meal like that lol.   PEACE
